Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Debtor or Secondary Obligor May Waive Right to Notification of Disposition Only after Default (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-624)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 
 Wells Fargo must not allow a borrower or guarantor to waive the right to notification of disposition of collateral, except by an agreement to that effect entered into and authenticated only after default.

 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans

 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC

Title: PSDR - Duty to notify of forgeries, alterations and statement errors - Sender's Duty to Exercise Ordinary Care to Discover Payment Order Error within Reasonable Time (U.C.C. ¬ß 4A-205)
Summary:
MCR 1100
 
 Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY. 
 
 As a sending bank of a payment order, Wells Fargo must exercise the duty of ordinary care to discover errors with respect to the payment order and notify the receiving bank of discovered errors in a reasonable time, not exceeding 90 days after the receiving bank's notification of receipt.

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Transferability and Assignment - Required Contract Provisions and Disclosures
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Transferability and Assignment - Required Contract Provisions and Disclosures
 
 MCR0001016
 
 Covered States: AR, CA, DC, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, KS, LA, MD, ME, NY, OK, PA, TN, TX, UT, WI, WV 
 
 When engaged in the transfer or assignment of accounts and mortgages, Wells Fargo must provide state-specific disclosures or, in the case of mortgages, notices to the mortgagor with the required RESPA information. The written notice or disclosure must be provided to certain individuals and through prescribed delivery methods and timeframes.

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices and Acknowledgments - Waivers
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices and Acknowledgments ‚Äì Waivers
 
 MCR0001007
 
 Covered States: AK, CA, CO, DC, DE, GA, IA, ID, IL, IN, LA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, ND, NJ, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, UT, VA, WA, WI, WV.
 
 REQUIREMENT I 
 
 When providing a loan or offering certain products or services listed below, Wells Fargo must not require the consumer to waive any available legal remedies, claims, defenses, or rights of action against Wells Fargo. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other 
 9. Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 12. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 13. Other Services - Retail Broker Dealer - Services, Tools, & Apps
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.150; Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2986.3(b); Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22370(j)(1); Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22370(k); Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 4302; Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 4302; Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-684(3); Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3404(4); Idaho Code ¬ß 28-41-106(1)(4)(5); Idaho Code ¬ß 48-1007(4); 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 675/9; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-1-107(1); Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 1-107(1), (4); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 492.114(d); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 325G.16(2)(e); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 550.42(1), (2); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408.560(5); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-79(e); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1321.41(G); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 1-107; Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 83.670(3); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b)(4); 42 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 8103(e); 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6124; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-5(c); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-5(c); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 31-5.2-8; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 31-5.4-4(a),(c) and (d); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 224.79(3)(f); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.407(4); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.419(1)(b); W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-4-109(5)(G).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Lending 
 
 (a) When brokering a consumer loan, Wells Fargo must assume additional legal duties that cannot be waived or modified by the consumer, including: acting in good faith and fair dealing; safeguarding and accounting for funds handled for the borrower; following reasonable and lawful instructions from the borrower; exercising reasonable skill, care, and diligence; timely and clearly disclosing material information that might reasonably borrower‚Äôs rights and interests, including how much compensation Wells Fargo would receive as a broker from any of the loan options offered to the borrower; and making reasonable efforts to secure a loan advantageous to the borrower in light of all circumstances including rates, charges, and repayment terms. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 10-303-A.
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must not include contract terms containing a confession of judgment by the consumer or borrower, or authorizing any power of attorney to confess judgment on behalf of the consumer or borrower. (NJ, MD) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:3B-13; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-1023(b)(2).
 
 2. Debt Collection 
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must not include contract terms that require a consumer debtor to waive his or her right to notice or an opportunity to be heard before Wells Fargo commences an action for seizure of the consumer debtor‚Äôs property securing the transaction (i.e., replevin). (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 13-1303(b).
 
 
 REQUIREMENT II
 
 In addition, with respect to the services and products below, Wells Fargo must allow a consumer to waive certain notices, requirements, applicable waiting periods provided that such waiver by the consumer is made in writing.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other 
 9. Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 12. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 13. Other Services - Retail Broker Dealer - Services, Tools, & App
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 D.C. Code ¬ß 28-3803(2); La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 13:4108.2(A); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 6-l(t); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-7(e); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 22-3-1360; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-107.
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Lending ‚Äì Waiver of Waiting Periods
 
 In a consumer loan transaction, Wells Fargo must allow a consumer to modify or waive the applicable waiting period between the delivery of disclosures and consummation of the loan, if the consumer provides a signed, written statement explaining that the extension of credit is necessary to meet a bona fide financial emergency. (OH, OK) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(D)(2); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-7(e); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-1(c)(1)(C); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-310(6).
 
 2. Debt Collection
 
 (a) Where a consumer has defaulted on a credit transaction, Wells Fargo must not enforce a security interest on a consumer‚Äôs goods without providing required notices and opportunities to cure such defaults unless the consumer has voluntarily surrendered possession of such goods as collateral. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-5-111.
 
 (b) In a contract for mortgage on a homestead property (more than 40 acres) that is executed after June 30, 1991, and which is not a purchase money contract, Wells Fargo must include the following statement printed in a conspicuous manner: ‚ÄúI understand that homestead property is in many cases protected from the claims of creditors and exempt from judicial sale and that, by signing this contract, I voluntarily give up my right to this protection for this property with respect to claims based upon this contract.‚Äù Such statement must be separately signed and dated by the mortgagor indicating that he or she is specifically and knowingly waiving the homestead exemption. (ND) N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 47-18-05.1.
 
 3. Class Action Waivers
 
 (a) In a contract for any open-end or closed-end consumer transaction contract, Wells Fargo must not require the debtor to waive his or her right to engage or participate in a class action lawsuit against Wells Fargo regarding such consumer transaction contract, unless Wells Fargo discloses the waiver to the debtor in writing. If the contract was entered into after August 1, 2006, Wells Fargo must provide such disclosure in a bold type font and all capital letters. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-3-104; Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-4-105.

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Plain Language
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Plain Language
 
 MCR: 0001021
 
 Covered States: CT, KS, MA, ME, MN, MT, ND, NJ, NY, PA, PR, WA.
 
 When offering the consumer contracts, products, or services listed below, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, terms and conditions, and other information in plain language that is clear and readable. Wells Fargo must also comply with state-specific timing requirements for each disclosure, notice, term, and condition. Additionally, Wells Fargo must comply with state-specific formatting requirements.
 
 1. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts
 2. Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 3. Deposit / Money Movement - Wire Transfer
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 38a-297(a); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-152(a),(b); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-152(a),(c); Me. Stat. tit. 10, ¬ß 1124(1); Mont. Admin. R. 2.59.118(3); N.D. Admin. Code 13-05-01-04; N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 34.6(a); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 325G.3; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-2; 73 Pa. Stat. ¬ß 2205(a)(b)(1)-(9); PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(A); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-613(3).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Consumer Lending:
 
 (a) When providing a consumer credit transaction, Wells Fargo must provide notice to the consumer that he or she should not sign the agreement before reading it, and that he or she is entitled to a copy of the agreement and to prepay the unpaid balance at any time without penalty. (KS) (Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-202). Wells Fargo does not have to comply with this requirement if it is offering an open line of credit. (KS) (Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-202). 
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide its customers with certain clear and specific disclosures that must be made in a single, separate document, in plain language, and with captioned subdivisions for the information to be disclosed. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 90.3.
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must provide its customers with certain disclosure summaries on a one page notice separate from any other documents. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(1).
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must disclose interest rate, timing, and loan amount information when issuing loans and notes. In addition, if the contract provides for the possibility of an increase or decrease in the rate (or both), that fact must be clearly described in plain language, in at least 8-point bold face type on the face of the contract. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-32(b); (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:9A-53.4.
 
 (e) Wells Fargo must comply with the Truth in Lending Act ("TILA") (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-32(d) (PA) 73 Pa. Stat. ¬ß 2205(2); PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(B).
 
 (f) When displaying promotional materials, Wells Fargo must not use techniques, signs, abbreviations, or acronyms that create a wrong image or impression in the public (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(E).
 
 2. Deposit Money Movement
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide particular disclosures in the terms and conditions of electronic fund transfers, before a consumer contracts for an electronic fund transfer. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 167B, ¬ß 8(a).
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must inform its customers of the time periods for the availability of funds and with the hours Wells Fargo will be open. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 34.6(a).
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must also convey disclosures when servicing trust accounts. (PR) PR Reglamento 5766 ¬ß 20. 
 
 3. Lending Products - Consumer Other Loans/Lines (Mortgage Loans for Residential Property)
 
 (a) If Wells Fargo does not offer interim financing, then it must disclose that to the customer in writing at the time the mortgage loan application is filed. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 49-6a(b).
 
 4. Insurance Products
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide a readable policy when selling insurance and it must provide a certification that states that the policy meets the minimum reading ease score on the test used. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 38a-297(a)-(b).

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Cross-collateralization and Dragnet Clauses
PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Typesize, Font and Color - Disclosures Easily Readable, Readily Noticeable
PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Single Document - Tying Arrangements
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Single Document - Tying Arrangements
 
 MCR 1023
 
 Covered states: VA
 
 When offering the below products and services, before executing an agreement for those products and services, Wells Fargo must provide a document clearly and conspicuously explaining that the consumer is not required to use services from Wells Fargo bank or its subsidiaries, affiliates, or other service entities. When referring a consumer to the products or services listed below, Wells Fargo must provide a document clearly and conspicuously explaining that the consumer is not required to use the products or services listed below. 
 
 1. Deposit / Money Movement - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 3. Other Services - Retail Broker Dealer - Services, Tools, & Apps
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-888(C)(2) and (3)

Title: PSDR - Duty to Notify of Forgeries, Alterations and Statement Errors - Customer Must Examine Statement of Account with Reasonable Promptness, & Promptly Notify Bank of Unauthorized Payment (U.C.C. ¬ß 4-406)
Summary:

 When Wells Fargo provides a deposit account statement showing payment of items, the burden is placed on the customer to exercise reasonable promptness in examining the statement and items to determine whether any payment was not authorized and if so, promptly notify the bank.

Title: PSDR - Retail Leases - Liquidated Damages Clause Must Provide Reasonable Amount or Formula (U.C.C. ¬ß 2A-504)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 When providing a retail lease with a liquidated damages clause, Wells Fargo must set forth in the lease agreement an amount or formula of damages meeting statutory requirements. In the absence of including statutorily required language in the lease, Wells Fargo may pursue other statutory remedy. 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.12.504(a), (b); Ala. Code ¬ß 7-2A-504(1), (2); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-2A-504(1), (2); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-2A504(A), (B); Cal. Com. Code ¬ß10504(a), (b); Colo. Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß11-2A-504(1), (2); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 490:2A-504(a), (b); Iowa Code ¬ß 554.13504(1), (2); Idaho Code ¬ß28-12-504(1), (2); 810 Ill. Comp. Stat.5/2A-504(1), (2); Ind. Code ¬ß26-1-2.1-504(1), (2); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß84-2a-504(1), (2); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß355.2A-504(1), (2); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 106, ¬ß 2A-504(1), (2); Md. Code Ann.,Com. Law ¬ß2A-504(1), (2); Me. Stat. ¬ß 382-A:2A-504(1), (2); N.J.Stat.Ann. ¬ß12A:2A-504(1), (2); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß55-2A-504(1), (2); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 104A.2504(1), (2); N.Y. U.C.C. Law ¬ß2-A-504(1), (2); Ohio Rev. Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Single Document - Deposit and/or Share Account Designations
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Single Document - Deposit and/or Share Account Designations
 Covered States: NC
 
 When establishing a deposit account payable on death to a beneficiary, including the account types listed below, the account holder must sign a separate statement. Within this statement, the account holder must acknowledge that the account holder can withdraw money from the deposit account during his or her life, the account holder can change the beneficiary for the account at any time, when the account holder dies, any money remaining in the account will be given to the beneficiary, and the money in the account money will not be given to the account holder‚Äôs heirs or controlled by the account holder‚Äôs will.
 
 1. Deposit / Money Movement - Cash Management Accounts
 2. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts
 3. Deposit / Money Movement - Multi Currency Accounts
 4. Deposit / Money Movement - Retirement Accounts; and
  5. Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citation:
 N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 53C-6-7(a)(8)

Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Prescribed Language - Pre-Application, Application and Processing Disclosures and Notices
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Disclosures - Prescribed Language - Pre-Application, Application and Processing Disclosures and Notices
 
 MCR0001096
 
 Covered States: CA, CO, DC, GA, HI, MA, MD, MI, MN, NE, NM, NY, PA, SC, TX, VT, WV
 
 When engaged in the processing and receipt of applications for the below consumer products and services, Wells Fargo must provide state-specific disclosures and notices that contain certain language. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 4. Deposit / Money Movement - Online Money Movement
 5. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts
 6. Deposit / Money Movement - Debit Card
 7. Deposit / Money Movement - Prepaid Cards
 8. Deposit / Money Movement - Retirements Accounts
 9. Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 80.4(a); 73 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2245(a)(3)
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 (a) For loans made under the Pilot Program for Increased Access to Responsible Small Dollar Loans, Wells Fargo must provide to borrowers a disclosure expressly saying so. (CA) Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1612(b)
 
 (b) In the alternative to a customer‚Äôs recorded acknowledgment of having received information about the statute‚Äôs refund policy, Wells Fargo must provide a notice with language expressing that the service being offered is ‚Äúsatisfaction guaranteed,‚Äù a ‚Äúno risk guarantee‚Äù or similar. (PA) 73 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2245(a)(3)
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must disclose all of the medical conditions that will be inquired about in connection with consumer credit insurance. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 34-29-165(1-2)
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) Before accepting an application for a loan, Wells Fargo must give the loan applicant a disclosure with language that explains the terms of the loan sought by the applicant and advising the applicant to check with their legal advisor and other lien holders for the existence of prior liens with acceleration clauses. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 80.4(a), (c)
 
 (b) For certain home loans, Wells Fargo must provide the debtor with a disclosure that states the debtor may lose his or her home and any money that has been put into it. The disclosure must have the same or similar language to the example found in the state statute. (CA, CO, NM, PA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(k)(1); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-103(1)(a); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21A-5(E); 63 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 456.512(A). In several states, this applies to covered loans. (CA, CO, PA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(k)(1); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-103(1)(a); 63 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 456.512(A). Specifically for high-cost home loans in NM, Wells Fargo must also include language stating that the borrower could obtain a lower cost loan and should shop around. N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21A-5(E)
 
 (c) For red flags, Wells Fargo must distribute to consumers a disclosure that contains a list of possible lending abuses and violations. The red flag warning disclosure notice is provided in the state statute. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, Appendix Form 1
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must provide an informational notice describing what a foreclosure is to the public, upon request, and to all applicants securing a loan with residential property. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 667-41(b)
 
 (e) For mortgages with a balloon payment feature, Wells Fargo must give to the consumer a disclosure explaining what a balloon payment is. (MD, NY) Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(B)(1); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß¬ß 80.4(b), 80.11(4). In NY, Wells Fargo must also disclose the details about whether the loan is divided in one or two terms. N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß¬ß 80.11(4), 82.10(c)(4)
 
 (f) Wells Fargo must expressly disclose to borrowers when the mortgage loan does not provide for the establishment of an escrow account from which the borrowers‚Äô property taxes and homeowner‚Äôs insurance will be paid. (MD) Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(B)(2)
 
 (g) With respect to binding arbitration provisions in mortgage loans, Wells Fargo must provide to the borrower a disclosure that says the mortgage loan he or she has applied for contains a mandatory binding arbitration provision. (MD) Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(B)(3)
 
 (h) In a notice to inquirers or applicants, Wells Fargo must include language stating that loan inquirers or applicants have the right to submit a written application for a mortgage loan or a home improvement loan or to request information on the foregoing. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 445.1605(1)
 
 (i) For PACE loans, Wells Fargo must provide to applicants a list of the associated risks. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 216C.437(27)(a)
 
 (j) Wells Fargo must provide a notice with language that the borrower should consider financial counseling or consult with the appropriate advisors. (NY, WV) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 6-m(2)(j); W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-19-11(1.a)
 
 (k) All Wells Fargo applications must have language saying that it is a crime to provide false information. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3
 
 (l) For any extension of credit, Wells Fargo must provide a notice with a statement that the borrower is not required to sign a confession of judgment. (TX) Tex. Const. Art. XVI, ¬ß 50(g)
 
 (m) In advertisements and solicitations of leads, Wells Fargo must include language stating that it is a loan solicitation and that information received will be shared with third parties. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 8, ¬ß 2220a
 
 (n) In the alternative to a customer‚Äôs recorded acknowledgment of having received information about the statute‚Äôs refund policy, Wells Fargo must provide a notice with language expressing that the service being offered is ‚Äúsatisfaction guaranteed,‚Äù a ‚Äúno risk guarantee‚Äù or similar. (PA) 73 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2245(a)(3)
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 
 a. Wells Fargo must give to applicants a disclosure with language identifying the annual percentage rate or variable rate index and spread, other fees, annual fees, transaction fees, and the date the finance charge begins to accrue on a transaction. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 325G.42(1), (3)
 
 b. In the alternative to a customer‚Äôs recorded acknowledgment of having received information about the statute‚Äôs refund policy, Wells Fargo must provide a notice with language expressing that the service being offered is ‚Äúsatisfaction guaranteed,‚Äù a ‚Äúno risk guarantee‚Äù or similar. (PA) 73 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2245(a)(3)
 
 c. Wells Fargo must disclose all of the medical conditions that will be inquired about in connection with consumer credit insurance. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 34-29-165(1-2)
 
 4. Deposit / Money Movement - Online Money Movement
 
 a. Wells Fargo must provide to customers the terms and conditions of electronic fund transfers involving a consumer‚Äôs account, including language that the consumer may not stop payment of electronic fund transfers. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 167B, ¬ß 8(a)(16)
 
 b. Wells Fargo must give all consumers initiating an electronic funds transfer a notice if a surcharge will be imposed. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 8-157.01(4) 
 
 c. In the alternative to a customer‚Äôs recorded acknowledgment of having received information about the statute‚Äôs refund policy, Wells Fargo must provide a notice with language expressing that the service being offered is ‚Äúsatisfaction guaranteed,‚Äù a ‚Äúno risk guarantee‚Äù or similar. (PA) 73 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2245(a)(3)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Debtor May Waive Right of Redemption after Default (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-624 State Variation)
PSDR - Disclosures - Timing - Closing or Servicing
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AR, CA, FL, KS, MA, ME, MT, NE, NY, OK, OR, RI, VA, VT, WA, WV
 
 Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information to customers, borrowers, and card users at specific stages of a loan or credit agreement, including origination, modification, closing and transfer of servicing rights.
 
 1. Consumer Lending
 2. Loan Servicing ‚Äì no specific product 
 3. Residential Mortgage Loan Servicing
 4. Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Deposit /Money Movement ‚Äì Payment Services
 6. Other Services - Special Services - Safekeeping Services
 7. Insurance products
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Consumer Lending:
 
 (a) When providing consumer loans, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures to a borrower, including:
 
 (i) Requisite information regarding certain charges at least thirty days before the borrower signs the written loan agreement (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2954.11(e)(1), (f)(1); and
 
 (ii) a mortgagor‚Äôs obligations with respect to paying the real estate taxes and vacating the home, six months before the end of a loan term. (WV) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-19-11(11.4)
 
 (b) In order to avoid compliance failure related to residential mortgage loans, Wells Fargo must, within thirty days of the loan closing and before receiving any notice of the compliance failure, make appropriate restitution to the borrower and appropriate adjustment to the loan, or within sixty days of the loan closing and before to receiving any notice of the compliance failure, notify the borrower of the compliance failure and make appropriate restitution to the borrower and appropriate adjustments to the loan, if the failure was unintentional. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 8-506(6)(F)
 
 (c) When offering a consumer credit transaction, Wells Fargo must not obligate a customer as a cosigner, unless, before or at the time of signing a separate agreement or the first extension of credit, it provides a written notice to the customer containing certain notices required to be given to the debtor. (ME, NE) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-206(1); Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 45-1053(1)
 
 (d) At the time a loan or line of credit is made, Wells Fargo must deliver to the borrower:
 
 (i) a statement in English showing in clear and distinct terms the amount and date of the loan and the date of its maturity; the nature of the security, if any, for the loan; the name and address of the borrower and of the licensee; and the rate of interest charged. (OR, FL, MT, RI, VA, VT) Or. Admin. R. 441-730-0240(1)(3)(5); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 516.15(1); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-5-303(1); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-13; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1524(D); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 8, ¬ß 2232a(a); and
 
 (ii) a statement that payment in any amount may be made in advance at any time, and a detailed schedule showing the manner in which the proceeds of the loan have been disbursed or are to be disbursed on behalf of the borrower. (OR, MT) Or. Admin. R. 441-730-0240(1)(3)(5); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-5-303(1)
 
 (e) If the servicing for the loan is subject to sale, transfer, or assignment, Wells Fargo must:
 
 (i) disclose that fact in writing at the time of or before loan closing and must also disclose in the same writing that when such servicing is sold, transferred, or assigned, the purchasing servicing agent is required to provide notification to the customer (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.148.030(1); and
 
 (ii) if Wells Fargo, which has not provided the notice, consolidates with, merges with, or is acquired by another institution, and later loan servicing becomes subject to sale, transfer, or assignment, Wells Fargo must within thirty days of the transaction make the disclosure in writing to the customer. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.148.030(1)
 
 (f) If the annual percentage rate at the time of completion varies from the annual percentage rate originally disclosed, Wells Fargo must disclose all the changed terms no later than completion or settlement. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(5)(c)
 
 (g) When providing consumer loans and credit, in order to avoid liability, Wells Fargo must, within fifteen days after discovering an error, and before the institution of an action or the receipt of the written notice of the error, notify the person concerned of the error and make corrections. (KS, ME) Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-5-203(2); Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 5-201(7)
 
 (h) When entering into a consumer credit transaction requiring certain disclosures regarding interest determined on a per diem basis, Wells Fargo must make disclosures based on information actually known at the time of disclosure. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 7(c)
 
 2. Loan Servicing ‚Äì no specific product 
 
 (a) When assuming the role of loan servicer under any loan, Wells Fargo must provide to the borrower a copy of the written and signed loan brokerage agreement at the time the borrower signs it. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 45-191.04(1)
 
 3. Residential Mortgage Loan Servicing
 
 (a) When assuming the role of loan servicer under a residential mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must send notice to the customer within ten days after the sale of the servicing of a loan, and provide certain disclosures, loan information and a coupon or payment book to the customer. (AK) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 18.56.135(a), (b) 
 
 (b) When acting as loan servicer under a residential mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must, within fifteen days of a written request for information from a customer, provide a written response containing requisite information. (AK) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 18.56.135(c)
 
 4. Consumer Credit Cards
 
 (a) When issuing a credit card to a customer that imposes issuance or activity fees, Wells Fargo must make certain written disclosures, within thirty days after the customer requests the card and no later than the delivery of the card. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-2(d)(2)
 
 5. Deposit /Money Movement ‚Äì Payment Services
 
 (a) When acting as a payment servicer, and if it is the policy of Wells Fargo to give cash refunds for payments made by cash, Wells Fargo must, at the time the transaction is completed, make certain clear and conspicuous disclosures. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 167B, ¬ß 15
 
 6. Other Services - Special Services - Safekeeping Services
 
 (a) When providing a safe deposit box for rent, Wells Fargo must provide to the customer at the time of rental a copy of the safe deposit box rental agreement, which must include certain notices in at least eight point bold type. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 338(1) - (2)
 
 7. Insurance products
 
 (a) When providing loans featuring insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must include a certain terms in any group credit insurance policy. (AR) 054-00-012 Ark. Code R. ¬ß 3(3.7)
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must not use a method of billing insurance charges to a customer on closed-end transactions that creates a balloon payment at the end of the credit transaction or extends the credit transaction‚Äôs maturity date, unless the method is specifically disclosed at the time of the origination of the credit agreement and the customer specifically agreed to it. (AR) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-101-106(c)

Title: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Mobile Homes
Summary:
Covered States: FL
 When seller or holder under a Retail Installment Contract (RIC) for a mobile home purchase that provides for a finance charge at an adjustable rate, Wells Fargo must make certain required disclosures and adhere to limits on adjustments to the rate of the finance charge. 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 (a) When a RIC for a mobile home purchase provides for a finance charge at an adjustable rate, Wells Fargo, as seller, must: 
 (i) compute the finance charge on the unpaid balance based on a statutory ‚Äúindex value.‚Äù (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.125(1),(2). The finance charge rate must be adjusted in certain prescribed time limitations and within specified maximum percentage point changes; (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.125(3)-(5)
 (ii) if previously agreed with the buyer in writing, adhere to any limitations or waiver of adjustments as applicable, and apply the results of any adjustments to a subsequent installment payment; (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.125(6)-(8)
 (iii) at least 35 days in advance of an adjustment, send the buyer written notice of required disclosures; (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.125(9), (10)
 (iv) not apply the refund credit prescribed by statute where the RIC is a simple interest contract. (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.125(11)
 (b) When the unpaid balance of a RIC for a mobile home purchase has been extended, deferred, renewed or restated, Wells Fargo, as holder, may compute the finance charge in accordance with statute. (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.125(12)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Fee Disclosures and Refundability - Loans by Licensees
Summary:
Covered States: CA, DE, FL, IL, PA, TX, WA, WY
 When providing consumer loans, Wells Fargo as a state-licensed mortgage broker or loan originator must disclose certain costs, fees, and terms for refunds; and must execute a written loan brokerage agreement and provide a borrower information document.
 1. Consumer Real Estate Loans;
 2. Consumer Other Loans; 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Real Estate Loans ‚Äì When acting as a broker or originator, Wells Fargo: 
 (a) must provide a good faith estimate of costs that may be incurred in arranging for the loan. (FL, IL, WA, WY) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-40.008(3)(a); Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1110; Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 110.215; Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 31.04.102(2); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-114(a)(iii) 
 
 (b) must not include premiums for life, health, or loss-of-income insurance in determining the loan origination fee, if Wells Fargo discloses the premium cost and that the insurance need not be purchased from Wells Fargo. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-40.008(4)(a)
  
 (c) must disclose the name of the third party receiving certain charges including a rate lock fee (DE) 5-2200-2203 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 5.0(5.1); 5-2200-2203 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 5.0(5.2-5.20). If a valid commitment or closing does not occur, then Wells Fargo must refund the charges, unless the nonoccurrence was due to the borrower‚Äôs fault. (CA, PA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 50203(b); 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(10) 
 
 (d) must execute a written loan brokerage agreement containing certain specified terms before the execution of a completed residential mortgage loan application. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1010(a)-(e), (h)
 
 (e) must provide a borrower an information document prior to execution of a residential mortgage loan application, which must include certain specified terms. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1110
 
 2. Consumer Other Loans
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must disclose certain items before the loan transaction is consummated. (IL) 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 670/16 
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must notify the consumer in the contract of its intention to collect default charges. (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 41.3(d)
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must furnish to the consumer a statement setting forth certain specified details about the loan. (PA) 7 Pa. Stat. ¬ß 6215
 
 (d) In a secured consumer installment loan contract or signature loan contract, Wells Fargo must include a dishonored check fee provision of no more than $30. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin

Title: PSDR ‚Äì Contracts and Disclosures ‚Äì Form and Style ‚Äì Single Document ‚Äì Discrete Transactions or Services
Summary:
Covered States: IL, PR, WA, WV
 When engaged in consumer and commercial lending, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information in the loan instruments or separate sheet.
 1. Consumer and Commercial Lending 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer and Commercial Lending 
 (a) When providing an installment loan, other than a loan for the purchase of real estate, Wells Fargo must deliver to the customer a copy of the note, instrument or statement containing required disclosures. Wells Fargo must follow additional requirements for placement of disclosures depending on whether disclosures are made on the note, instrument or separate document. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 205/4a(g)(i) 
 
 (b) When providing an unsecured consumer loan contract with insurance, Wells Fargo must give the customer a copy of the contract to allow the customer to request cancellation of the insurance. (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 10(E)
 
 
 (c) When providing residential mortgage loans, Wells Fargo must give the borrower(s) a separate sheet containing contract terms; (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(1); or certain required disclosures in bold typeface. (WV) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-19-11(11.2)

Title: PSDR - Credit Enhancers - Notices - Cosigner, Co-maker, and Guarantor Notices
Summary:
Covered States: CA, CO, CT, MA, NY, SC, WI, WV
 When engaged in the sale, lease, or other offering of the below consumer products and services, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific notices and copies of documents to signatories, cosigners, co-makers, guarantors, endorsers, sureties, or similar parties. 
 1. Consumer Credit Transactions
 2. Consumer Leases
 3. Consumer Lending (excluding loans secured by real property);
 4. Real Estate Transactions 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-105(1), (3); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-105(4); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-405(a); N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 15-702(2), (3); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-303(1); 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Lending
 (a) When engaged in consumer lending, Wells Fargo must 
 (i) provide notice of obligation to any cosigner, comaker, guarantor, endorser, surety, or similar party identifying the debt and reasonably informing the person of his/her obligations therein (CO, NY, SC) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-105(1), (3); N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 15-702(2); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-303(1); and a copy of the note, contract, or other writing evidencing the obligation (CO, NY) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-105(4); N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 15-702(2), (3)
 (ii) provide notice of obligation to a co-signer on a consumer credit account identifying the account and reasonably informative of his/her rights, as well as a completed copy of the agreement establishing the account and any other writing evidencing the co-signer's obligation (NY) N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 15-702(3)
 (iii) provide notice of obligation to each person who does not in fact receive any of the money, property, or services which are the subject matter of the consumer credit contract. Such notice must be in English and Spanish in at least 10-point type, and, if included in the consumer credit contract, must appear immediately above the space reserved for that person's signature or above or adjacent to any other notices required by law and contained in a box formed by a heavy line. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.91(a)-(c); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.92(a)
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide notice of additional obligation to guarantor in open-end credit plan or other extension of credit (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 24
 (c) Wells Fargo must provide notice of right to cure to co-signers (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-105(5)
 (d) Wells Fargo must provide notice of delinquency to any co-signer prior to provision of adverse information to any credit reporting agency (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.101(b); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.101(c)
 (e) Wells Fargo must provide notice of delinquency to co-signers prior to repossession in a motor vehicle credit agreement (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2983.35(a)
 (f) Wells Fargo must provide a copy of any writing setting forth the terms of the debtor‚Äôs agreement or separate obligation signed by the person entitled to a separate written credit-enhancer notice under the statutory requirement (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-303(4) 
 (g) Wells Fargo must provide a copy of any notice of assignment to joint obligors (WI) Wis. Admin. Code DFI-WCA ¬ß 1.37 
 2. Consumer Leases
 (a) When providing consumer leases, Wells Fargo must provide a record of obligation and a copy of the signed record and, upon request, the lease, to a guarantor in a consumer lease. A guarantor‚Äôs signed acknowledgement of receipt of such record creates a presumption of delivery. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-405(a); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-405(c) 
 3. Consumer Lending (excluding loans secured by real property)
 (a) When providing consumer loans (excluding loans secured by real property);
 (i) Wells Fargo must provide a notice identifying the debt to any co-signer of a consumer loan (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-3-303(1);
 (ii) Wells Fargo must provide notice of default to any co-signer in any consumer loan/consumer credit sale/or consumer lease (WV) W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-2-106
 4. Real Estate Transactions 
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide notice to co-signers in rental-purchase agreements in a specified form. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1812.643(c)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Disclosure of Fees and Premiums and Limits on Charges
Summary:
Covered States: AL, AR, CA, CO, CT, FL, ID, IN, LA, MA, ME, MI, MN, MS, MO, ND, NH, OH, OK, PA, VA, WI, WY
 When providing credit insurance coverage for consumer loans, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures regarding fees, premiums, charges, and is subject to certain conditions. 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-404(c); 4 Colo. Code Regs. 902-1, Rule 4(b); (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 40.07(2)(a); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.13(a)(26); 4 Colo. Code Regs. 902-1, Rule 3(a)(1)
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Credit Insurance
 (a) When providing credit insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) make certain disclosures and be subject to certain conditions. (AL, CA, CT, ID, MI, MN, VA) Ala. Code ¬ß5-19-20(b), Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß22314(g), Idaho Admin. Code r.18.01.61.023, Mich. Admin. Code r. 550.215, Minn. Stat. ¬ß 56.155(1), Va. Code Ann. ¬ß38.2-3735(A) 
 (ii) meet certain conditions and make certain disclosures for additional charges. (CO, IN, ME, MN, OK, WI, WY) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-2-202(3), Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-3-202(2), Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 2-501(2), Minn. Stat. ¬ß 47.59(6)(b), Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-202(2), Wis. Stat. ¬ß422.202(1)(b), Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß40-14-311(b)
 (iii) disclose if a billing method creates a balloon payment at the end of the credit transaction or extends the maturity date. (AR, MI, MS) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß23-101-106(c), Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 500.1609(3), Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 83-54-9(3)
 (iv) make certain disclosures and be subject to certain conditions if a debtor is making payments for credit insurance and a policy is not issued. (MO, ND) Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß385.050(3)-(5), N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 26.1-37-08(3)-(5)
 (v) must meet certain conditions and make certain disclosures if selling credit insurance in a single premium basis. (OK, PA) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 4-113, 63 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß456.512(f)(2)
 (vi) must be subject to certain conditions and limitations in connection with providing a small loan. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-559(a) 
 (vii) must obtain the informed consent of the borrower under certain circumstances in connection with a high cost home loan. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 40.07(2) 
 (viii) must meet certain conditions for charges or premiums not to be included as finance charges. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 4(b)
 (ix) must meet certain conditions and make certain disclosures when including premiums in the amount financed. (FL, WI) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 516.35(2), Wis. Stat. ¬ß422.202(2s)
 (b) When an agreement relating to an insurance premium loan is made, Wells Fargo must include certain information in the agreement. (ID) Idaho Code ¬ß 28-43-205
 (c) When requiring credit insurance, Wells Fargo must meet certain requirements in connection with a lease of movables (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3333, and must make certain disclosures and be subject to certain conditions if used as additional security for an indebtedness. (NH) N.H. Code R. Admin. Ins. 1201.04(c) 
 (d) When providing any mortgage that is refinanced after October 1, 2002, Wells Fargo must disclose the amount, and whether this amount includes premiums for credit insurance. (OH) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(C)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Fee Disclosures and Refundability - Refundability
Summary:
Covered States: AZ, CO, GA, KS, MA, MI, MN, MO, NJ, OK, PA, PR, RI, WI
 Wells Fargo must disclose the conditions for the refund of fees and charges in connection with the application for or insurance of credit, and must refund certain fees and charges upon termination of services or credit obligations.
 1. Consumer Real Estate Loans
 2. Other Loans/Lines
 3. Insurance Products
 4. Commercial Real Estate Loans
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1.  Consumer Real Estate Loans
 (a) When offering a mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must 
 (i) disclose the fees, including application, commitment, and loan fees, and the terms or conditions for a refund of those fees. (AZ, GA, WI) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-946(C); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1014(1); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1014(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.052(7e)(b)
 (ii) promptly refund any loan application fees or other amounts paid if the borrower cancels the loan transaction within 3 days of receiving a high loan-to-value mortgage notice (KS) Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-207(5)
 (b) When offering a mortgage rate lock commitment, Wells Fargo must 
 (i) disclose certain information including the interest rate and fees. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 42.11A(4)
 (ii) refund the rate-lock fee if the loan did not close, unless it was due to the borrower‚Äôs fault, whereupon Wells Fargo must send written notice of the reason for retaining the fee. (MO) Mo. Code Regs. Ann. Tit. 20, ¬ß 1140-30.280(2)
 (c) When accepting reimbursement of third party application, credit, or appraisal fees or fee charges, Wells Fargo must disclose certain information, including whether a fee is refundable, and the terms and conditions for the refund. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.3(a) 
 2. Other Loans/Lines
 (a) When establishing an open-end credit account, Wells Fargo must 
 (i) provide certain required statutory language if the loan fee or charges are not included in the annual percentage rate pursuant to the federal Truth in Lending Act. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 47.59(12)(a)
 (ii) disclose that a borrower under an open-end credit plan secured by a dwelling may elect not to open the plan and can receive a refund of all application fees if a disclosed term changes. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(4)(B)(ii)
 (b) When offering a revolving charge account plan or a revolving loan account plan, Wells Fargo must 
 (i) refund all application fees if the borrower elects not to enter into the plan because a term or condition in the application changed. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.3(4); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.3(4)
 (ii) provide certain required statutory disclosures and pamphlet. If specific terms about the plan cannot be provided because they are unavailable, Wells Fargo must not impose any nonrefundable application fee until three days after borrower‚Äôs receipt of the required application disclosures. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-301(5) 
 (c) Wells Fargo must refund any overcharges, with interest. (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 41.3(q) 
 (d) When making loans under the Small Loans regulations, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) prominently display at a visible place of business its loan fees and charges. (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(A);
 (ii) disclose in writing such fees, charges, and any penalties. (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(B)
 (e) When a solicitation check recipient returns the amount borrowed, Wells Fargo must not assess any penalty, charge, interest, or fee or affect the recipient‚Äôs credit score if the amount is returned within 5 business days after the check is processed. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 100.315(2)(b)(4)
 3. Consumer Insurance Products
 (a) When offering credit insurance, Wells Fargo must make certain clear and conspicuous, written disclosures, including the conditions for cancellation and the method of refund of unearned premiums. (CO, MA) 4 Colo. Code Regs. 902-1, Rule 4(b); 211 Mass. Code Regs. 143.02(1), (2)
 (b) When offering credit insurance subsequent to a credit extension, Wells Fargo must provide written disclosures within 10 calendar days after the oral offer or with other written material, whichever is earlier. (MA) 211 Mass. Code Regs. 143.02(1), (2)
 (c) Wells Fargo must immediately correct an error in calculating refunds of unearned insurance premiums on a prepaid loan contract, with interest. (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 41.3(q)
 (d) When credit insurance is canceled or not issued, Wells Fargo must promptly refund all premiums and charges or credit the account (MI, RI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 550.618; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 27-30-6(g), (h). RI requires that the refund or credit be provided within 30 days of the cancelation request, 30 days of the application if insurance is not issued, or 30 days of a substituted lesser amount. (RI) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 27-30-6(g), (h) 
 4. Commercial Real Estate Loans
 (a) When offering a commercial mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must disclose the fees, including application, commitment, and loan fees, and the terms or conditions for a refund of those fees. (AZ) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-983(C)

Title: PSDR - Private Mortgage Insurance - Notices at or before Closing - Application Notices
Summary:
Covered States: CT, ME
 Wells Fargo must disclose mortgage insurance requirements at the time of a mortgage loan application.
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 (a) When providing a first residential mortgage, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures when the application is submitted. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-726(a), (c) 
 (b) When acting as processor or underwriter of a residential mortgage, Wells Fargo must disclose to the borrower that Wells Fargo is also in the business of private mortgage insurance. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 33, ¬ß 507

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Paper Size - 8-1/2 x 11 or 8-1/2 x 14 Permitted
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Paper Size - 8-1/2 x 11 or 8-1/2 x 14 Permitted
 
 MCR0001019
 
 Covered State: TX
 
 If Wells Fargo uses a non-standard contract, Wells Fargo must submit to the Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner one copy of the contract in a text-searchable PDF format that is not locked or restricted in any way, and the page size of the contract must be 8.5 inches by 11 inches or 8.5 inches by 14 inches. 
 
 This MCR is not product specific. 
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 90.104(c)(2).

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Credit Insurance Disclosures
Summary:
Covered States: DE, FL, IL, LA, MA, MI, MN, MO, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OK, PA, PR, SD, VA, WV
 When engaged in consumer lending, Wells Fargo must provide their customers with various state specific disclosures including the right of the customer to choose the insurance company for the loan, should it be necessary.

(DE, LA, MA, MI, MN, MO, NJ, NY, OH, OK, PA, PR, SD, VA, WV) 5-900-903 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß2.1.1; La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß6:969.25; 209 Mass. Code Regs. 32.34; Mass. Gen.  (ii) provide all state specific insurance disclosures to their lending customers prior to completing a lending contract. (DE, IL, LA, MA, MI, MO, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OK, PA, PR, SD, VA, WV) 5-900-903 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß2.3.1; 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 670/16; La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß22:1600(B); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 32.34; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 167F, ¬ß 2A(b)(4)(iii); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß500.4418(2)(a) ‚Äì (c); Minn. Stat. ¬ß56.155(1); Mo. Code Regs. Ann. Tit. 20, ¬ß1140-5.020(17)(E); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß17:11C-21(a) and (c); Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß690A.030(1); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11, ¬ß187.12(a)(2); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß3901.211(C)(1); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß3901.211(C)(1); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß365:10-5-62(b)(2); 40 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß310.76(a); PR Reglamento 5782, Art.5(B), (F); S.D. Admin. R. 20:06:06:11; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß38.2-233(C)(2); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß38.2-3737(F); W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 114-61-4(4.1), (4.2)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Obligations of Good Faith, Diligence, Reasonablene

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Fee Disclosures and Refundability - Dwelling and Residence Secured Loans
Summary:
Covered States: CA, DC, GA, MN, OK, TN, WY 
 When processing credit applications, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures regarding fees and charges refundable upon termination of the lending transaction. 
 1. Consumer Real Estate ‚Äì Revolving (Open End)
 2. Consumer Real Estate ‚Äì Real Estate Secured
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Real Estate ‚Äì Revolving (Open End)
 (a) When processing an application for a revolving charge account plan secured by consumer's principal dwelling, Wells Fargo must provide statutorily mandated pamphlet and disclosures of certain information. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß¬ß 2-310.3(5)(a); 3-309.3(5)(a); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß¬ß 2-310.3(5)(b); 3-309.3(5)(b)
 (b) When processing an application for a revolving charge account plan secured by consumer's principal dwelling, Wells Fargo must disclose: an itemization of any fees imposed and when such fees are payable. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(1)(c); a clear and conspicuous statement when the loan application must be submitted to obtain the terms disclosed (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.2(1)(f); a statement that the loan applicant may reject an agreement to open an account if any term changes before the agreement is final, and when a refund of all loan application fees may be obtained (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(1)(f)(ii); that no nonrefundable fee may be imposed for revolving charge account loan secured by consumer‚Äôs principal dwelling until 3 days after consumer receives statutorily-mandated disclosures and pamphlet (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß¬ß 2-310.3(5); 3-309(5); and a good faith estimate of the additional fees that may be imposed by third parties in connection with opening the account. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.2(1)(d) 
 2. Consumer Real Estate ‚Äì Real Estate Secured
 (a) Refunds of any credit application fees
 (i) When the borrower voids the mortgage loan application for failure to provide certain statutorily-required disclosures, Wells Fargo must return any application fees if prior to the loan closing. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1116.3 
 (ii) When the borrower withdraws a mortgage loan application prior to signing the financing agreement or written commitment, Wells Fargo must not assert a penalty and return all fees except for any reasonable application fee. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1116.6
 (iii) When acting as mortgage lender or broker and prior to accepting any fee, Wells Fargo must disclose the terms and conditions for obtaining refund of all or any part of the fee or charge. (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(2);(MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.16(2)(b); (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(1)(f)(ii)
 (b) When originating a residential mortgage loan or processing a residential mortgage loan application, Wells Fargo must provide the following information about fees and charges:
 (i) At least 3 days before loan closing, disclose prepayment fees or penalties. (CA, TN) Cal. Fin. Code 4973(a)(2)(B); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(9)(A)
 (ii) At least 3 days before loan closing, disclose negative amortization provision that may add principal to loan balance. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(c)
 (iii) Within 3 days of receipt of residential loan application but no later than 7 days before closing, disclose state-specific information and a Loan Estimate as required by federal law; no later than 3 days before closing, disclose a Closing Disclosure as required by federal law; and disclose acceptance of fees cannot guarantee loan approval. (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(2) 
 (iv) Disclose the will be no payment of any fees or charges prior to closing except for charges actually incurred to process the loan application. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-113(b)
 (v) Disclose the identity of trust account where any advance fees submitted by borrower will be deposited and if orally informing a borrower of the actual or anticipated periodic payment, must also disclose that an additional amount will be included for payment of taxes and insurance. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.16(2)(b); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.13(a)(26)
 (c) When acting as loan originator for a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must calculate points and fees for financing high-cost home loans using state-specified formulas and limits (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(7); when acting as loan originator for re-financing an existing high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must calculate points and fees for financing high-cost home loans using state-specified formulas and limits (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(8); and when acting as loan originator for a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must calculate any late payment fee using state-specified formulas and limits. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(15)
 (d) When acting as a licensed residential mortgage lender, Wells Fargo may charge a loan cancellation fee prior to closing (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-113(b); and prior to the closing, Wells Fargo must re-disclose any fees or charges that increased by more than $1,000 after the initial disclosure (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-113(f); and may require a borrower to pay fees or charges actually incurred for services rendered by third parties necessary to process the application; a rate lock in fee; and a commitment fee upon approval of the loan (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-113(b)

Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Servicer Disclosures - Credit Insurance Related Notices and Requirements
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IN, KS, KY, MA, ME, MI, MN, MO, MT, NH, NJ, NM, NY, OH, OK, PA, SC, TN, UT, VT, WV
 
 When engaged in the sale, lease, or other offering of the below consumer products and services, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information, including any planned or completed changes in insurance coverages, explanations of coverages, and issue refunds for unused premiums.
 
 1. Consumer Lending 
 2. Retail Installment Contracts
 3. Credit Life Insurance
 4. Credit Disability Insurance
 5. Mortgages 
 6. Insurance Generally
 7. Credit Cards
 8. Refinancing
 9. Sales and Leasing of Motor Vehicles
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß5-4-105; Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß5-4-108(2); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß431:10B-109(c)-(e); Haw. Rev. Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Servicer Disclosures - Statement of Account/Receipt Notices
Summary:
MCR: 1098
 
 Covered States: AK, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, HI, IA, IL, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, NH, NJ, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, TN, VA, WA.
 
 Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures and notices relating to upcoming payments due, receipt of payments, and payments received but not applied, within prescribed timelines. When Wells Fargo is paid in cash, it must provide a receipt to its customer containing certain information. Wells Fargo must also provide periodic statements of account, which include information related to payments received, interest paid, amounts owed, and escrow amounts required and paid. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 06.20.270; Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.090(b); Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.090(a); Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.110(b); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-631(D); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1810.3(a)(1)-(7); Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22337(d); Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22458; Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-104(1); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-104(2); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-716(b); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-781; D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 16, ¬ß 116; Fla. Stat. ¬ß 516.15(2); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.35(2)(a); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(c)(5); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(e)(1); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-6(a)(24); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/15; 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/16; Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3206(4); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-205(1); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-205(2); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 367.320(2)(c-e); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 11(b); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 22; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, ¬ß 19; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-1023(d); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-308(b); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-308(e); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-503(g); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-617(a); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-923(d); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 13-316(b)-(f); Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-205(1); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 445.862(b); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 56.14(2); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408.130(1) and (2); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-67-127(1)(b); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 399-A:15(XV); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:9A-59.4(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 401.6(b)(3); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 10.1(b-d); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 401.6(c); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 419.3(f); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 419.4(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 419.4(c); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1109.05(C); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1109.18(C); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 725.345(6); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 86A.324(1)(d); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 86A.324(1)(h); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 86A.324(1)(i); 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(6); 10 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 753(a); 7 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 3067(b); PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 3.8(B); PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 3.8(C)(b); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.1-11(b); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-302(1); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-302(2); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-3-302(1); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-3-302(2); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(18); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1818.2(B); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-900(3)(c); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-905(1)(b); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 31.04.290(1)(b).
 
 Additional State Specific Requirements: 
 
 1. All Products Listed Above 
 
 (a) For new loans, Wells Fargo must issue payment instructions containing specific statutory requirements at least 15 days before the first payment is due. (AR) 214-00-009 Ark. Code R. ¬ß 5010-1(a). 
 
 (b) For balloon payment notes with repayment terms longer than one year, Wells Fargo must deliver a written notice to the borrower containing the statutory requirements. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2966(a). 
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must notify the borrower, at least two days prior to the payment due date, of the amount due and the payment due date. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22370(i)(5). 
 
 (d) Wells Fargo cannot assess fees more than 45 days after the fee was incurred. If periodic statements do not provide the information, Wells Fargo must provide a clear statement to the borrower explaining the fee. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-900(3)(e). 
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) Upon the consumer‚Äôs payment in full or renewal of a consumer loan, Wells Fargo must provide written notice of payment and release to the customer, including the statutory requirements. Wells Fargo must provide notice to the consumer:
 i. At the time the loan is repaid. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 399-A:15(XVI)
 ii. Within 15 days of the day the loan is repaid. (AZ) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-637(G)
 iii. Within 20 days of the day the loan is repaid. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 56.14(4);
 iv. Within 30 days of the day the loan is repaid. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-104(3)
 v. Upon request of the consumer. (KS) Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-205(3)
 
 (b) At the time the consumer loan is made, Wells Fargo must deliver to the borrower a written statement or copy of the loan contract that includes the installment schedule, security, and prepayment terms. Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408.130(1)-(2).
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards and Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards 
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must include, with each credit card billing statement, the statutorily required statement regarding minimum payment. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1748.13(a)(1). 
 
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide written disclosures prior to imposing a delinquency charge on a retail installment account, and Wells Fargo must not impose more than one delinquency charge on any installment, regardless of the period during which it remains in default. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1810.12(b)
  
 (b) If a retail installment account has an outstanding credit balance greater than one dollar ($1), Wells Fargo must comply with statutory requirements to either issue a cash refund or notice. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1810.3(e)(1); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1810.3(e)(2); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2924i(c)
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must provide its customer with a written payment receipt when payment is made on an installment land contract if the customer requests the receipt or if the payment is made in cash. If the payment is made in cash, Wells Fargo must put the date, amount, nature of the payment, the obligation the payment applies to, and account balance information. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6231(a); (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6231(b)
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must not charge for providing a written statement of account to the customer in any 6-month period, but if the customer requests more than one statement of account during that period, Wells Fargo is entitled to:
 a. $10 per each additional statement. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/15; 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/16. 
 b. 50 cents for each additional statement. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, ¬ß 19
 
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must respond within 15 days to a written request for information from a mortgagor. The written response must include the telephone number of someone at Wells Fargo who can assist the mortgagor. (AK) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 18.56.135(c); Md. Code Ann. Com. Law ¬ß 13-316(b)-(f).
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide a statutorily prescribed notice to the borrower if it advances the required insurance payments on a borrower‚Äôs vehicle. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2982.8(c)
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must return the certificate of title or the application for the certificate, and the manufacturer‚Äôs certificate of origin containing a clearly marked record of the date of receipt, with a notice that the customer must register and pay all additional fees and taxes due within 30 days from the date of purchase of the vehicle. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 47, ¬ß 1110(A.4)
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must comply with specific requirements when offering a balloon payment mortgage. Wells Fargo must provide the borrower with a notice of adjustment or of maturity in writing or via electronic medium if the borrower has consented. Wells Fargo must provide the notice at least 30 but not more than 120 days prior to a payment adjustment, and at least 90 but not more than 120 days prior to the expected maturity of a balloon-payment mortgage. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 80.5
 
 (e) When servicing a revolving credit line secured by a junior mortgage, Wells Fargo must provide notice at the time the adjusted payment is due. This notice must be written or provided electronically if the borrower has consented. If Wells Fargo provides the notice electronically, it must demonstrate that it asked applicant if he or she could print the notice. If a borrower indicates he or she cannot download and print such notice, Wells Fargo must mail the notice. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 80.5.; N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.5
 
 (f) Wells Fargo cannot charge a late fee if full payment is made on the due date or within the applicable grace period, and if a late fee is charged, it must be assessed within 30 days of accrual and be clearly disclosed on the next statement. (KY) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 367.320(2)(c)-(e)
 
 (g) Within 7 days of acquiring mortgage servicing, Wells Fargo must send the mortgagor a notice which provides information related to mortgage payments and means to contact Wells Fargo personnel. Additionally, Wells Fargo must promptly pay all taxes, insurance premiums, and water and sewer assessments so long as the mortgagor has made sufficient payments and Wells Fargo is in possession of the assessment bill. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 13-316(b)-(f)
 
 (h) Wells Fargo must follow specific requirements provided by law when calculating interest on a mortgage escrow account. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 10.1(b-d)
 
 (i) If Wells Fargo has an agreement with the borrower that Wells Fargo will not pay insurance, taxes, or other charges without sufficient escrow, then Wells Fargo must notify the borrower in that agreement of his or her duty to pay those costs. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-905(2)
 
 (j) Wells Fargo must notify the borrower of any changes to borrower's account if Wells Fargo collects escrow for the borrower to pay certain costs. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-905(3)

Title: PSDR - Retail Leases - Goods (excluding Motor Vehicles)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, CA, IA, IN, NY, OK, WI, WV
 
 Wells Fargo must make the required lease disclosures to the lessee prior to the consummation of the consumer lease, and the disclosures must be made clearly and conspicuously in writing. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3202(2); Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3202(2)(e); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-5-1.1(a); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-5-1.1(a)(3); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(b)
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must not include certain provisions in lease-purchase agreements, including a confession of judgment, a negotiable instrument, certain assignments, and waivers. (AK) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.35.040
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must not include a provision waiving certain consumer‚Äôs rights in a contract or proposed contract for the sale or lease of consumer goods or services. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1670.8(a)(1)
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must not use additional information in the disclosures to mislead the 
 lessee or contradict/distract attention from the required disclosures. Additionally, Wells Fargo must assume that all scheduled payments will be made when due, even if that assumption is later rendered inaccurate by an act, occurrence or agreement. (IA, OK) Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3202(2); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-5-1.1(b)
 
 (d) If acting as lessor, Wells Fargo must provide certain information to the consumer, 
 including a brief description of the goods, various payment obligations and other charges, insurance coverage, and any liabilities the lease imposes on the consumer. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3202(1)
 
 (e) If acting as lessor, Wells Fargo must provide certain payment information, 
 including the number of periodic payments, the amount of each payment and the due dates for payments. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3202(1)(f) 
 
 (f) Wells Fargo must not require the obligation of lessee to exceed the average 
 monthly payment upon expiration of a consumer lease. (WI, IN, OK) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.412; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-2-406; Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-406
 
 
 (g) Wells Fargo must provide consumer leases that are written in a clear and coherent 
 manner, using words with common and everyday meanings. The lease must also be appropriately divided into well-organized, captioned sections and use easily readable type size and ink that contrasts with the paper. (NY, WV) N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 5-702(a)(1),(2); W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-6-109(a)
 
 (h) When providing the lessee with the required disclosures, Wells Fargo must provide a dated statement that identifies the lessor and the lessee. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-5-1.1(a)(1)
 
  (i) Wells Fargo must segregate the disclosures from other information and the disclosures must only contain directly related information. Additionally, Wells Fargo must ensure that headings, content, and format for the disclosures are provided in a manner substantially similar to the applicable model form. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-5-1.1(a)(2)
 
 (j) Wells Fargo must not use a reasonable estimate for an amount or other item 
 needed to be included to comply with a required disclosure unless the exact information is unknown or unavailable after reasonable efforts have been made to find the information, the reasonable estimate is based on the best information available, is clearly identified as an estimate, and is not used to evade any disclosures. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-5-1.1(d)
  
 (k) In an advertisement for a consumer lease, Wells Fargo must follow certain requirements including: 
 
 (i) Wells Fargo must not state that a specific lease of property at specific amounts or terms is available unless the lessor usually leases or will lease the property at those amounts or terms. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(a);
 
 (ii) If Wells Fargo provides a percentage rate, the rate must not be more prominent than any of the disclosures required to accompany the rate and Wells Fargo must not use the term "annual percentage rate," "annual lease rate," or any equivalent term. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(b)(2); 
 
 (iii) If an advertisement states the amount of any payment, contains a statement of capitalized cost reduction or states that no payment is required prior to or at the consummation of the lease, Wells Fargo must include the required disclosures and include additional information including that the transaction advertised is a lease, payment information, whether a security deposit is required, and a statement regarding extra charges imposed at the end of the lease term. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(d)(1); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(d)(2)
 
 (a) If such an advertisement is made through television or radio, Wells Fargo must also list a toll-free telephone number along with a reference that such number may be used by consumers to obtain the information, or direct the consumer to a written advertisement which contains the required information in a publication of general circulation in the community served by the media station, including the name and the date of the publication. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(f)(1)
 
  (b) If Wells Fargo lists a toll-free telephone number, it must be an established toll-free number that is available for at least 10 days beginning on the date of the broadcast. Wells Fargo must provide the required telephone information orally or in writing, upon request. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:10-7-1.1(f)(2)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Debtor or Obligor May Not Waive Certain Rights or Limit Duties Imposed on Secured Party (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-602)
PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Secondary Obligor May Waive Right of Redemption after Default in Non-Consumer Transaction (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-624)
Summary:

 Except in consumer goods transactions, for a debtor or secondary obligor to waive the right to notification of disposition of collateral, Wells Fargo must enter into and authenticate an agreement to that effect after default. 
 
 1. Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
