Stat. tit. 12A, ¬ß 1-9-624 (c); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 79.0624(3); 13 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 9624 (c); 19 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 2384 (c); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 6A-9-624 (c); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 36-9-624 (c); S.D. Codified Laws ¬ß 57A-9-624 (c); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-9-624 (c); Tex. Bus. & Com. Ann. ¬ß 9.624(c); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70A-9a-624 (3); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 8.9A-624 (c); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9A, ¬ß 9-624 (c); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 62A.9A-624 (c); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 409.624 (3); W. Va. Code ¬ß 46-9-624 (c); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 34.1-9-624 (c)

Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Servicer Disclosures - Loan Sale, Transfer and/or Assignment
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AR, CA, CO, CT, GA, HI, IA, IL, ME, MO, MT, NJ, NV, NY, OK, PA, TN, UT, WA, WI, WY 
 When a consumer or mortgage loan is sold, transferred, or assigned, Wells Fargo, as lender, broker, assignee, or servicer, must provide customers with certain disclosures.
 1. Consumer Lending 
 2. Mortgages 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.5(c)(2); Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 9-306; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(h)(3); Tenn. Comp. R. & Regs. 0780-1-18-.01(7); Wis. Admin. Code Ins ¬ß 3.25(9)(h)
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Lending 
 (a) When acting as lender for open-end consumer loan, Wells Fargo must notify borrower of a transfer of the loan and that borrower may pay off loan balance to terminate the agreement. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 401.6(d)(2)
 (b) When acting as assignee of a consumer credit sale or lease, Wells Fargo must give notice meeting statutory requirements and qualify as a good faith assignee as set forth by state statute (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-238(a); and the original assignor will continue to receive payments until proper notice is received by the borrower (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.409 (1, 2). An assignment of earnings as payment for a consumer credit transaction must be revocable at will by the customer, and the assignment may be extended if the certain conditions are met, including the right to revoke at will. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.404(2) 
 2. Mortgages 
 (a) When acting as the original lender on a mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must notify the borrower of any transfer and where to send next 3 monthly payments (IL) 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/48.2(e)(2); with Maine requiring the original creditor to retain servicing rights unless the assignee of servicing rights maintains an office in state or toll-free phone number to the customer service office (ME) Me. Stat. tit.9-A, ¬ß 9-304 
 (b) When acting as a lender, Wells Fargo must disclose the possibility of transfer, sale or assignment of the loan at or prior to closing. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.148.030(1) 
 (c) When acting as the transferee mortgage lender, Wells Fargo must provide the borrower with a Mortgage Transfer Disclosure to the extent required by federal law. (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(8) 
 (d) When servicing a mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must comply with the notification requirements of the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974, 12 U.S.C. ¬ß‚Äâ2601 et seq. (RESPA). (AK, CT, HI, MT, NJ) Ark. Code ¬ß 23-39-510(b)(2); 109-03-003.8 Ark. Code R. ¬ß C; Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-719e; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(l)(1); Mont. Code ¬ß 32-9-169(1); N.J. Stat. ¬ß 17:16F-36(a)
 (e) When acting as transferor/assignor/seller of servicing rights to mortgage loans, Wells Fargo must provide statutorily mandated notice to the borrower/mortgagor within certain time limits. (AK, CA, CO, CT, IA, MO, MT, NJ, NV, UT) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 18.56.135(a); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2937(b); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 38-40-103.5(3); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-719e; Iowa Code ¬ß 535B.11(6); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 443.861; Mont. Code ¬ß 32-9-170(7); Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645F976(e); NJ Stat. ¬ß 17-16F-36(b); N.J. Stat.¬ß 17:16F-17(b) (notice sent to tax collector); 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.5(b); Utah Code ¬ß 70D-2-303(2); 
 (f) When acting as transferee/assignee/purchaser of servicing rights to mortgage loans, Well Fargo must provide statutorily mandated notice to the borrower/mortgagor within certain time limits. (AK, CA, GA, HI, IL, MT, NJ, OK, UT) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 18.56.135(b); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2937(b); Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(8); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(l); 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/48.2(e)(3); Mont. Code ¬ß 32-9-170(7); N.J. Stat. ¬ß 17:16F-17(d) (notice sent to tax collector); N.J. Stat. ¬ß 17:16F-36; Okla. Admin, Code ¬ß 160:45-5-9(b)(4); Okla. Admin, Code ¬ß 160:45-5-9(d);10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.5(b); Utah Code ¬ß 70D-2-303(2)
 (g) When acting as lender or mortgage broker for a reverse mortgage transaction, Wells Fargo must provide to applicant a Servicing Disclosure Statement per Appendix MS-1 of 12 C.F.R. 1024, SubPart C (RESPA) (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.5(a)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Required Terms and Provisions - Mortgage Loans
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Required Terms and Provisions - Mortgage Loans
 
 MCR: 1076
 
 Covered States: AK, CA, DE, FL, ID, IL, KS, LA, MN, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PR, RI, SC, TX, WA, WI, WV.
 
 When offering mortgage loans, Wells Fargo's mortgage agreements and any modifications made to those agreements must contain state-specific disclosures as to fees, penalties, time-frames, obligations, interest rates, and other information. Disclosures must meet certain state-specific formatting requirements.
  
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 34.20.160(b); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2963; Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2966(d), (e); 5-2100-2104 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 2.0; Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2113;; Kan. Admin. Reg. ¬ß 17-24-1; La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3572.11(A)(2); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 47.209(2); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-76(b); Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645E.290(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.2(1)(g); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 86.150(1)-(4); ; S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 40-58-78(A)-(C); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 342.456(a)-(d); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 31.04.515(1); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 31.04.515(5) - (7); Wis. Admin. Code DFI-Bkg ¬ß 44.01(1); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.055(1); W. Va. Code ¬ß 38-1-14(c)(1).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate:
 
 (a) When providing an eligible borrower an extension for 3 years, Wells Fargo must not increase the interest rate on the introductory mortgage rate. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-40(a).
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must not foreclose a homestead unless certain statutory requirements are met. (TX) Tex. Const. Art. XVI, ¬ß 50(a)(5).
 
 (c) When a security interest contains a subordination clause, Wells Fargo must place at the top the word "SUBORDINATED" in at least 10 point bold type, capitalized and underlined, and include certain notices. (CA)Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2953.2.
 
 (d) When acting as a licensee, Wells Fargo must not receive any compensation for any mortgage loan agreement modifications prior to the execution of a written contract that details the services and compensation. (DE) 5-2200-2203 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 2.0(2.5)
 
 (e) When modifying a loan agreement, Wells Fargo must include a notice to the borrower immediately above the signature, in 12 point capitalized font, that complies with the statutory language. (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 494.00296(c)
 
 (f) When modifying a loan agreement, Wells Fargo must not require or encourage the borrower to make certain waivers of rights, pay certain charges, or end communications lender, investor, or loan servicer. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.355(2)
 
 (g) When acting as a licensee in a mortgage transaction, Wells Fargo must not:
 
 (i) charge or accept certain fees. (ID) Idaho Code ¬ß 26-31-211(1),(3)
 
 (ii) enter in agreement that contains blank spaces. (ID) Idaho Code ¬ß 26-31-211(1),(3)
 
 (iii) obtain any exclusive dealing agreements. (ID) Idaho Code ¬ß 26-31-211(1),(3)
 
 (iv) enter into any other agreement with the borrower with respect to a single loan, unless it meets certain statutory disclosure requirements. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1010(g)
 
 (h) When Wells Fargo provides a variation in the interest rate, it must make certain disclosures and follow express guidelines. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-76(b)
 
 (i) When Wells Fargo enters into an agreement where it conditionally reduces the amount of the principal in order to assist the borrower in avoiding foreclosure, it must meet certain criteria in order to be entitled to a share in the appreciation of the market value of the property. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 6-f(1)
 
 (j) When Wells Fargo provides a revolving loan account plan, it must make certain, enumerated statements to the borrower. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.2(1)(g)
 
 (k) When Wells Fargo seeks a letter of balance of cancelation, the writing must contain certain enumerated details. (PR) PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 3.7(a)(c)(d)
 
 (l) When Wells Fargo seeks to impose a prepayment penalty, Wells Fargo must meet certain requirements. (RI) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-23-5(b)
 
 (m) In a contract for a first lien real estate mortgage on an owner-occupied residential property, Wells Fargo must increase the contractual interest rate unless the contract contains certain provisions. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.055(1) 
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Any Consumer Loan or Contract:
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must get loan documents signed on the registrant's registered premises, when servicing a loan and certain circumstances arise. (OH) Ohio Admin. Code 1301:8-3-07(A)
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures in specific formats when issuing a service contract. (PR) PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 4.8(d).

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - Rates, Fees, Loan Terms
Summary:
Covered States: CA, CO, DC, GA, IA, MA, MD, ME, MN, MS, NH, , NJ, NY, OK, SC, TN, TX, WA, WI
 When engaged in lending, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information, including the terms and the text form and content and timing of the disclosure.
 1. Consumer Lending (excluding loans secured by real property); 
 2. Consumer Credit Cards; 
 3. Secured Consumer Lending and
 4. Home Mortgage Lending and Other Real Estate Transactions;
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Lending
 (a) Before closing, Wells Fargo must provide particular disclosures including:
 (i) For all consumer, non-open end loans, principal amount of loan, fees and prepaid expenses. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 12(a)(2)
 (ii) For all loans, principal amount, finance charges, and APR. (MD, OK) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-106(b); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-1(b)
 (iii) For flex loan plan, licensee must disclose in writing in clear language interest, fees and charges. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-12-112(a)
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide particular disclosures including:
 (i) For all consumer, non-open end loans, Wells Fargo must disclose the identity of creditor, amount financed, statement of right to obtain disclosure of loan amounts with check boxes to select. If borrow elects yes, Wells Fargo must disclose an itemization of amount financed including finance charges, APR, number of payments, amount and due dates, total sale price, explanation of terms, security interest, late payment fees, disclosure of fees that can be refunded, notice of any security interest, statement referring borrower to certain document for explanations. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 12(a)(1)-(13)and(b) 
 (ii) For all loans, if insurance is required as part of loan, Wells Fargo must disclose that borrower may select their own insurer. Borrower must execute written acknowledgment that received disclosure. (MS) 19-001-023 Miss. Code R. ¬ß 23.11(A)-(C)
 (iii) For all loans, Wells Fargo must disclose all information required by Federal Consumer Credit Protection Act, or in the alternative, the disclosures required by the state but compliance with Federal rules is sufficient. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-301(2)and(3)
 (iv) For open ended, variable rate loans, Wells Fargo must disclose all information required by Federal or in the alternative, the disclosures required by the state which includes a notice with specific language but compliance with Federal rules is sufficient. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 303.015(c)
 2. Consumer Credit Cards
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures on the credit card application and such disclosures must be in certain text and format. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 325G.42(1) 
 
 3. Secured Consumer Lending
 (a) Wells Fargo must disclose the right of rescission and provide applicable forms to rescind. (MA, OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 5-204(1) ; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 10(a)
 (b) If Wells Fargo credits installment payments as of the date due rather than date of receipt, it must provide disclosure. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-106(1)
 4. Home Mortgage Lending and Other Real Estate Transactions
 (a) Before accepting an application fee for a mortgage Wells Fargo must provide particular disclosures including: 
 (i) fees and whether refundable, (GA) Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1014(2)
 (ii) whether fees are refundable and whether terms of loan are fixed. (WI) Wis.Stat. ¬ß 138.052(7e)(b) 
 (iii) disclosures required by federal law. (MA, OK) 940 Mass. Code Regs. 8.06(3); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A ¬ß 3-310(5)
 (iv) fees and whether refundable, estimated days between application and commitment, and name of contact. Borrower must acknowledge receipt in writing. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.3(a)
 (v) types of loans available and for each type, term, rate, payment, explanation of any future adjustments, prepayment penalties, exemplars for variable rates, history of variable rate indexes, and escrow payments. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(a)
 (vi) if rates will change after consummation and for more than one year, must provide consumer loan handbook and disclosures for each program customer is interested in including terms of rate change, timing, historical, examples, etc. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(2)(B)
 (vii) for a step rate mortgage, the changes payment and rates with a comparison to fixed rate loan. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(e)
 
 (viii) for a graduated payment loan, changes in payment and comparison to conventional loan. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(c)
 (ix) for a pledged account loan, a comparison to conventional rate loan and savings account. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(d)
 (x) for a preferred rate mortgage, events that would cause change in interest rate and rules for termination including fees and how new rate is determined. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(f)
 (b) In association with accepting an application for a mortgage, Wells Fargo must provide disclosures pursuant to specified timing the most restrictive of which is at the time of the application the following disclosures:
 (i) Within three days of application, Wells Fargo must provide:
 1. good faith estimate. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.3(a)
 2. one page summary of terms in simple language and, if rate lock, rate lock fees with applicable forms. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(3); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(e), (f)
 3. If Wells Fargo charges settlement or document review fees, insurance requirements, ability of borrower to select own attorney or title company, and good faith estimate. Written acknowledgment of same must be attached to application. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-119(b)
 (ii) Within three business days of application, Wells Fargo must provide:
 1. For a home equity loan, Wells Fargo must provide a notice with specific language disclosure at time of application or within three business days if application by phone or mail. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2971(a)-(b)
 2. For a refinance loan, Wells Fargo must provide disclosures within three business days and at least 12 days prior to consummation. One copy may be provided to married couple. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 153.45(4)(E)
 3. For a balloon loan, a real estate broker who negotiates a loan must disclose the terms of the loan including number of payments, amount of payment, balance at maturity and a notice with specific language. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10241.4; Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10241(h)
 (iii) If Wells Fargo applies payments on the day they are received, they must disclose same at time of application via separate written disclosure. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 397-A:14(III)
 (c) Prior to settlement of a real estate mortgage loan, in relation to sale of manufactured home, Wells Fargo must provide disclosures of terms of loan at least two days prior to closing. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-3-308(A)
 (d) Wells Fargo shall disclose [no specified timing]:
 (i) For all consumer, non-open end loans, Wells Fargo must disclose the identity of creditor, amount financed, statement of right to obtain disclosure of loan amounts with check boxes to select. If borrow elects yes, Wells Fargo must disclose an itemization of amount financed including finance charges, APR, number of payments, amount and due dates, total sale price, explanation of terms, security interest, late payment fees, disclosure of fees that can be refunded, notice of any security interest, statement referring borrower to certain document for explanations, and whether the loan may be assumed by a future purchaser. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 12(a)(1)-(13)and(b)
 (ii) Statement of loan form shall contain name and address, actual cash received from borrower, funds paid to third persons and fees paid by borrower. (CA) Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1454(a),(b)
 (iii) For variable rate mortgage, notice with specific language with examples for various rate changes including highest rate under agreement. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-310(3)
 (iv) Clear and conspicuous statement regarding cost of insurance and that borrower may retain own insurance. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 537.2501(2)(b)
 (v) If title search is required, written notice that borrower can select own title company. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-311
 (vi) If the mortgage does not include taxes and insurance, shall orally disclose the additional amounts and that borrower would be required to pay. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.13(a)(26) 
 (vii) Prior to closing, in a table funded transaction, rate lock fee on good faith estimate and at closing disclose, the rate lock fee paid. Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(9)
 (e) Wells Fargo shall disclose pursuant to specified timing 
 (i) With regard to a balloon loan, prior to the borrower becoming obligated. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10241.4
 (ii) At or before the commitment, the expiration and last date for acceptance of commitment, amount of loan, whether subject to increase in rate before expiration. If not subject to increase in rate, finance charges, APR and payment. If subject to change, notice in specified language with examples under various rates and fees. If a variable rates, circumstances that would cause change of rate, examples of various rates, and fees that are subject to change. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.5(a), (c)
 (iii) Before commitment, make available written disclosure of fees and notice that a failure to pay will result in loss of property. Borrower must sign acknowledgment at or prior to closing. (GA) Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1014(2)
 (iv) If a balloon loan, at time of commitment, notice with specified language. Such notice may be given electronically and may also be included in the loan contract. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(b)
 (f) In the event terms change after disclosure, Wells Fargo shall disclose the interest rate and a statement regarding the terms that are unchanged the most strict is at least three days prior to closing. (DC, MD, OK) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-1022(c)(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-310(4); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(2)(B); D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1113(b)(1)
 (i) such disclosure shall be within three days of the change and at least three days prior to closing. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(3)
 (ii) at least one day prior. S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-309(C)
 (iii) if the APR varies from disclosed rate by more than 1/8 of 1%, prior to settlement. Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(5)(c)
 (iv) for the sale of a manufactured home, at least one day prior to closing. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-3-308(C)(1)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosure - Non-Credit Insurance Disclosures
Summary:
Covered States: AL, CA, CT, HI, MA, NJ, NV, NY, PR, WV
 Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures when requiring or offering insurance products incident to loans, extensions of credit and leases. 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-404(a)
 1. Insurance products
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Insurance products
 (a) When providing a loan that features a GAP waiver, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures and forward funds received on waivers as prescribed by the applicable agreement(s) or policy(ies). (AL) Ala. Code ¬ß 8-37-3(g) 
 (b) When requiring customers of auto loans to insure the vehicle and providing said insurance policy, Wells Fargo, as holder of the security interest, must disclose certain limitations in policy coverage to the customer or a transferee on the loan. The written notice must be signed by the customer or the transferee. When Wells Fargo provides a policy as a result of the customer or transferee‚Äôs failure to obtain a policy, the required disclosures must be made in a separate document other than the policy and must be mailed within 30 days of obtaining the policy. (CA) Cal. Veh. Code ¬ß 5604
 (c) Wells Fargo must not condition any extension of credit on a customer obtaining an insurance policy from a particular insurer or producer. (HI, PR) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 431:13-104(a); PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 10(B) Wells Fargo must not solicit insurance before a loan commitment is issued or the loan is approved (HI, PR) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 431:13-104(b); PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 10(A), unless an insurance premium is to be financed as part of the loan. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 431:13-104(b) An offer of insurance, which may be included in a notification approving the loan, and the ultimate insurance contract must comply with applicable statute and regulation. (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 10(A), (C) Wells Fargo must not reject a reasonable contract of insurance, require a separate charge for handling insurance contracts, use or disclose information relative to a contract of insurance for purpose of making a solicitation, or require non-customary procedures or conditions of licensed insurers or producers. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 431:13-104(b) 
 (d) When requiring a residential mortgage loan customer to obtain flood insurance, Wells Fargo must make required form disclosures unless another creditor or creditor‚Äôs representative has already made the required disclosure, and Wells Fargo has retained a record of such timely disclosure. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.01; 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(1); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(3)(a), (b) Certain form disclosures must be mailed or delivered to the customer in a statutory time frame. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(2) When renewing a flood insurance policy, Wells Fargo must make required form disclosures regarding the policy if certain modifications are being made to the loan, if the coverage needed exceeds prior coverage or if otherwise required by statute. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(4)(a), (b)
 (e) When offering an insurance product incident to a consumer loan or line of credit, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) provide a written statement containing statutorily prescribed language in at least 10-point bold typeface. The insurance coverage offered by Wells Fargo must not be in an amount in excess of the payments on the loan or a duration beyond the term of the loan; (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-21(e)
 (ii) provide, at the time an offer is made or within ten days of an oral offer, requisite written disclosures in at least 12-point typeface. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 691C.290
 (f) When requiring customers to maintain hazard insurance as a condition of a real estate loan, Wells Fargo must, at the time of a loan commitment or loan application, deliver to the borrower(s) certain written or electronic disclosures. Where disclosures are made in electronic format, Wells Fargo must follow up with a hard copy within three days or retain records demonstrating that the borrower received and was able to download and print electronic disclosures. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.9(b)
 (g) When offering certain insurance products incident to consumer extensions of credit or through direct mail advertisements, Wells Fargo must make certain clear and conspicuous disclosures in a writing, including certain disclosures in at least 12-point typeface. When the offer of insurance is subsequent to the extension of credit or not through direct mail, requisite disclosures may be provided orally or electronically in the prescribed time frame. (WV) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 114-61-4(4.2), (4.4)(f) When offering to extend insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must make required written disclosures in at least 12-point typeface, and mail such disclosures within ten days of enrollment over the telephone. (WV) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 114-61-4(4.3)

Title: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Goods (including Motor Vehicles)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, CT, GA, HI, ID, IL, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MT, NC, ND, NE, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PR, SC, SD, TN, TX, WA, WV 
 When providing motor vehicle financing, Wells Fargo must provide a written agreement, signed by the parties, containing the agreement of the parties, as well as certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information. 
 1. Retail Installment Contracts
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-604; Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-403(1); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 51-13-02(1), (3); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 51-13-02(2)(e), (3); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 51-13-02(2)(f), (3); Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 45-1028; Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 45-336(1); Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 45-340; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16C-42(a)-(c); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16C-42(d); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16C-42(e)
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Retail Installment Contracts
 (a) When providing a Retail Installment Contract (RIC): 
 (i) Wells Fargo must provide the RIC as a single document and include any financing information between the parties. (AK, IL, KY, MA, PR, WA) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.010(a); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/25(a); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255D, ¬ß 9(A); 10 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 741(1), (3); Wash Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.020 Where more than one contract is used to reflect the agreement between the parties, certain terms must be reflected in the original contract and subsequent contracts. (AK) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.040(a) Wells Fargo may also use multiple documents to reflect a RIC where the contract is not solicited directly to the borrower (such as when ordering from a catalog), and in that event, Wells Fargo must provide the customer with a memo containing requisite contract terms. (AK, KY) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.10.050(a), (b); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß371.290(2) Wells Fargo may enter into a retail installment contract that is contained in more than one document provided that the documents meet the specific requirements set forth in the statute. Title: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Motor Vehicles
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Motor Vehicles
 
 MCR 1152
 
 Covered States: 
 AK, AZ, CA, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MN, MO, MS, NC, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OK, OR, PA, TX, UT, VA, VT, WI 
 
 General Requirement Statement: 
 When offering a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract is signed, written, and fully discloses material terms. In addition, the contract must follow certain formatting and style requirements. Wells Fargo must also provide certain notices, disclosures and itemized information in a separate document, in easily legible and plain language. These notices and disclosures must be delivered to the buyer or lessor within certain designated times. Wells Fargo must also provide a schedule of payments.
 
 1. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 3. Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Non-consumer Loans/Lines 
 4. Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 5. Insurance Products

 1. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Asset Based Loans, Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines, Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Non-consumer Loans/Lines & Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC 
 
 a. In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must not include:
  
 i. a power of attorney, confession of judgment, or an assignment of wages. (MN, NH, KY, TX, PA, OR) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 53C.08(1)(b); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:7(VIII)(1); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(1)(c); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.410; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6228(5); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 83.670(4)

 iii. a provision waiving the retail buyer‚Äôs right to assert a claim or defense against Wells Fargo or third parties arising out the sale or contract or to post a statement on the internet regarding the seller or manufacturer of the vehicle. (TX, NJ, PA) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.412(a) and (b); N.J. Stat. Ann ¬ß 56:12-16.1(a); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-49.1; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6228(7)

 vi. a provision that provides for the payment of attorneys‚Äô fees that do not meet certain criteria. (DE, NY) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(h); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302(7)
  
 vii. an acceleration clause. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6228(2)
  
 viii. a provision that allows the seller or holder of a contract to enter upon the buyer's premises unlawfully. (NY, OR) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302(13)(c); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 83.670(2)
  
 ix. blank spaces. (DE, GA, NH, PA, TX) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(i); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-32(b); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-32(h); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:3-b(V); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6228(1); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.112(b)
  
 x. a credit service charge or delinquency charge that violates statutorily enumerated calculations. (LA, NY, DE, GA, KY, NY) La. Stat. Ann ¬ß 6.969.11(A) and (B)(1); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 303(4), N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 303(1) and (2); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(h); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-32(g); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(1)(d); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302(7)
  
 b. When assigning or being assigned a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer of the assignment and follow other statutorily enumerated procedures, otherwise payment by the retail buyer to the last known holder of the contract shall be binding on all subsequent holders or assignees of the contract. (FL, KY, MN, MO, MS, NH, NM, WI) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.08(4); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(1)(e); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 53C.08(1)(d); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 365.130(1); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 63-19-45; N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:8(IV); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-19-14; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.303; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 218.0142(6)(a)
  
 c. When Wells Fargo purchases, receives, or is assigned a retail installment contract, then Wells Fargo must renew the contract in accordance with applicable state laws. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 492.134(b)
  
 d. When Wells Fargo issues a conditional sale contract, it must contain certain notices and meet certain formatting requirements. (CA) Cal Civ. Code ¬ß 2982(r); Cal Civ. Code ¬ß 2982(h); Cal Civ. Code ¬ß 2982.2; Cal Civ. Code ¬ß 2984.1 
  
 e. When Wells Fargo is acting as a buyer, and the retail installment contract provides that if a buyer rejects or revokes acceptance of the motor vehicle and asserts a security interest in the motor vehicle based on the ground of rightful rejection or justifiable revocation, Wells Fargo must post a bond of the disputed balance or deposit all accrued installment payments into a court registry. (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.07(10)(a)-(b)
  
 f. When offering a conditional sale contract, Wells Fargo must not include certain enumerated provisions. (CA) Cal Civ. Code ¬ß 2984.2(a)-(c)
  
 g. When issuing a retail installment contract, the statutorily required disclosure statements must be no smaller than 18-point font. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. ¬ß 42-179-8(a), (b)
  
 h. When Wells Fargo receives prepayment from a buyer of any portion of a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must refund certain unearned charges, and those unearned charges must be computed in a manner that is at least as favorable to the buyer as the actuarial method. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, ¬ß 10
  
 i. When offering a motor vehicle for sale, Wells Fargo must ensure the agreement has been approved by the Board and Attorney General. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 60-1417
  
 j. When offering a repossessed vehicle for sale, Wells Fargo must:
  
 i. provide enumerated written disclosures in a clear manner. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 41-3-408(2)
  
 ii. obtain the consumer‚Äôs signature on the disclosures prior to completing the sale, lease, or transfer. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 41-3-408(2)(e)
  
 iii. deliver a copy of the signed disclosure to the Motor Vehicle Division within 30 days after the sale, lease, or transfer. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 41-3-408(2)(f)
  
 iv. affix a disclosure statement in conformance with the statute on the lower corner of the windshield furthest from the driver‚Äôs side. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 41-3-408(3)(a)
  
 k. On the Disclosure Form, Wells Fargo must disclose the amount financed as a percentage of the Vehicle Price to determine whether negative equity is being financed in the transaction. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 5(2)
  
 i. Wells Fargo must deliver the Disclosure Form with every motor vehicle installment contract, even if it involves negative equity. (DE, VT) 5-2900-2901 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 5.0; 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 7(1)-(3)
  
 ii. Wells Fargo must attach the Disclosure Form to any subsequent assignment, sale, or transfer of the motor vehicle installment contract. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 7(1)-(3)
  
 iii. When Wells Fargo is acting as a motor vehicle dealer, it must provide the buyer with an unexecuted copy of the Disclosure Form, and it must be signed by the buyer prior to completing the transaction. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 7(1)-(3)
  
 l. In an installment contract, Wells Fargo must state ‚ÄúRETAIL INSTALLMENT CONTRACT‚Äù in at least 10-point bold font above the signature line, as well as include certain liability disclosure language, and a ‚ÄúNotice to Buyer‚Äù. (DE, FL, GA, IL, NM, NY, OR) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(b); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.07(1)(b); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-32(b); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-32(b) ¬ß 10-1-32(d); 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/3(c)(3); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-19-7(D); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302(2)(a)-(c); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 83.520(2); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 83.565(d)
  
 m. Wells Fargo, acting as a licensee, must not make any false or misleading advertisements regarding any part of a motor vehicle retail installment sales contract. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.702(a)
  
 i. When transferring ownership of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must disclose the vehicle‚Äôs mileage in writing to the transferee. Wells Fargo must not knowingly make false statements regarding the mileage or odometer reading or alter in any way any information provided in the mileage disclosure statement. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 342.155(1)(a); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 342.155(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 342.155(3)
  
 n. When Wells Fargo, acting as a licensee, advertises rates, terms, or conditions of a motor vehicle installment transaction, it must comply with federal disclosure requirements. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.702(d)
  
 o. When entering into a non-model standard retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must include a certification of readability. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.802(a) and (b) 
  
 p. To be easily readable, Wells Fargo must use Arial, Calibri, Caslon, Century Schoolbook, Garamond, Helvetica, Scala, or Times New Roman typeface in at least 8-point font for its motor vehicle installment contracts. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.806(b); 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.806(d)
  
 q. In addition to the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner notice requirements, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures including on what type of earnings method Wells Fargo is applying. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.805(a)-(b)
  
 r. Wells Fargo must include a specific disclosure notice to the buyer in 10-point font that is either bold, capitalized, or underlined directly above the buyer‚Äôs signature. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.102(c)
  
 s. Wells Fargo must print the Disclosure Form on an easily distinguishable, separate sheet of paper, in at least 12-point font, and provide a copy to the buyer(s). (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 6
  
 t. When Wells Fargo is entering into a prelease agreement, it must place specific notice language directly above the signature line, in bold-faced capital letters in at least 10-point font, under the heading: NOTICE TO PROSPECTIVE LESSEE. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 218.0144(2)(b)
  
 u. In addition to following the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner‚Äôs instructions, Wells Fargo must submit the retail installment contract in a non-locked text-searchable PDF on 8.5 x 11-inch or 8.5 x 14-inch paper. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.802(c)(2)
  
 v. In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must deliver a copy of the contract to the buyer that shall include all the required disclosures and information about the transaction. Wells Fargo must provide an acknowledgement of delivery to be signed by the buyer, which is printed in at least 12-point type that is bold-faced, capitalized, or underlined, and if contained in the contract, shall appear directly above the buyer‚Äôs signature. (AZ, CA, CT, FL, MI, NH, NM, TX) Ariz Rev. Stat. ¬ß 44-286(B); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2984.3; Fla. Stat. ¬ß 520.07(1)(c) and (e)(7); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 492.112(e); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:7(I)(c), (d); N. H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:7(VI); N.M Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-19-7(C); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.112(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.112(b)
 
 w. When engaged in a contract of the lease or buyback of a vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide certain written disclosure language in the contract in 12-point boldface type and heading in 16-point boldface type. The language of the ‚ÄúDISCLOSURE STATEMENT‚Äù must be boxed and contain a notice warning that the vehicle was previously sold as new and disclosing any defects or conditions subsequently alleged or found. Conn. Agencies Regs. ¬ß 42-179-8(c), (d)
  
 x. When Wells Fargo seeks to include a documentary fee in a retail installment contract, it must meet certain enumerated requirements. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.006(c)(3)
  
 y. When Wells Fargo seeks to amend or correct a retail installment contract, it must confirm so in writing signed by the retail buyer, and then deliver or mail a copy of that confirmation to the buyer. (CA, TX) Cal Civ. Code ¬ß 2984; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.116(1), (2)
  
 z. When Wells Fargo agrees to amend a retail installment contract at the buyer‚Äôs request to extend or defer any or all installments, Wells Fargo must not charge a refinance fee or other fees that exceed certain statutory limitations. (KY, MO, MS) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(1)(f); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 365.130(2); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 365.130(3); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 63-19-39
  
 aa. When the final installment becomes due on a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must give the buyer a 15-day notice before it can charge interest. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/11.2
  
 bb. In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must disclose that any refinancing may be for any period and payment schedule to which the buyer and Wells Fargo agree. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.123(c) and (b)(5)
  
 cc. In an installment contract, Wells Fargo must provide for payment of the time balance in substantially equal times and amounts, except in certain enumerated circumstances. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6221(d)
  
 dd. When Wells Fargo is acting as a retail seller, it must provide the buyer notice in connection with the retail installment contract stating that the retail buyer is not required to accept or provide a debt cancellation agreement to purchase the motor vehicle under a retail installment contract. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.124(d)
  
 ee. When Wells Fargo is a licensee for a motor vehicle title loan, it must provide each borrower with a pamphlet that is in a form consistent with regulations and plainly explains the borrowers‚Äô rights and responsibilities and provides a toll-free number for the Commission for assistance with complaints. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-2215(5)
  
 ff. When completing a motor vehicle installment contract, Wells Fargo must ensure that the Cash Price is consistent on all forms. When motor vehicle rebates are disclosed, Wells Fargo must deduct them from the Cash Price. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 4(3)
  
 gg. When the calculation of the Cash Price includes Optional Items, Wells Fargo must itemize and deduct them from the Cash Price to reach the Vehicle Price. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 5(1)
  
 i. When the calculation of the Cash Price includes Optional Items, Wells Fargo must itemize them on the retail installment contract in a conspicuous manner. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 8
  
 hh. Wells Fargo must compute the finances charged and balance on a retail installment aftcontract based on certain enumerated factors and disclosures. (CA, KY, LA, MI, NH) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2982(g)(2), (3); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(1)(a); La. Admin. Code tit. 46:V, ¬ß 7711(D); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 492.118(1)-(5); NH. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:8(I)-(III) 
  
 ii. When Wells Fargo seeks to include money advanced or debt cancellation agreements in the retail installment contract, it must be included as an itemized charge. (KY, TX) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(7)(b); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.404(d) 
  
 jj. When Wells Fargo receives a request from a buyer for cash receipts or information on current balances or amounts due, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer with such receipts or information in writing. (GA, TX) Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-32(i); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.405(a), (b)
  
 kk. When Wells Fargo wants to ensure the buyer will be responsible upon total loss of the vehicle, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer and require the buyer to sign a separate document that conspicuously discloses that responsibility. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302A(1)
  
 i. When Wells Fargo is statutorily required to offer to waive its contractual right to hold the buyer liable for the gap amount in the event of a total loss of the vehicle, the notice must also fulfill certain enumerated requirements. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302A(1)
  
 ii. When Wells Fargo is acting as retail seller of a debt cancellation agreement for total loss or theft of an ordinary vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer in at least 10 days a copy of the agreement, and the agreement must set forth specific details. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.308(d)
  
  
 ll. When Wells Fargo offers to sell an automobile club membership to a retail buyer, the contract must contain certain enumerated notices to the buyer. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.412(a)and(b)
 
 mm. When entering a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer prior to receiving signature, that the motor vehicle is equipped with electronic tracking technology that may be used by Wells Fargo to verify the operational status of the technology, to service the contract or lease, or to locate the vehicle for repossession. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 598.9715(1), (3); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 598.9715(2)
  
 nn. When Wells Fargo enters into a balloon contract, it must contain certain enumerated provisions. (NH) NH. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:8-a(III)(a); NH. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:8-a(III)(c) and (d); NH. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-A:8-a(V)
  
 oo. When the buyer consents in an installment contract, Wells Fargo must be entitled to a transfer fee not to exceed 10% of the remaining unpaid balance of $25, whichever is less. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 ¬ß 331(1) and (2) 
  
 pp. Wells Fargo must not permit any loan processing fee on a motor vehicle retail installment contract to exceed $200 and must meet other statutory requirements. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-50.075
  
 2. Insurance Products
  
 a. When offering a retail installment contract that includes insurance, Wells Fargo must include certain statutory disclosures pertaining to the type of insurance and scope of coverage, and the insurance must comply with applicable Texas state laws. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.209(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 348.209(b)-(d)
 
 b. When offering a retail installment contract with the option to purchase life insurance, accident and health insurance, or involuntary unemployment insurance, Wells Fargo must include certain disclosure language in 10-point boldface type informing the buyer that: (i) the buyer is not required to purchase credit insurance to obtain credit, and (ii) to receive insurance, the buyer must sign and agree to pay an additional charge. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, ¬ß 10
 
 c. When offering a retail installment contract that includes credit life insurance or credit disability insurance, the installment contract must include a disclosure notice containing information regarding the buyer‚Äôs entitlement to partial refund of any premiums from prepayment of the installment loan. (IL) 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9.02(1) and (2)
 
 d. When offering a retail installment contract that provides for insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must either: (1) ensure that the policy includes public liability coverage protecting the driver against damages from negligent use of the vehicle; or (2) notify to the buyer in writing at the time of the contract that the motor vehicle is not covered by public liability insurance and obtaining a signed acknowledgment from the buyer indicating that he or she has been so notified. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 218.0143(1)-(2)
 
 e. When engaging in a retail installment contract that includes insurance coverage for the buyer, Wells Fargo must provide copies of any policies, certificates of insurance, and other coverage information to the buyer within 30 days of the execution of the retail installment contract, as well as comply with other statutory requirements. (CT, IL, KY, NY, MN, MO, PA, VT) Conn. Agencies Regs. ¬ß A-288-2; 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9; 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9.03; Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 190.100(4); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 302(6); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 53C.08(3); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 365.080(1); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6241(c)(2), (3), (5) and (7); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß 2355(g)
  
 f. When Wells Fargo offers a retail installment contract that includes insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must ensure that the policies or certificates of insurance are written for the full term for which a premium has been charged to the borrower, and Wells Fargo must pay all such premiums to the insurance company for whom the premium was collected. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. ¬ß A-288-4
  
 g. When the retail installment contract charges for insurance, but Wells Fargo is unable to purchase the insurance or the insurance premium cost changes, Wells Fargo must advise the purchaser in writing by certified or registered mail within 5 calendar days of learning of the inability or increase. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 ¬ß 326(1)

Title: PSDR - Force-placed Insurance - Notices Required - Disclosure Before and/or After Force Placement of Collateral Protection Insurance
Summary:
Covered States: AR, CT, DE, FL, HI, IA, IL, IN, MA, ME, MI, MO, MS, NJ, NY, OR, PA, TN, TX, WA, WI, WY
 When Wells Fargo is required to force-place collateral protection insurance, Wells Fargo must provide required disclosures at certain times.
 1. Real Estate Loans 
 2. Other Loans/Lines
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 746.201(4) 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Real Estate Loans 
 
 (a) When force-placed collateral protection insurance is required in connection with Real Estate Loans, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) disclose the requirement to maintain collateral insurance coverage (AK, FL, IL, MA, MI, MO, MS, NJ, NY, PA, TN, TX, WA, WI, WY) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-101-113(a); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 655.946(1), (2); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 180/15(a); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(5); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 500.1625(1),(3); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 427.120(3); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 83-54-21(1); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16V-3(c) and (d); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11, ¬ß 227.2(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.9(b); 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.9(c); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 56-49-113(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 307.052(a); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-551(2)(a); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.207(1); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-317(a). 
 
 (ii) make adequate disclosure, which is accomplished if the agreement requires the debtor to maintain collateral insurance, there were reasonable efforts to notify and a reasonable time to comply, a final notice was sent, and a copy of the creditor-placed insurance coverage policy, if any, was sent (AK, MI, MS, TN) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-101-113(a); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 500.1625(1),(3); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 83-54-25(1) and (3); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 56-49-113(a) and (c).
 
 (iii) provide written notice within a certain time frame either before or after placement of insurance (AK, FL, IL, MA, MO, MS, NJ, PA, WA) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-101-113(a); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 655.946(1), (2); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 180/15(a); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(5); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 427.120(3); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 83-54-21(1)10; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16V-3(c) and (d); Pa. Code ¬ß 59.9(c); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-551(2)(a); provide a second written notice at least 30 days after delivering or mailing the first written notice. (PA, WA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.9(d); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-551(2)(a); and locate the debtor if the required notice is returned undeliverable using its regular procedures for locating debtors and mail a second notice once it is located. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 307.052(f); or send a copy of the force-placed insurance policy to the debtor's last known address. (AK, TN) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-101-113(e); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 56-49-113(e)-(f).
 
 (iv) provide the initial notice about the required collateral insurance in a certain format including at least 12-point type (AK, MI) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-101-113(d); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 500.1625(4) and must provide notice substantially similar to certain required statutory language. (MO, TX, WA) Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 427.120(3); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 307.052(a); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-551(2)(a). 
 (v) provide notice that includes certain information in bold text. (NJ, PA) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16V-3(c) and (d); 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.9(c) and provide a notice entitled "Notice of Placement of Insurance" (IL, MO) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 180/15(a); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 427.125(1). 
 
 (vi) provide to the principal debtor or any joint obligor a notice that includes the required statutory language (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.04(5); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 57.05(1)-(3). 
 (vii) provide written notice through its insurer disclosing that an insurer is staffing the telephones of Wells Fargo, as mortgage servicer, if that is the case, and for subsequent renewal or replacement of the force-placed insurance (NY, PA) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11, ¬ß 227.2(a) and (b)(1); 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 59.9(e).
 (b) When Wells Fargo cancels the insurance prior to expiration, it must provide notice stating that the policy may be cancelled on a date not less than 10 days after the notice is delivered or not less than 13 days after it is mailed. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-453.
 (c) When the insurer cancels the insurance prior to expiration, Wells Fargo must obtain other comparable insurance and furnish a copy of the insurance policy to the buyer (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6241(d)(3).
 (d) When the debtor provides evidence that the required insurance was in place, Wells Fargo must cancel the creditor-placed coverage, deduct costs and interest from the borrower‚Äôs obligation, and not assess any costs for the purchase of collateral protection insurance if the debtor provides evidence that the required evidence was in place (CT, HI, NJ) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-719h(a)(12); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-6(a)(10); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:16V-3(f), (h).
 2. Other Loans/Lines
 (a) When offering a consumer loan secured by a motor vehicle, real property, or other collateral, Wells Fargo must provide notice of placement of collateral insurance coverage and inform the borrower of the amount advanced, any charges, any revised payment schedule, a brief description of the insurance paid, including the type and amount of coverages, within a reasonable time (DE, IA, IN, ME) 5-2200-2201 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 5.0(5.3); 5-2900-2901 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 4.0(4.3); Iowa Code ¬ß 537.2506(1); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-3-208(1); Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 2-506(1).
 (b) When a retail installment contract or retail charge agreement is involved, Wells Fargo must provide written notice of obtained force-placed insurance after the buyer fails to obtain the required coverage (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 345.206(a), (c).

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Evidence of Policy; Notice of Proposed Insurance; Certificate of Insurance Requirements; Contents of Policy
Summary:
PSDR ‚Äì Credit Application Notices ‚Äì Insurance Disclosures - Evidence of Policy; Notice of Proposed Insurance; Certificate of Insurance Requirements; Contents of Policy
 
 Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, DC, DE, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, ME, MI, MO, MT, NC, NH, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, UT, VA, WI, WV
 
 When purchasing credit life insurance and credit disability insurance for consumer loans, Wells Fargo must provide clear state-specific disclosures and notices to the loan debtor, the earliest being at the time the insurance was purchased.
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 054.00 Ark. Code R. ¬ß12(3.1), (3.3), (3.5), (3.6); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß23-87- 111(a),(b)(1),(3); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß20-1621.03(F); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß20-2104(D); Cal. Veh. Code ¬ß5604; Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß33-31-9(c.1); Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 120-2-27-.09(3); Idaho Admin. Code r.18.01.61.011(11)(c); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/9; Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß110.170(e); Me. Stat. tit. 24-A, ¬ß2857(2),(4); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß550.611; N.H. Code R. Admin. Ins. 1201.16(d),(j); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11, ¬ß187.4(c), (d); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß3918.06(A), (B),(D); Or. Admin. R. 836-062-0005(1); S.C Code Ann. ¬ß37-4-105(A),(B); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß47-11-111(a); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß56-7-906 (b)-(c); Tenn. Comp. R. & Regs. 0780-1-4-.04(1)-(3); Utah Admin. Code r.590-91-3(C); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß31A-22-806(1)-(4); W. Va. Code ¬ß33-11A-9(c).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Notice of Insurance
 
 (a) When providing consumer loans that feature credit life or disability insurance, Wells Fargo must: 
 
 (i) deliver to the customer a copy of the policy containing the insurance company‚Äôs contact information, and other requisite information, and terms in a prescribed time frame, the earliest of which is the date the debt is acquired. Title: PSDR - Advertising and Solicitation - Disclosures - Lending Products
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Advertising and Solicitation - Disclosures - Lending Products
 MCR1061
 Covered States: AK, AR, CA, CO, CT, GA, HI, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NB, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OK, OR, PR, TN, TX, VA, VT, WA, WV, WY
 When advertising its lending products, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information within or along with the advertisement in a clear and conspicuous manner. Wells Fargo must comply with all federal advertising disclosures including the Truth-in-Lending Act, Consumer Credit Disclosure Act, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Wells Fargo must not publish an advertisement containing any false, misleading or deceptive statements.
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 12. Insurance Products

 Additional State-Specific Requirements:
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans; Commercial Real Estate Loans; Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Non-Consumer Loans/Lines; and Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 
 a. For secured credit cards, Wells Fargo must identify the card as a ‚Äúsecured credit card,‚Äù describe the security by item or type, and comply with all federal disclosure requirements. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1747.94(a); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1748.11(e)-(i)
 
 b. When Wells Fargo uses a consumer credit report in connection with certain credit transactions, Wells Fargo must include in any solicitation to the customer a statutorily required statement explaining the reason for the solicitation, the consumer‚Äôs right, and qualifying language about extending credit. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1785.20.1(a)(1)-(4) 
 
 c. Wells Fargo must disclose to the consumer that the consumer‚Äôs prequalifying report might be provided to third parties and used in connection with certain credit transactions. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1785.20.1(2) 
 
 d. When Wells Fargo mails out unsolicited materials in more than one state, Wells Fargo must include a notice in large, boldface type stating that credit terms vary by state and that provides the statutorily required disclosure or explains how to obtain the disclosure. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1810.21(b)
 
 e. Wells Fargo must include the amount or percentage of the down payment, the terms of repayment, and the annual percentage rate, along with other prescribed disclosures, in advertisements for a credit sale under a contract providing for the extension of closed-end credit. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-29(b)-(d)
 
 f. Wells Fargo must not advertise a specific periodic consumer credit amount, installment amount, or a specified down payment. In addition, Wells Fargo must state the rate of a finance charge as an annual percentage rate. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/29.1(a)-(c)
 
 g. In order for a catalog or multi-page advertisement to be considered a single advertisement, Wells Fargo must set out the table or schedule clearly and conspicuously and make reference to it when any statement of credit term appears in a different place. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/29.1(e),(f); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 14(a),(b); Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-201(3),(4)
 
 h. Wells Fargo must provide the annual percentage rate for purchases disclosed in at least 18-point type on the solicitation disclosure. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-2(b)(1)
 
 i. Wells Fargo must include in solicitations to open a credit card under a revolving loan account information on the rate, any annual, membership or periodic fees, minimum finance and transaction charges, the repayment date and the balance calculation method. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(1)
 
 j. Wells Fargo must disclose all fees imposed for late payments, extensions of credit in the form of cash, and extensions of credit in excess of the authorized amount for such account in its credit and charge card solicitations. Wells Fargo must also provide information on the annual, membership or periodic fees, transaction or other charges, and the payment due date in those solicitations. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(2); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(5)(a)(b)
 
 k. Wells Fargo must not include the specific terms of an open-ended credit plan in an advertisement to aid promote, or assist directly or indirectly the extension of consumer credit unless certain conditions are met. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 14(c)
 l. Wells Fargo must not create rate statements that vary from the accurately computed rate by more than specified amounts. The annual percentage rate (APR) must not be more than .125% greater or less than the actual rate. The administrator must not allow a tolerance greater than 8% of that rate for rate tables or charts except to simplify compliance where irregular payments are involved. Reference specific Wyoming requirements for consumer loans payable in substantially equal installments. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-323(1); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-225
 m. Wells Fargo must not solicit, advertise, or enter into a contract for specific interest rates, points, or other financing terms unless the terms are actually available at the time of soliciting, advertising, or contracting from a person exempt from licensing or a lender with whom the mortgage broker maintains a written correspondent or loan broker agreement. Wells Fargo also must not advertise any rate of interest without conspicuously disclosing the annual percentage rate implied by such a rate of interest. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.0201(5),(10)
 n. Wells Fargo must follow certain requirements for accuracy and reliability when advertising, such as not using the term ‚Äòfree‚Äô or any other similar term suggesting there is no cost to the applicant. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-440(1)-(4)and (6)-(9)
 
 o. Wells Fargo must (1) register leased vehicles, (2) identify specific vehicle in its inventory with its vehicle identification number, and (3) must not refuse to lease an available vehicle to any creditworthy person at the advertised total lease amount. N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:26(I)-(IV).
 
 p. When Wells Fargo advertises examples or tables of periodic payments under a flat payment plan, Wells Fargo must include all charges to the borrower as well as interest and principal. When only principal and interest payments are advertised, Wells Fargo must include a clear statement of the rate of charge or the total amount of charge. In all such advertising, the total number and frequency of payments must be specified. (AK) Alaska Admin. Code tit. 3, ¬ß 12.290
 
 q. When Wells Fargo advertises extensions of consumer credit under an open-end credit plan, Wells Fargo must include the cash price and the amount or percentage of down payment, if any, the monthly or other periodic payment, the number of payments or the period of repayment, the total amount of all payments, and whether the monthly or other periodic payment is calculated on the assumption that the purchaser has no outstanding balance due under the open-end credit plan if that is the case, the amount of the finance charge and any periodic rate that may be applied expressed as an annual percentage rate, any minimum, fixed, transaction, activity, or similar charge and any membership or participation fee that could be imposed, the name of the creditor, if not the seller, and whether the advertised terms are available to the purchaser only after the creditor‚Äôs approval if that is the case. (CA, HI) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 17538.7(a), (c); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-29(a), (c)
 
 r. When Wells Fargo advertises open-end credit in a catalog or multiple-page advertisements, it must include all appropriate disclosures for a representative scale of amounts up to the level of the more commonly sold higher-priced property or services offered. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 17538.7(b)(2)
 
 s. When advertising for motor vehicles, Powersports vehicles, and leases of the same, Wells Fargo must follow the rules laid out in the statute to avoid being construed as misleading or inaccurate. (CO) 1 Colo. Code Regs. 205-1, Regulation ¬ß 44-20-121(3)(i)(Rule1)-(Rule19); 1 Colo. Code Regs. 205-2, Regulation ¬ß 44-20-420(3)(i)(Rule1)-(Rule19)
 
 t. Wells Fargo must not advertise any rate of interest or finance charge pertaining to any consumer credit transactions other than a rate stated in simple interest terms or in terms compliant with the applicable federal statute. (GA) Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-4-4(a)-(c)
 
 u. When an advertisement includes a rate or amount of interest, Wells Fargo must state that rate as an annual percentage rate of interest charged. In addition, other charges must be stated separately. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 205/4a(h)
 
 v. Wells Fargo must only advertise ‚Äúnew reduced rates‚Äù or similar phrases for 60 days or less following the effective date of the reduction in rates. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 110.190(c)
 
 w. Wells Fargo must disclose the proceeds of the loan and the number and amount of installments in advertisements mentioning the payment schedule for a loan. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 110.190(g)
 
 x. Wells Fargo must only advertise at its business locations or other locations approved by the state regulator. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 110.190(i)
 
 y. Wells Fargo must conspicuously display the notice spelled out in the statute:
 
 i. in 14 point bold type on loan documents (IN) Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-7-301(2),(3); and 
 
 ii. in 1 inch bold print at its business location. (IN) Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-7-301(2),(3)
 
 z. When advertising in print, Wells Fargo must make sure the information is close to the terms it relates to and of sufficient prominence in terms of print style, size and contrast as compared with the remainder of the advertisement so as to be readily noticeable. (OR) Or. Admin. R. 137-020-0020(2)(j)
 
 aa. When advertising in print, Wells Fargo must use at least 10 point font with the exception of the PRB, which must be at least half of the largest font size used in the promotion but never less than 12 points. (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(D)
 
 bb. Wells Fargo must disclose the terms of repayment and the percentage of funding charges, expressed in terms of the annual percentage rate, when advertising a credit extension. (PR) PR Reglamento 5782, Art. 5(C)
 cc. Wells Fargo must not refer to supervision or control by the state, the Attorney General, the Commissioner of Banking, the Division of Banking, or any other state agency, in any advertising. (WV) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-4-2(2.3)(b)
 dd. When entering into consumer vehicle leases, Wells Fargo must not state the amount of any monthly payment, or state a capitalized cost reduction or other payment required before or at delivery, unless it also states: that the transaction advertised is a lease; the total amount due at delivery; the number, amount, and due dates or period of scheduled payments; a statement of whether or not a security deposit is required; and a disclosure of the lessee's liability at the end of an open-end lease. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(8)
 ee. When making any advertisement to directly or indirectly assist a consumer lease, Wells Fargo must state that the advertisement offers a lease rather than a vehicle sale. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(7)
 ff. When making an advertisement to directly or indirectly assist any credit sale of a vehicle, Wells Fargo must not state: the amount or percentage of the down payment required; that no down payment is required; the amount of any payment or the number of payments or the period of repayment; the amount of any finance charge; or that there is no charge for credit, unless it also provides certain required notices. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(6)
 gg. When making any advertisement to directly or indirectly assist an extension of credit, Wells Fargo must not state that a specific amount of credit or installment amount can be arranged unless the creditor usually arranges or will arrange credit amounts or installments for that period and in that amount. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(5)
 hh. Wells Fargo must not advertise or offer any rebate that is payable to the consumer which the consumer may apply to purchase any rebate except a rebate offered by the dealer's franchise manufacturer or a financial institution that is affiliated with the dealer's franchise manufacturer. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(40(o) 
 ii. When offering multiple rebates that apply to the same vehicle(s) or model(s) but are not available in combination, Wells Fargo must not advertise or offer those rebates in any manner that implies that they are available in combination, such as by adding them together. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(40(o)
 jj. Wells Fargo must not advertise or offer any rebate that requires the dealer‚Äôs financial participation without a clear disclosure that states: Dealer participation in this rebate program may increase vehicle price before rebate. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(40(o)
 kk. For a rebate offered by a dealer‚Äôs manufacturer, Wells Fargo must not advertise or offer a sum total of multiple rebates or a vehicle price that incorporates any rebate unless more than 50% of individuals who acquired vehicles in the state of Washington from the manufacturer's franchised dealers in the preceding 12 months would have qualified for each rebate. For a rebate offered by a financial institution that is affiliated with the dealer's manufacturer, Wells Fargo must not advertise or offer a sum total of multiple rebates or a vehicle price that incorporates any rebate unless more than 50% of individuals in the state of Washington who applied in the preceding 12 months to the financial institution for financing for the acquisition of a vehicle produced by the franchised manufacturer would have qualified for the rebate. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(40(o)
 ll. Wells Fargo must not advertise that a new vehicle or model or type of vehicle will be leased or sold for a certain amount above or below invoice or cost without disclosing the actual dollar amount being referred to as invoice; stating the final, total price for each vehicle; and computing invoice as the actual cost to the dealer to get each vehicle from the manufacturer. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 308-66-152(4)(m)
 mm. When making a radio advertisement or advertisement communicated by telephone that is used to promote short-term loans, Wells Fargo must include a disclosure statement that lasts at least 2 seconds and is spoken so that its contents can be easily understood. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1819
 nn. When making a television advertisement which is used to promote short-term loans, Wells Fargo must include a visual disclosure legend that includes 20 scan lines in size. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1819
 oo. When making any print media advertisement, including any website, used to promote short-term loans, Wells Fargo must include conspicuous disclosure statements, except that if a single advertisement consists of multiple pages, folds, or faces, the disclosure requirement applies only to one page, fold, or face. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1819(C); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1819
 pp. When making any advertising materials used to promote short-term loans that includes the amount of any payment, expressed either as a percentage or dollar amount, or the amount of any finance charge, Wells Fargo must include a statement of the interest, fees and charges, expressed as an annual percentage rate, payable using examples of a $300 loan repaid in 3 months, a $500 loan repaid in 5 months, and a $1,000 loan repaid in 10 months. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1819(B)
 qq. Wells Fargo must include a statement that if the buyer does not wish to make the purchase on credit, he or she can prepay the obligation within 15 days of receipt of the notice for an amount identified in the notice and avoid the payment of any credit service charge. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-305(2)
 rr. When conducting radio advertisements for consumer leases, Wells Fargo must clearly and conspicuously include certain statements and information as required by the statute. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-313(13)(c)(i)
 ss. Wells Fargo must advertise the service charge in the required form and the amount of the service charge or installment payments with the rate of credit service charge and the terms of repayment. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-313(2), (6)
 tt. Wells Fargo must accurately advertise vehicle leases. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2003(a)
 uu. Wells Fargo must follow specific requirements when mailing a solicitation for a cash loan to a Minnesota resident that includes a facsimile check payable to the addressee. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 47.605(4)
 vv. When using a borrower‚Äôs current loan information in an advertisement which is not obtained from a solicitation, application, or loan, Wells Fargo must provide the name and source of the information; a statement that it is not affiliated with the borrower's lender; and the information disclosed must be in the same size type font as the rest of the information in the advertisement. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-440(10)
 ww. Wells Fargo must not advertise with envelopes or stationery, or by using images in an electronic format, that are designed to resemble a government mailing or other method of communication that suggest an affiliation that does not exist. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-630(1)
 xx. Wells Fargo must not engage in certain types of advertising unless specific conditions are met (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:17-7.3(a); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:17-7.3(b)-(d)
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate and Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not advertise that mortgage loans will be made within a specified time after the mortgage loan application is received, make claims that cannot reasonably be fulfilled or supported, indicate that mortgage loans are available to borrowers with ‚Äúprevious bankruptcy‚Äù, ‚Äúno credit‚Äù, ‚Äúbad credit‚Äù, or similar language, unless the advertisement clearly explains any limitations that apply, or states that ‚Äúcertain limitations apply, call for details.‚Äù (AR) 214.00 Ark. Code R. ¬ß 5013-1(c)(1)-(4),(6)-(9).
 
 b. When using a borrower‚Äôs current loan information, Wells Fargo must include a statement that it is not affiliated with the borrower‚Äôs lender, mortgage banker, or mortgage servicer in at least 8 point type size font, otherwise it will be deemed misleading. (AR) 214-00-009 Ark. Code R. ¬ß 5013-1(c).
 
 c. For residential mortgage loan products, Wells Fargo must only advertise products and terms that are available at the time they are offered or otherwise disclose any limitations, comply with state and federal disclosure requirements, not make any misleading or deceptive statements, and incorporate the final Interagency Guidance on Nontraditional Mortgage Product Risks. (CO) 4 Colo. Code Regs. 725-3, Chapter 5(A),(C),(D),(E),(F),(G); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 12-10-713(a),(aa),(cc) .
 
 d. When advertising, Wells Fargo must not make any misrepresentation with respect to its identity, use a simulated check or comparison to a hypothetical loan, unless the advertisement provides further information as dictated by the statute, and make representations such as ‚Äúeligible‚Äù, ‚Äúpreapproved‚Äù or similar, without also disclosing in similar size print the prerequisites to qualify for the residential mortgage loan. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-497(a).
 
 e. Wells Fargo must provide written disclosure to the consumer when it receives compensation both for making the residential mortgage loan and for real estate broker or agent services in connection with the same transaction. (KS) Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-2-310(1)(e).
 
 f. Wells Fargo must use the words ‚ÄúMortgage Banker Institution‚Äù or ‚ÄúMortgage Banker‚Äù in a font size of not less than half of the largest letter in the notice providing services for the provision of mortgage loans. (PR) PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 3.12(a)(1).
 g. Wells Fargo must clearly disclose whether a payment advertised or offered for a residential mortgage loan includes amounts for taxes, insurance, or other products sold to the borrower, and it must clearly disclose the APR implied by the rate of interest when advertising a rate of interest. Wells Fargo also must not engage in unfair or deceptive advertising practices; make false or deceptive statements or representations with regard to the rates, points, or other financing terms or conditions for a residential mortgage loan; must not engage in bait and switch advertising; and must not advertise rates, programs, or terms that are not actually available at the time. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-500(3)(f),(l),(m)(ix),(n) and (q)
 h. When making an advertisement that states or implies that a consumer can reduce his or her monthly payment by refinancing his or her current mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must clearly and conspicuously disclose to the consumer that by refinancing the consumer's existing loan, the consumer's total finance charges may be higher over the life of the loan. (VA) 10 Go. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-60(F), (H)
 i. Wells Fargo must include all disclosures required by the Commissioner of Mortgage Lending in all advertisements. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 645B.189(2)
 j. When advertising a mortgage loan payment with a pre-payment penalty, Wells Fargo must include a statement indicating that there is a pre-payment penalty. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.2(g)
 k. Wells Fargo must refrain from making certain statements in advertising. (MT) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-9-124.1(6)-(8) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-9-149(2),(3)
 3. Insurance Products
 
 a. When referencing specifics in a policy, Wells Fargo must also advertise the exceptions, reductions, and limitations affecting the basic provisions of the policy and disclose the extent to which a preexisting condition may prevent recovery. (KY) 806 Ky. Admin. Regs. 12:010(3)(3)

Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Servicer Disclosures - Borrower Requested Disclosures and Notices
Summary:
Covered States: AR, CA, CO, DE, GA, HI, IN, LA, MA, MD, ME, MN, NC, NY, PA, SC, TX, VA 
 Upon receiving request for information from borrower, other lienholders or authorized parties, a loan servicer or financial institution must respond timely and with accurate and complete information. 
 1. Consumer Lending (excluding loans secured by real property);
 2. Deposit Accounts;
 3. Home Mortgage Lending and Other Real Estate Transactions;
 4. Other 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: N/A
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Lending 
 (a) When acting as loan servicer or lienholder listed on motor vehicle certificate of title, Wells Fargo must provide account status and pertinent information about secured indebtedness.
