(AR, GA, MA, MN) Ark. Code ¬ß 27-14-909(d), (c); Ga. Code ¬ß 40-3-57; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 90D, ¬ß 25; Minn. Stat ¬ß 168A.21(1).
 (b) When acting as loan servicer on a line of credit and upon written request by borrower, Wells Fargo must close the account, apply the payoff funds to the remaining balance and release/reconvey the collateral securing loan (CA, NY, SC) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2943.1(d) and (e); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 352; S.C. Code ¬ß 37-2-302(3).
 (c) When acting as loan servicer and upon written request by borrower, Wells Fargo must provide copy of complete credit application (CA)Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.202(d); and a copy of the obligation evidencing the loan (DE) Del Code Tit. 5, ¬ß 2239;
 (d) When acting as loan originator, Wells Fargo must disclose loan information, annual percentage rate, points and fees on covered loans (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4979.
 2. Deposit Accounts
 (a) When serving as a banking institution for deposit accounts or money market deposits, Wells Fargo must provide account information to allow the depositor to calculate interest yield. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs, Tit. 3, ¬ß 13.7(c)
 
 3. Home Mortgage Lending and Other Real Estate Transactions
 (a) When servicing a senior lien, Wells Fargo must respond in 10 days after receipt of a written request by a junior lienholder for information about the senior lien account (MN) Minn. Stat ¬ß 582.32(3)(e);
 (b) When servicing a mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must respond to Qualified Written Requests (QWR) within the timeline set forth by state and federal laws and regulations (AK, NC) 109-03-003.8 Ark. Code R. ¬ß C; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 45-93(1);
 (c) When acting as loan servicer, upon receipt of a written request, Wells Fargo must provide a payment history (HI, NY, SC) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(e)(2); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs, Tit. 3, ¬ß 419.4(b); S.C. Code ¬ß 37-2-302(3);
 (d) When acting as a lender, Wells Fargo must disclose at or prior to the closing that the loan is subject to possible transfer, sale or assignment (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.148.030(1).
 4. Ancillary Products
 (a) When servicing a residential mortgage loan, upon written request by borrower, Wells Fargo must provide a response to the request to cancel PMI or Private Mortgage Insurance within thirty days (MN) Minn. Stat ¬ß 47.207(4)(a).
 5. Other Provisions
 (a) Borrowers‚Äô requests to Wells Fargo as loan servicer, creditor or assignee must be in writing (AK, CA, CO, GA, IN, LA, MA, MN, NC, NY, PA, SC, TX) 109-03-003.8 Ark. Code R. ¬ß C; Ark. Code ¬ß 27-14-909(d), (c); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.202(d); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-103(h); Ga. Code ¬ß 40-3-57; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.4-2-201(1); ; Ind. Code¬ß 24-4.5-2-209(3); La. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6:1096(H)(1); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 90D, ¬ß 25; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183, ¬ß 54D(a); Minn. Stat ¬ß 168A.21(1); Minn. Stat ¬ß 168A.21(2); Minn. Stat ¬ß 47.207(4)(a); Minn. Stat ¬ß 582.32(3)(e); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 45-93(1); N.Y. Banking Law¬ß 352; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6326; 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(7); 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(12); S.C. Code ¬ß 37-2-302(3); Tex. Fin. Code ¬ß 348.405(a), (b).
 (b) When acting as a loan servicer or creditor, upon request by the borrower, Wells Fargo must provide written pay off statement (CO, HI, IN, LA, MA, ME, NY, VA) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-103(h); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(g); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.4-2-201(1); Ind. Code¬ß 24-4.5-2-209(3); La. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6:1096(H)(1); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183, ¬ß 54D(a); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183, ¬ß 54D(b); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183, ¬ß 54D(c); Me. Stat tit. 9-A, ¬ß 9-305-B; N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs, Tit, 3, ¬ß 419.4(d); Va. Code ¬ß 6.2-1818.2(A),(C) and (D).
 (c) When acting as a loan servicer or creditor and upon request by borrower, Wells Fargo must provide written statement of account, accounting or account status (HI, NC, PA, SC, TX, VA) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-5(e)(2); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-6(a)(15); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 454M-6(a)(19); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 45-93(1); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6326; 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(7); 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(12); S.C. Code ¬ß 37-2-302(3); Tex. Fin. Code ¬ß 348.405(a), (b); Va. Code ¬ß 6.2-1818.2(A),(C) and (D).
 (d) When the owner of assets subject to a lien submits a written request, a judgment creditor with a lien securing a money judgment for child support must disclose the amount of the judgment debt (MN) Minn. Stat ¬ß 168A.21(2);
 (e) When originating a loan with two or more borrowers, Wells Fargo may send the statement with specific required language to any one of the borrowers unless the other borrowers submit a request to receive a copy of the statement (MD) Md. Code, Com. Law ¬ß 12-308(a)(2).

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - Loan Application
Summary:
Covered States: CA, CT, DC, GA, IL, IN, MA, MD, ME, NC, NH, NV, NY, OK, PR, SC, TX, WA, WI, WV
 
 When engaged in the provision of certain consumer credit transactions, loans, mortgages, or leases, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures, notifications, and/or other information at the time of loan application, often in a particular format and/or within a particular time frame.
 
 1. Consumer Lending (excluding loans secured by real property);
 2. Home Mortgage Lending and Other Real Estate Transactions;
 3. Consumer Credit Cards; and
 4. Other Products
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Home Mortgage Lending and Other Real Estate
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must take the following actions in connection with certain mortgage transactions:
 
 (i) When engaging in a mortgage or other similar loan secured by real property, Wells Fargo must meet certain requirements or provide certain disclosures and/or other information to the borrower, often in a particular format, either at the time of application or within a particular time frame after receipt of the application; (CA, CT, DC, GA, IL, IN, MD, NH, NY, OK, PR, TX, WA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2971(a),(c), Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 49-6d(a),(b), Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-726(b), D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1114(a)(8), Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1014(1), Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(2), Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1110, Ind. Code ¬ß 24-5-23.5-8(a), Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-125(b)(1), Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-1022(b)(1), (2), Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(C), Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(B)(4), Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(A), (C), N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 397-A:16-a(VII), N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.4(a), N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(a), Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-309(1), 32 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 2883, Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 156.004(a),(b), 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 153.45(4)(A), Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.030(1), Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 31.04.102(3), Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-510(1)
 
 (ii) When engaging in a mortgage transaction, Wells Fargo must include certain requirements, information, and/or disclosures in or with the mortgage loan application; (DC, NY) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1116.1, D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1116.2, N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 9-o(2), N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.4(d)
 
 (iii) When engaged in a reverse mortgage loan transaction, Wells Fargo must meet certain requirements, and/or provide certain disclosures or other information to an applicant, beforeor upon accepting an application; (MA, NY, WV) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 167E, ¬ß 7(d), N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 79.9(a)(d), W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-19-11(11.1)
 
 (iv) When engaged in a mortgage transaction, Wells Fargo must provide a disclosure summarizing the loan terms in a particular format; (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(1), Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(4)(a). Wells Fargo must provide the initial disclosure summary within 3 business days of receiving a completed loan application; (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(2)
 
 (v) When engaging in a mortgage transaction, Wells Fargo as a mortgage broker/agent or mortgage banker, acting in a dual capacity as a real estate broker/salesperson, must provide the borrower with certain disclosures in a specified format (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.235(1); Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645E.290(2); (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.235(2)
 
 (b) When engaging in any extension of credit secured by a consumer‚Äôs dwelling subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, Wells Fargo must provide good faith estimates and certain disclosures within 3 business days of receiving an application; (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-310(1). Wells Fargo must follow a particular format when providing these disclosures; (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-310(2)
 
 (c) When engaging in a closed-end credit transaction, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures in writing, and in a particular format; (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-1(a)(1). Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures relating to estimates and per-diem interest; (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-1(c)(2)
 
 (d) When engaging in a revolving charge or loan account plan which is secured by a consumer‚Äôs principal dwelling, Wells Fargo must provide a clear and conspicuous statement of the time the application must be submitted, and whether the terms are subject to change. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.2(f)(i), Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(f)(i)
 
 (e) When engaging in a closed-end credit transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, Wells Fargo must disclose certain information before consummation or within three business days after receiving an application; (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(1), Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(5)(B)
 
 (f) When engaging in a credit sale of a purchaser-occupied manufactured home, Wells Fargo must provide certain estimated disclosures not less than two days before consummation of the transaction; S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-309(A)
 
 2. Consumer Lending (excluding loans secured by real property)
 
 (a) When engaging in a retail installment transaction, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures and/or other information with the application, or within a particular time frame; (CA, IL) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1810.1(a)-(g), 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/25(d)
 
 (b) When engaging in a nontraditional loan or adjustable rate loan transaction, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures within three business days after receipt of a completed application, or before the borrower becomes obligated on the note, whichever is earlier; (CA) Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1436(d)
 
 (c) When engaging in a small dollar loan transaction, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures in a writing with no smaller than 12-point type font, at the time of the application; (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22370(a)(3)
 
 (d) When providing a loan to a borrower who is a covered military service member, Wells Fargo must meet certain requirements and make certain disclosures; (NC) N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 53-180.1(b)(1), (4) 
 
 (e) When providing certain loans which include an offer for an automobile club membership in connection with the loan, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures concerning the membership; (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 83.837(c)
 
 (f) When engaging in a consumer lease transaction with a cosigner involved, Wells Fargo must provide certain notice to the cosigner in a particular format; (WV) W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-2-104(c)
 
 3. Consumer Credit Card
 
 (a) When engaging in a credit or charge card account transaction, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures on or with a solicitation or application, in a particular format; (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-2(a)(2)
 
 4. Other Products
 
 (a) When engaged in certain credit transactions, Wells Fargo must provide disclosures regarding certain credit terms in Spanish; (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 90.702 
 
 (b) When engaged in the offering/solicitation of an extension of credit, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures in a particular format; (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 100.315(2)(b)(1)-(3)
 
 (c) When using credit information as an insurer, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures either on the insurance application or at the time the insurance application is taken; (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 24-A, ¬ß 2169-B(3)

Title: PSDR - Commitment and Rate-lock Agreements - Required, Restricted, or Prohibited Terms
Summary:
Covered States: CT, D.C., FL, MO, NJ, NM, NY, OR, PA, TN, VA, VT, WA
 
 Wells Fargo must include certain required terms in writing when it provides commitment agreements and rate lock agreements to borrowers prior to a residential mortgage loan closing when Wells Fargo is engaged in the sale or offering of residential mortgage loans.
 
 Lending Product (loan, lines and leases) ‚ÄìAsset Based Loans
 Lending Product (loan, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 Lending Product (loan, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Real Estate
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 (D.C.) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1117.4 ‚Äì 1117.5; D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1117.1; (N.J.) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.4(a); (N.M.) N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21-31(F); (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(c); (PA) 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(11); (VA) 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-30(B); 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-30(A); Vt. Code R. ¬ß 4(A).
 
 Additional State-Specific Requirements:
 
 1. Commitment Agreements and Letters
 a. D.C., Virginia and Vermont contain the most restrictive requirements for the terms that must be included in a Commitment Agreement above and beyond the terms of the name of the mortgage lender, the principal amount and term of the loan including interest rate, and the amount of any commitment fee. (D.C.) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1117.1; (VA) 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-30(A); (VT) Vt. Code R. ¬ß 4 (A) 
 b. When Wells Fargo enters into a loan pursuant to a valid contract for commitment, it shall not exceed the maximum lawful rate in effect on the date of such commitment and it must meet other requirements regarding the interest rate (MO) Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408.030(1).
 c. In each commitment it shall issue, Wells Fargo must include a list of all documents foreseeably required to be produced and conditions foreseeably required to be satisfied for closing of a mortgage loan based on information provided by the applicant. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(c).
 d. No later than twelve business days prior to the expiration of any commitment period, Wells Fargo must mail to each applicant for a mortgage loan a notice indicating the date of such expiration together with a request that the applicant contact the lender immediately to discuss the conditions precedent to the closing of such loan. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(c).
 e. When Wells Fargo issues an Optional Short Form Commitment Letter instead of a commitment letter when a Closing Disclosure is Required by Federal Regulation Z, the Short Form Commitment Letter must be delivered concurrently with the Reg Z Closing Disclosure and it must meet other requirements (VT) 21-010-010 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 4(B).
 f. Wells Fargo must sign the commitment letters it issues and the commitment letter requirements must be grouped together in a meaningful way, and/or (ii) bolded or otherwise made easily distinguishable from the remainder of the text. (VT) 21-010-010 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 4(A). 
 
 2. Lock In and Rate Lock Agreements
 a. D.C., Oregon and Virginia contain the most restrictive requirements for the terms that must be included in a Rate Lock Agreement above and beyond the general terms of the interest rate, expiration date, discount points, commitment fees and lock in fees. (D.C.) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1117.4 ‚Äì 1117.5; (OR) Or. Admin. R. 441-865-0060(1)(c); (VA) 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-30(B).
 b. When Wells Fargo acts as a mortgage lender and enters into a lock-in agreement with the borrower, both Wells Fargo and the borrower must execute the agreement, and the lock-in agreement must contain specific terms. (D.C.) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1117.4 ‚Äì 1117.5.
 c. When Wells Fargo acts as a mortgage lender, it cannot commit to a first mortgage loan applicant that the lender will make the loan at a specified rate except by issuing a mortgage rate lock-in, and the period for which the terms are locked in is at least as long as Wells Fargo‚Äôs good faith estimate of the anticipated time from when the mortgage loan application is submitted to the lender to the time when such lender will be ready to close such loan. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-706(a)(1).
 d. There is a minimum period for which the terms may be locked in. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-706(a)(2).
 e. When Wells Fargo enters into a mortgage rate lock-in with an applicant, the mortgage rate lock-in must be considered void and evidenced by a new mortgage rate lock in if the applicant chooses to change the type or amount of a first mortgage loan for which application is made, or does not qualify for a particular type or amount of first mortgage loan and chooses to apply for another. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-706(d)(4).
 f. Wells Fargo must sign any lock-in agreement it receives in the mail or the mortgage broker receives in order for the lock-in agreement to become effective. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-40.155(2); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 494.0069(3); (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.4(d).
 g. Wells Fargo must promptly refund any lock-in fee paid by the borrower if a borrower rescinds the lock-in agreement before a written confirmation of the agreement has been signed by Wells Fargo and mailed to the borrower pursuant to its contractual relationship with the borrower. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-40.155(2); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 494.0069(3); (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.4(d).
 h. Wells Fargo must ensure that Lock In Agreements include a statement that includes the provisions of N.J.A.C. 3:1-16.6(a) (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.4(a).
 i. Wells Fargo must include a list of all documents typically required to be produced and conditions typically required to be satisfied for closing of a mortgage loan based on information provided by the applicant in each lock-in agreement it issues. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(c).
 j. Wells Fargo must mail to each applicant for a mortgage loan a notice indicating the date of the lock-in expiration with a request that the applicant contact Wells Fargo immediately to discuss the conditions precedent to the closing of such loan no later than twelve business days prior to the expiration of any lock-in period, (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(c).
 k. Wells Fargo will satisfy the requirements for lock in agreements when it is in compliance with 12 CFR 1026.37 (relating to content of disclosures for certain mortgage transactions (Loan Estimate)) (PA) 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6121(11).
 l. Wells Fargo must provide the borrower with a new rate lock agreement within three business days of a change in the locked interest rate. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-510(5).
 
 3. Fee Provisions for Lock In and Lock Rate Agreements
 a. When Wells Fargo acts as a mortgage loan company, it must ensure that a Lock in Agreement includes any fees required for an extension of the lock-in period. (NM) N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21-31(F).
 b. When Wells Fargo collects commitment fees, the fees must be limited to compensation which is fair and reasonable for the detriment suffered or the commitment made by the lender, considering the condition of the money market, the interest rates then prevailing, the credit worthiness of the borrower, the likelihood of the loan being made, and the interest rate and other terms contained in the loan commitment. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-14-113(b).
 c. Wells Fargo cannot charge a rate lock fee to the borrower unless it is agreed to in writing by the borrower and Wells Fargo cannot retain the fee if the borrower rescinds the loan under Regulation Z, if the borrower does not qualify for a loan, or if the loan is denied based on the property appraisal. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-555(3)(b)(iv).

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices and Acknowledgments - Unconscionability
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices and Acknowledgments ‚Äì Unconscionability
 
 MCR0001006
 
 Covered States: CO, ID, IN, KS, MA, ME, NC, NJ, NM, OH, OK, VA, WI, WY
 
 For the products listed below, Wells Fargo must not include unconscionable terms in customer contracts.
 
 1. Insurance products
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 12. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 38-40-105(1)(d); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-5-108(1),(2); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1345.03(B)(1)-(7).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 (a) Wells Fargo must not use mortgage loan agreements that are unconscionable given the terms and circumstances of the transaction, otherwise a clause or the contract as a whole may be found unconscionable by a court so long as the charge or practice is not expressly permitted by state law (CO, KS, NC). Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 38-40-105(2)(a),(b); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-5-108(1); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25A-43(b).
 (b) For its mortgage loan products, Wells Fargo must not use agreements containing an unconscionable arbitration clause, unconscionable clause requiring the consumer to pay the supplier's attorney's fees, or unconscionable liquidated damages clause included in a mortgage loan contract (OH). Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1345.031(C)(1).
 
 2. All of the lending products listed above. 
 (a) Wells Fargo must not enter into a settlement agreement in which the debtor agrees to waive or forego rights or benefits (ID). Idaho Code ¬ß 28-41-106(4).
 (b) Wells Fargo must not use agreements requiring a borrower to assert claims or defenses in a forum outside of the jurisdiction in a more costly, slower, and less convenient forum, when that borrower could have brought claims or defenses in a forum within the state, and Wells Fargo must not limit claims or defenses that the borrower would have had (MA, ME, NJ, NM). Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183C, ¬ß 13; Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 8-506(6)(I); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-26(e); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21A-5(C).
 (c) Wells Fargo must ensure that, with respect to surviving spousal elections and waivers, it provides a fair and reasonable disclosure of the property or financial obligations of the decedent and written disclosures that were expressly and voluntarily waived (VA). Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 64.2-308.14(B)(2).
 (d) Wells Fargo must not issue a credit card in the name of any person unless that person has personally requested Wells Fargo open an account and issue the card (WI). Wis. Admin. Code DFI-WCA ¬ß 1.86.
 
 3. Insurance products
 (a) Wells Fargo must not charge insurance rates or charges that are unconscionable based on several factors, including the benefits to the debtor, credit's need for the insurance, and relationship between the amount of credit and benefits provided; however, the amount, term, or charge for insurance is not unconscionable if Wells Fargo complies with other applicable provisions of state law (CO, ID, IN, KS, OK, WY). Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-4-106(1), (2); Idaho Code ¬ß 28-44-106(1)-(2); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-4-106(1)-(2); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-4-106(1)-(2); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 4-106(1), (2); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-406(a), (b).

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Credit Sale or Lease
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Credit Sale or Lease
 
 MCR 1008
 
 Covered State: WA 
 
 When offering the products listed below, Wells Fargo must not use a security interest in real property, personal property, or fixtures of the buyer to secure payment. Additionally, for the products listed below, when entering into a retail installment contract or lender credit card agreement, Wells Fargo must not require the buyer to waive a claim or defense arising from the sale, or submit to a lawsuit in a county other than the county where the buyer signed the contract, lives, or has its principal place of business.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer ‚Äì Products 
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.125; Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.150.

Title: PSDR - Retail Leases - Motor Vehicles - Requirements
Summary:
Wells Fargo must deliver requisite disclosures, notices and contracts when engaging in consumer and commercial lease transactions and motor vehicle purchase finance transactions. 
 1. Consumer Leases
 2. Commercial Leases
 3. Consumer Lending 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Leases 
 (a) When soliciting or advertising consumer retail leases, 
 (i) Wells Fargo must provide certain clear and conspicuous disclosures. (CA, NH, OK) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.71(a), (b), (d); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:2(I); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 465:15-3-12 A failure to provide required disclosures will not affect the validated of the lease agreement. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.71(a), (b), (d) 
 (ii) Wells Fargo must not use specified ‚Äútrigger terms‚Äù without also providing corresponding statutory disclosures. (NM) N.M. Code R. ¬ß 12.2.4.19(B), (C) 
 (b) When entering into consumer leases: 
 (i) Wells Fargo must provide a written contract containing all of the obligations of the parties and additional requisite notices and disclosures, in certain minimum required typeface, (CA, FL, HI, IL, MD, NH, NJ, NY, PR, WI) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(a), (c), (f), (g); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 521.004; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 481L-2(1)-(3); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(a), (c)-(e); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/70; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(b), (d), (e); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:3(I), (III), (IV); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:4; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-62(a)-(d), (f)-(h); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(1)-(5); 10 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 2411; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.203(1)-(4), (6)(b), signed by all parties or their authorized representatives, (CA, FL, IL, MD, NJ, NY, WI) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(a), (c), (g); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 521.004; 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(b); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(a); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-62(a); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(1); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.203(1), with no blank spaces (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-62(e), and containing an acknowledgment that the lessee received the lease or disclosure. (IL, MD, NH, NY, PR, WI) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(c); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(c), (h)(3); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:7(I)-(III); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(3) 10 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 2411; (NM) N.M. Code R. ¬ß 12.2.4.19(5) 
 (ii) A copy of the executed lease must be provided to the lessee in a statutorily prescribed time frame, (CA, HI, MD) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(g); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 481L-2(4); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(c), and in the language principally used in negotiation. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 481L-2(5)
 (iii) Upon request and within a defined time period, Wells Fargo must provide: worksheets used to calculate the loan payment. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 481L-2(6), a statement of payments received and remaining balance, (IL, MD, NY) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(l)(1)-(3); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(k)(1)-(2); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(13)(a), or proof of an assignment of the lease, (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(j)(2), or a written statement of the early termination liability under the lease. (NY, WI) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(13)(b); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.203(8) Wells Fargo must not charge for the preparation of a written statement of the early termination liability under the lease, unless a charge was disclosed to the lessee prior to preparation of the statement, or a statement was previously provided in the previous 12 months; in no event should the charge exceed $20 per statement. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.203(8)
 (iv) Where the lease provides that the lessee may be subject to guaranteed asset protection (GAP) liability, Wells Fargo must include in the lease certain statements and disclosures, (CA, MI, NH, WI) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(j); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 445.992; N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:9(I); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.204(1), in statutorily prescribed language in at least 8-point bold typeface, (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(j), and with a place for an acknowledgment. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 445.992(2) In order to avoid potential liability, Wells Fargo must not seek to invoke GAP liability without first making the requisite disclosures. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 445.993(1), (2) Wells Fargo may waive its right to GAP liability in exchange for a separately stated charge; such charge must be disclosed in the lease in requisite typeface. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:9(II), (III); Wells Fargo must not condition a motor vehicle lease on the less obtaining GAP protection. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:9(III) Wells Fargo may waive GAP liability, fully or in part, as an incentive for purchasing, leasing, or financing a replacement vehicle with the same seller or creditor from the original lease transaction. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 218.0148(2)(j)
 (v) Wells Fargo may prescribe a certain accounting method by including the method in the lease terms. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/45(c)
 (vi) Where insurance coverage is required, Wells Fargo may include lease terms allowing Wells Fargo certain remedies where the lessee has failed to obtain insurance. (MD, NY) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(f); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(7)(a) Wells Fargo may require insurance or obtain insurance coverage on behalf of the lessee, except that payment under the policy must be issued to the lessee. (PR) 10 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 2411
 (vii) Wells Fargo must include in the lease requisite information and disclosures regarding a trade-in vehicle (FL, HI, IN) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 521.005; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 481L-3; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-5-16.5-10 Wells Fargo may provide in a vehicle lease agreement the outstanding balance from a prior motor vehicle loan or lease. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 334.21
 (viii) Where the lease is for a new vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide the required ‚ÄúLemon Law‚Äù disclosure. (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 60-2-1-.05(1), (2)
 (ix) Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures regarding certain motor vehicle leases, (CT, IL, MI, NH, OH) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-271(b); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/15(b); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/55(a), (b); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 257.401(4); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(1); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1345.74(A), in minimum size typeface, (OH) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1345.74(A); and via prescribed delivery means within a statutorily defined time frame. (CT, IL) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42-271(b); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/55(b)
 (x) When engaged in a lease transaction of a vehicle returned to a manufacturer, Wells Fargo must not deliver the vehicle until and unless required disclosures regarding the vehicle are made by the manufacture. (ND) N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 51-07-22(1), (2)
 (xi) Upon execution of the lease documents, Wells Fargo must complete a report of lease and provide additional information to the lessee at least ten days prior to the expiration of the temporary placard. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 482.4235(6) 
 (xii) Wells Fargo and the lessee may agree that: the lessee will fulfill certain duties to protect the motor vehicle as collateral, and Wells Fargo may apply expenditures resulting from the lessee‚Äôs failure to the unpaid loan balance. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.207(1) 
 (xiii) Wells Fargo and the lessee may agree in the contract that specified charges can be assessed, or that damages are available upon the lessee‚Äôs default beyond what is otherwise permitted by statute. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.202(1)(b), (1)(e); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.413(1), (2g)
 (c) When a vehicle lease provides an option for the lessee to purchase the vehicle: 
 (i) Wells Fargo must, within 15 business days of receiving payment in full, deliver the vehicle‚Äôs certificate of ownership to the transferee. (CA) Cal. Veh. Code ¬ß 5753(c)(2)
 (ii) When the lessee is exercising a purchase option, Wells Fargo must not make prohibited charges. (IL, NH) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/55(a); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(I)
 (d) When the leased vehicle is delivered to the lessee prior to final credit approval, Wells Fargo must provide statutory notice to and obtain an acknowledgment that the prospective lessee received the notice. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-67(a) 
 (e) When accepting return of a leased vehicle, 
 (i) Wells Fargo must not prevent the customer from attending a vehicle inspection for excess wear and damage, (IL, NH) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/55(a); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(I), and must allow access to the vehicle for counter-inspection within a specified time frame and provide certain notice of the lessee‚Äôs right to inspection. (NH, WI) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(III, IV); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.208(4)(a), (4)(b), (5)(a)
 (ii) Within a specified time period from the return of a leased vehicle, Wells Fargo must deliver an itemized bill to the lessee, containing statutory language. (NH, WI) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(II)-(IV), (VI); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.208(2), (3) 
 (iii) Following termination of a motor vehicle lease, Wells Fargo must deliver certain disclosures to the lessee, and retain and make available for inspection odometer disclosures delivered by the lessee. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 342.156(1)-(3) Wells Fargo may rely on the mileage provided by the lessee on certain title and disclosure documents if ownership is transferred without obtaining possession. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 342.156(4) 
 (iv) Failure to provide statutory notices or inspection access may limit the ability of Wells Fargo to recover for excess wear and damage, but not the ability of Wells Fargo to recover for excess mileage, odometer rollbacks or obscured or concealed structural or safety related damage. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(X), or a statutory fine. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 342.156(6)
 (v) When Wells Fargo intends to sell the vehicle following early termination of the lease where the lessee does not have or exercise a right of purchase, Wells Fargo must provide written notice to the lessee containing required disclosures, at least ten days before a sale. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 340(2), (3). Wells Fargo cannot collect from the lessee charges for early termination in excess of statutory limits. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 341(1)
 (vi) In order to collect for wear and tear on a returned vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide to the lessee requisite disclosures and information in the lease agreement, (NY, WI) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 343(2)(a)-(f) and deliver via registered mail or hand-delivery an itemized bill and appraisal, separately or as a single document, containing certain disclosures. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 343(3)(a)(i), (3)(a)(iii), (3)(b)(i), (4)(a)
 (f) When renegotiating leases, other than an extension of six months or less, Wells Fargo must comply with all disclosure requirements pertaining to leases other than warranties or provisions applying to the sale of used vehicles. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:21(I), (II)
 (g) When providing a written warranty, Wells Fargo may include language to limit coverage in certain circumstances. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 198-b(b)(4) Wells Fargo must deliver the written warranty to the customer, either on a separate sheet or as part of a contract with conspicuous titles. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 198-b(e)
 (h) When transferring ownership of a motor vehicle, including pursuant to a lease, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures in the form of an odometer disclosure statement, to the state. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 46.12.665(1)(a)-(g), (5)
 (i) When taking assignment of consumer leases; 
 (i) When providing a form lease agreement in anticipation of becoming the assignee of the lease, Wells Fargo must follow certain formatting requirements (CA, NY, WI) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2992; N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 333(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.201 Wells Fargo must make the form available for review by prospective lessees. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 333(1) 
 (ii) When taking assignment of a lessor‚Äôs rights, Wells Fargo may not recover from the lessee an amount exceeding the original obligation under the lease absent an agreement to the contrary. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2986.10(a),(b)
 (iii) Wells Fargo must honor any payments submitted to the prior lessee until such time as the lessee has notice of an assignment. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(j)(1) 
 (iv) Wells Fargo may assign the lease (MD, NY) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(i); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(11) 
 (v) A licensed vehicle lease facilitator may sign a lease in place of the lessor before the vehicle lease is assigned, transferred, or conveyed to an ultimate lessor. (TX) Tex. Occ. Code Ann. ¬ß 2301.5555
 (j) When accepting cash payments on a lease, Wells Fargo must provide a written receipt. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(j)(3) 
 (k) When a lessee has made a payment or provided a trade-in vehicle towards a lease that was not ultimately approved, Wells Fargo must return said payment and trade-in vehicle. (NH, NY) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:8(I), (II); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 334(2); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(3) Wells Fargo must not transfer a trade-in vehicle until the lease is executed, unless the parties have otherwise agreed in a contract using requisite language and typeface. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:8(I), (II). When selling a trade-in vehicle, Wells Fargo must include certain disclosures regarding the sale price as the value of the vehicle for purposes of crediting the lease or a prospective lessee. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.202(2) 
 (l) When Wells Fargo intends to include electronic tracking technology in the vehicle for purposes of ascertaining location or starter interruption, Wells Fargo must provide a required written notice and obtain the lessee‚Äôs consent in writing. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 598.9715(1), (2) These requirements cannot be waived. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 598.9715(3)
 2. Commercial Leases 
 (a) When providing a commercial vehicle lease, Wells Fargo must provide the lessee with a written, clear and conspicuous statement containing certain lease information. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 100.105(1) Where the lessee is to be responsible for GAP liability, Wells Fargo must make specific value disclosures that are agreed to by the lessee. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 100.105(2) Such disclosures and additional disclosures must be in a notice sent to the address of the lessee. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 100.155(1)-(3)
 (b) When entering into vehicle leases not subject to laws pertaining to consumer retail leases, the parties may agree in writing that the lease is subject to those laws. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 348
 (c) When transferring ownership of a motor vehicle, including pursuant to a lease, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures in the form of an odometer disclosure statement, to the state. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 46.12.665(1)(a)-(g), (5)
 3. Consumer Lending
 (a) When providing negative equity financing with a trade-in, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures to the customer. (DE) 5-2900-2901 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 5.0
 (b) When providing a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must provide a contract in writing, signed by the buyer and seller, containing completed essential provisions and required disclosures, including certain notice in specified typeface. (DE) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(a), (b), (d), (e) 
 (c) Where the loan is for a new vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide the required ‚ÄúLemon Law‚Äù disclosure, (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 60-2-1-.05(1), (2), and comply with Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) requirements. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2004(a)
 (d) When a vehicle does not conform to applicable warranties, Wells Fargo must report any defect to the manufacturer, factory branch or lessor and follow a prescribed process for resolution with the lessee, which is disclosed to the lessee in writing at the time of the lease. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2004(c), (d)(1)
 (e) When engaged in a sales transaction of a vehicle returned to a manufacturer, Wells Fargo must not deliver the vehicle until and unless required disclosures regarding the vehicle are made by the manufacture. (ND) N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 51-07-22(1), (2)
 (f) When providing a written warranty, Wells Fargo may include language to limit coverage in certain circumstances. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 198-b(b)(4) Wells Fargo must deliver the written warranty to the customer, either on a separate sheet or as part of a contract with conspicuous titles. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 198-b(e)
 (g) When entering into a debt cancellation agreement, Wells Fargo must disclose all provisions permitting the exclusion of loss or damage including events enumerated by statute, if applicable. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 397.005(a), (b) 
 (h) When transferring ownership of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures in the form of an odometer disclosure statement, to the state. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 46.12.665(1)(a)-(g), (5)
 (i) Wells Fargo and the borrower may agree that: the borrower will fulfill certain duties to protect the motor vehicle as collateral, and Wells Fargo may apply expenditures resulting from the borrower‚Äôs failure to the unpaid loan balance. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.207(1)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Fee Disclosures and Refundability - Loans by Brokers
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Fee Disclosures and Refundability - Loans by Brokers
 
 MCR0001150
 
 Covered States: CO, FL, LA, MS, NJ, NY, OK, PA, PR, SC, WA, WY
 
 When acting as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo must disclose and distribute certain information to parties seeking mortgage loans. Certain laws prohibit Wells Fargo, as broker, from assessing a fee or assessing an expense from funds deposited by a potential borrower, unless and until a loan is actually found, obtained, and closed for that borrower; limit fees to a percentage of the original loan amount; or limit the assessment of fees other than an application, credit report, property appraisal, or lock-in fees; or provide for a separate broker disclosure summary that includes all material terms of the agreement.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 81-18-27(1)(l); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.10(b); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 590-b; N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 59, ¬ß 2095.15(3); PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 4.8(b); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 40-58-75(A); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 40-58-75(C); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must disclose fees in writing, clearly and conspicuously,:
 
 (i) that late fees will be assessed to real estate secured consumer credit transactions payable in installments. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-106(1);
 
 (ii) the amount of the broker's application fee and under what circumstances all or any part of the broker's application fee may be refundable including if the broker does not perform the services indicated. (NJ, NY) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.10(b); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(v);
 
 1. Wells Fargo must send within three business days a signed, written mortgage broker agreement that discloses the total estimated charges and itemizes the same. (NY, SC, WY, WA) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 590-b(1)(e); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 40-58-75(A); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-114 (a); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(b); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.030(1)
 
 (iii) the rate, points, fees, and other terms to be received by the mortgage broker from a lender for its services, including the maximum for each applicable fee, (NY, WA) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(iv)-(vii); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(a); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-600-200(4); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.030(1), expressed as a percentage and in dollars in relation to the loan. (PR) PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 4.8(b)
 
 (b) Wells Fargo cannot charge a fee that is more:
 
 (i) than a certain percentage of the original loan amount which cannot exceed 7.95% of the original principal amount of the loan inclusive of the APR if required under Regulation Z of the federal Truth in Lending Act (TILA). (MI) Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 81-18-27(1)(l).
 
 (ii) than the actual costs of the goods or services charged by the third-party provider. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 59, ¬ß 2095.15(D)(3).
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must refund any overcharges or credit the borrower's account at time of closing:
 
 (i) That exceed the good-faith estimate of the actual cost. (LA, NJ, NY) La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:1096(G)(1); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.10(b); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(v).
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must not accept, give, or charge any undisclosed compensation. (NY, OK) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 590-b(1)(d); Okla. Stat. tit. 59, ¬ß 2095.15(D)(3).
 
 (e) Wells Fargo must not assess or receive a charge in advance from a borrower for the procurement of a loan until the loan is found, obtained, and closed. (LA, NY, PA) La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:1096(G)(1); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(a); 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6122(b)(1)-(2).
 
 (f) Wells Fargo's origination fees disbursed from loan proceeds must reflect the name of each mortgage broker to be paid. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-40.008(8).

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Form and Style (Misc.) - Blank Spaces
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Form and Style (Misc.) - Blank Spaces
 
 MCR: 1017
 
 Covered States: AZ, CA, HI, MA, MD, MI, NH, NJ, NY, PA, SC, VA, WI 
 When engaged in the execution of documents in connection with the below products and services, Wells Fargo must not permit a document with any blank spaces to be signed. Wells Fargo must only provide a complete document to be signed.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-947(A); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 42.12A(5); Md. Code Regs. 09.03.06.08(B); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 445.1634(8); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 352; PA - 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6332(a); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1614(1)
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 a) Despite the above, Wells Fargo must permit the following types of documents with blank spaces to be signed:
 i. Mortgage loan transaction documents to be signed by a party that has specifically authorized, in writing, that the licensee or escrow agent may complete the particular blank spaces. (AZ) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-909(A); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-984(A).
 
 ii. Forms authorizing the verification of application information or as otherwise expressly provided. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 399-A:15(XXVI)
 
 iii. Forms containing blanks to be filled in with the name of the licensee by the borrower. Wells Fargo must ensure that the filled-in form is signed and dated by the borrower. Wells Fargo must keep the completed form in in a separate loan file maintained with respect to the loan. (VA) 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-60-30(D)
 
 iv. Mortgage loan transaction documents containing blank spaces relating to recording when Wells Fargo acts as a residential mortgage lender, residential mortgage broker, or mortgage loan originator. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-75(j)
 
 v. Documents containing any blank spaces provided for the identifying numbers of goods not available at the time of the transaction. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.304(1)
 
 vi. Documents clearly indicating that any blank spaces relating to price, charges, or terms of payment are inapplicable. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.304(1)
 
 b) Signatory rules
 i. Wells Fargo must not permit the execution of documents where signatures are required to be witnessed without the witnesses being physically present. (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 46.2(j)(6)
 ii. Wells Fargo must not permit someone other than the required signatory to execute a document unless otherwise authorized by law. (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 46.2(j)(6)
 
 c) Note/Mortgage/Security Instrument requirements
 
 i. Wells Fargo must include in any note, promise to pay, or instrument of security: the amount of the loan, a clear description of the installment payments required, and the rate of interest charged. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1524(J)
 
 ii. When a combination note and mortgage is used and the borrower must sign at the bottom, Wells Fargo must mark the mortgage ‚ÄúNONE‚Äù, when only the note section is used. Wells Fargo must furnish the borrower with a legible copy of the note and mortgage. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. Regs. 15-60(w)
 
 iii. Wells Fargo must give each person entitled to notice a copy of: (i) the debt instrument and security agreement or deed of trust, if any, evidencing the consumer credit contract and, (ii) if it is a separate document, a copy of the notice required and a copy of the document evidencing that person's obligations. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.93
 
 d) Unsolicited credit sale contracts
 
 i. If Wells Fargo receives a credit sale contract through the mail that is not in response to any personal solicitation by Wells Fargo, and Wells Fargo's publicly available materials contain clear pricing and other terms, then Wells Fargo must, within 15 days from the shipment of goods in connection with that contract, provide the consumer with a written statement of the items shipped inserted in any spaces that were blank when Wells Fargo received the contract. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-11

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Parties May Not by Agreement Determine Standards for Secured Party's Duty to Refrain from Breaching Peace (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-603)
PSDR - Commitment and Rate-lock Agreements - Processing Commitments and Rate Locks
Summary:
Covered States: CT, FL, ME, MO, MS, MT, NJ, NY, TX, VA
 
 For the products below, if Wells Fargo offers the applicant a rate lock or loan commitment, Wells Fargo must disclose the rate lock fee and the loan commitment fee to the loan applicant and enter into an agreement with the loan applicant before collecting a rate lock fee or a commitment fee; must extend the rate lock or commitment if the loan does not close before the expiration of the rate lock or commitment period through no fault of the applicant; must make the rate lock and commitment fees paid by the applicant refundable if the loan does not close through no fault of the loan applicant; and must disburse loan funds according to the terms of a loan commitment.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Mo. Code Regs. Ann. Tit. 20, ¬ß 1140-30.280(2); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 81-18-27(1)(c); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.4(c); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 156.304(b); 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-30(C); 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-160-30(D) 
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not advertise a prevailing interest rate on a mortgage loan, unless the advertisement specifically states that the interest rate could change or may not be available at commitment or closing. (MT) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-9-168(7)
 b. If the interest rate is for a variable rate loan, Wells Fargo must set forth in the loan commitment that the interest rate is subject to increase before the loan closes, and the bank must fix the final rate no less than three days before the loan closes, upon proper notice to the borrower (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.5(d)
 c. Wells Fargo must extend the loan commitment or rate lock-in end date if its attorney or law firm chosen to close the loan cannot do so within the term of the commitment or lock-in agreement. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-706(d)(6)
 e. Wells Fargo must refund the commitment fee, the lock-in fee, and any points taken by the lender, if the property appraisal report is not favorable for the product for which the commitment was issued or if the product locked-in. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.4(c)(7), (8); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.6(b)(1), (b)(2)
 f. Wells Fargo must disburse all funds in accordance with its loan commitment to make a mortgage after a borrower has accepted the commitment. (MT) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-9-168(4)
 g. Wells Fargo must refund the lock-in fee to the borrower when:
 i. the borrower extends the lock-in agreement, and
 ii. Wells Fargo closes the loan above the lock-in rate but no higher than would provide a fair market yield (with no profit or ‚Äúspread‚Äù to Wells Fargo). (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.6(a)
 h. Wells Fargo must refund any commitment fee paid by the borrower when:
 i. no lock-in agreement has been executed, 
 ii. a commitment has been issued,
 iii. the loan does not close before the expiration date of the commitment, and 
 iv. the borrower terminates the commitment through no substantial fault of the borrower. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.6(b)
 i. A mortgage broker must include three disclosures in a lock-in agreement provided to the borrower. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-40.155(2), (3)
 j. If a mortgage broker or a supervised lender collects a fee for an interest rate lock, the loan broker must: 1) take the necessary steps to secure or guarantee the rate in the rate lock; 2) select a time period within which the loan can reasonably be expected to close; and 3) make a good faith effort to close the loan within the rate lock period. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 10-309; Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 9-313
 k. When acting as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo must not collect a rate-lock fee unless the rate-lock agreement contains certain disclosures. (MO) Mo. Code Regs. Ann. Tit. 20, ¬ß 1140-30.280(1)
 l. When acting as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo may not collect a commitment or rate-lock fee prior to the applicant's acceptance of a commitment from a lender. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(2)(iv)
 m. When acting as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo may not collect any fee other than an application fee, credit report fee, or property appraisal fee prior to closing, if the lender's commitment is subject to any one of the following: 1) adequate appraisal value; 2) satisfactory credit history and obligations; or 3) pre-sale requirement clause in a condominium or co-op mortgage commitment. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(2)(iv)
 n. Wells Fargo must request a rate-lock extension before the expiration of the current rate-lock period when issuing an ‚Äúauthority loan.‚Äù (VA) 13 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 10-40-160(C)

Title: PSDR - Private Mortgage Insurance - Annual Notice - General Notice Requirements
Summary:
Covered States: CA, MN
 When providing notice of the right to cancel private mortgage insurance (PMI), Wells Fargo must provide certain written notice to borrowers within 30 days of the close of escrow or annually.
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 State ‚Äì Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 (a) When acting as a lender where PMI is required as a condition of a loan, Wells Fargo must provide the borrower with certain required notices, including whether the borrower has the right to cancel the insurance, in at least 10-point bold type within 30 days of close of escrow, unless the mortgage is funded with bond proceeds issued under an indenture requiring mortgage insurance for the life of the loan. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2954.6(a) ‚Äì (c), (f)
 (b) When servicing a mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must provide annual notice, on a separate page and consistent with required specific formatting, of the borrower‚Äôs right to cancel PMI if the principal balance of the loan is 80 percent or less of the current market value of the home. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 47.207(3)(a), (b)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Credit Card Access for Open-end Loans
Summary:
MCR1013 
 
 Covered States: SC, TX 
 
 Wells Fargo must adhere to certain contractual requirements or prohibitions when providing open-end credit accessed by a credit card. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 
 Additional State-Specific Requirements: 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must not impose an over-limit charge on the credit card greater than ten dollars ($10) plus the lesser of ten percent (10%) of the credit limit or one hundred ($100) dollars. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-2-202(1)(c)
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must not issue a credit card or similar device to a homeowner as a means of providing a HELOC advance. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 153.84

Title: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Home Solicitation Sales
Summary:

 When making a home solicitation sale, Wells Fargo‚Äôs agreement or offer of sale must include certain state-specific disclosures in conspicuous language, including the seller‚Äôs information and the buyer‚Äôs right to cancel.

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Credit Decisions and Adverse Actions - Notices Relating to Adverse Action or Use of Credit Score
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Credit Decisions and Adverse Actions - Notices Relating to Adverse Action or Use of Credit Score
 
 Covered States: AR, CA, CO, CT, HI, IL, KS, LA, MA, MD, ME, MN, NH, NJ, OH, RI, VA, VT, WA, WI
 For the products listed below, when Wells Fargo has either taken an adverse action on a credit application or insurance application, or issued a decision on such an application based partly on the applicant‚Äôs credit score, Wells Fargo must disclose to the applicant, within a reasonable time following the adverse action or upon the applicant‚Äôs request, certain information, explanations, disclosures, and contact information relating to the action or decision. 
 
 1. Insurance products
 2. Asset Based Loans
 3. Consumer Credit Cards
 4. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 5. Consumer Real Estate
 6. Structured Products
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-93-103; Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-93-104(a); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1785.20(a); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1785.20(b); Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1950.204.1(a); Conn. Agencies Regs. ¬ß 36a-744-7(b); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-696(a); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 50-714(a); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 50-714(b); La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3571.1(Q); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183, ¬ß 64; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 93, ¬ß 62(b), (c); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 93, ¬ß 62(a); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-1702; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-1704; Me. Stat. tit. 24-A, ¬ß 2169-B(4); Me. Stat. tit. 24-A, ¬ß 2169-B(3); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 359-B:15(I); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 359-B:15(II); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 6-13.1-21(b); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 59.1-444.2(H); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-502; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-503(A); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-503(A), (D); 21-010-014 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 2; Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß 2480h(h)Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.182.110; Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.182.170(10); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.052(7e); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 224.75(3)(a) 
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements
 
 1. Insurance products; Asset Based Loans; Consumer Credit Cards; Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Consumer Real Estate; and Structured Products
 a. Wells Fargo must provide the consumer with a written notice of his or her rights in connection with obtaining a free copy of any credit report and the right to dispute such report. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1785.20(a) 
 b. When Wells Fargo requests access to a consumer credit report when reviewing a credit application and is unable to obtain access due to certain circumstances, Wells Fargo must treat the application as incomplete. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3571.1(Q) 
 c. Wells Fargo must provide each consumer against whom an adverse action is taken a written statement of the reasons for such action. (VT) 21-010-014 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 2
 d. Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures to a customer when making an adverse decision on application for a product based on information from a consumer report. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.182.110
 
 2. Commercial Credit Cards; Commercial Real Estate Loans; Asset Based Loans; Non-Consumer Loans/Lines; Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 a. When offering commercial lines of credit, Wells Fargo must disclose to an applicant certain information and explanations regarding any adverse action taken by Wells Fargo in connection with the credit application. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 8, ¬ß 10403(d)(2)-(3)
 
 3. Consumer Credit Cards; Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Consumer Real Estate
 a. When Wells Fargo receives information from a secondary market underwriter, investor, the Federal Housing Administration, or the Veteran's Administration which materially affects a loan in process, Wells Fargo must notify the applicant in writing upon receipt of such information. (CA) Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1950.204.1(b)
 b. When Wells Fargo determines that an applicant does not qualify for the loan for which they applied, but that the applicant may qualify for a different program instead, Wells Fargo must disclose such program and information in writing to the applicant. (CA) Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1950.204.1(a)
 c. When providing applications for credit, Wells Fargo must include a statutorily prescribed notice in a type size no smaller than that used throughout the application form. (OH) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 4112.021(B)(g)
 d. Within 30 days after receiving a completed application for credit, Wells Fargo must notify the applicant of Wells Fargo‚Äôs action on the application. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-502 
 e. When Wells Fargo obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency in connection with a credit application for the purchase or lease of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must disclose certain information to the seller upon written request of the buyer. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 53C.083
 
 4. Consumer Real Estate 
 a. When offering an extension of a consumer loan secured by residential property, Wells Fargo must provide a copy of any credit information relied upon by Wells Fargo to the consumer and must not charge more than a reasonable fee for providing such information. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-106(2)
 b. When originating a residential mortgage loan that fails to close, Wells Fargo must notify the applicant in writing as to why the loan failed to close, along with certain additional disclosures. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1355
 c. When taking an adverse action on a residential mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must disclose to the applicant certain information relating to the adverse action, including information about the collateral property if relevant to the adverse action. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 183, ¬ß 64 
 d. Wells Fargo must provide certain records and disclosures in connection with an offer of a secondary mortgage loan. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-82(a),(c) and (f)
 
 5. Insurance Products
 a. Wells Fargo must not deny a credit application on the sole basis that the applicant has refused to enroll in certain insurance policies. In addition, Wells Fargo must not offer involuntary unemployment insurance to a credit applicant until after Wells Fargo has decided on the credit application and has communicated the decision to the applicant. offer credit in connection with insurance products. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255, ¬ß 12G

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Right to Know Policy Options and Right to Choose Insurer
Summary:
MCR1092
 
 Covered States: AL, CO, DC, FL, HI, IA, ID, IN, KS, KY, LA, MD, ME, MO, MS, MT, NH, NJ, NY, OK, OR, RI, TN, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 
 When Wells Fargo either (i) requires insurance as additional security on credit or a loan or (ii) solicits insurance in connection with credit or a loan, Wells Fargo must provide the borrowers with a written disclosure, clearly written and prominently displayed, that notifies them of their right to procure alternative insurance coverage‚Äîeither through insurance they already own or by purchasing new plans. The disclosure must also state that the borrower‚Äôs choice of insurer will not affect the credit decision or credit terms. The disclosure must be made before the transaction is completed. 
 
 Similarly, if Wells Fargo makes available to borrowers more than one insurance plan, Wells Fargo must disclose all plans applicable to the credit transaction and the premium or insurance charge for each plan prior to the preparation of insurance documents and before the consumer becomes obligated on the transaction. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 10. Insurance products
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Ala. Code ¬ß 5-19-20(e); 3 Colo. Code Regs. 702-4, Regulation ¬ß 4-9-2 (Section 4); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-4-109; D.C. Code ¬ß 31-2231.20(c); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 626.9551(2)(a); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 431:13-104(c); Iowa Admin. Code r. 191-28.3(1); Iowa Admin. Code r. 191-28.3(2); Idaho Admin. Code r. 18.01.61.011(1); Idaho Admin. Code r. 18.01.61.011(2); 760 Ind. Admin. Code 1-5.1-3(a); 760 Ind. Admin. Code 1-5.1-3(b); Kan. Admin. Reg. ¬ß 40-5-103(a); Kan. Admin. Reg. ¬ß 40-5-103(b); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 304.12-150; La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3542(A); Md. Code Ann., Ins. ¬ß 13-114(b)(1); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 375.937(3); 19-001-023 Miss. Code R. ¬ß 23.11(B); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 33-18-501(3); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-13.1(b); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 365:10-5-62(b)(1); Or. Admin. R. 836-060-0011(1); Or. Admin. R. 836-060-0011(2); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 746.215(2); 230 R.I. Code R. 20-60-1.3(1); 230 R.I. Code R. 20-60-1.3(2); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 27-29-4(10); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 56-49-111(b); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 56-8-106(c); Utah Admin. Code r. 590-91-3(A); Utah Admin. Code r. 590-91-3(B); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 31A-22-806(6); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 38.2-233(A); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 38.2-233(B); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 38.2-513.1(A)(9); 21-020-006 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 3(1); 21-020-006 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 3(2); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 284-34-120(1); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 284-34-120(2); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 48.30.260(2); W. Va. Code ¬ß 33-11A-9(b).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements: 
 
 1. Additional Requirements Applicable to All Products Above 
 
 (a) When writing credit insurance, Wells Fargo must establish procedures by which creditors are able to give borrowers a sufficient number of printed notices informing the borrowers of their right to procure their own insurance. Wells Fargo must prominently display those notices. (TN) Tenn. Comp. R. & Regs. 0780-1-4-.02(1)
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide the borrower with information on any cost of insurance provided by Wells Fargo. (WV) W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-3-109(b)
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must notify the borrower of the disclosures above either at the time of application for the loan or at the outset of negotiations regarding the loan. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 24-A, ¬ß 2169
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must ‚Äúpromptly‚Äù notify the borrower of the disclosures above. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-409
 
 (e) Wells Fargo must not require or otherwise imply that the purchase of insurance is required as a condition of, or otherwise related to, the borrower receiving a loan. Wells Fargo must make various statutory disclosures to this effect and obtain acknowledgements from the borrower in accordance with the means and times prescribed by statute. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 406-C:10(I); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 406-C:10(II). 
 
 (f) Wells Fargo must not delay or impede the extension of a loan for the purpose of influencing a borrower‚Äôs selection or purchase of insurance. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 406-C:10(III)
 
 (g) Wells Fargo must obtain a written statement, signed by the borrower, that acknowledges that the borrower has received the state-specific disclosures above. LA‚Äôs timing requirement is the most restrictive, requiring Wells Fargo to obtain this statement at the time of written application; compliance with LA‚Äôs requirement would also comply with VA‚Äôs requirement (LA, VA) La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 22:1600(A); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 38.2-233(D)
 
 (h) Wells Fargo must not require that insurance relating to a loan be purchased through a particular insurance provider. Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-312(c)(1)
 
 (i) When Wells Fargo requires insurance and the borrower provides notice or issues a request, Wells Fargo must allow the borrower to provide the required insurance through alternative coverage. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-6-107; (WI) Wis. Admin. Code Ins ¬ß 3.25(11)
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 
 (a) When selling credit insurance on a mortgage, Wells Fargo must provide a clear and conspicuous disclosure stating that the credit insurance shall not be a condition to the extension of mortgage credit and that the borrower may elect not to purchase the insurance. (DC) D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1152.03
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance; Insurance products
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must disclose to borrowers of consumer loans that they are not required to purchase personal property insurance as a condition of receiving the loan and, if they want that personal property insurance, they have the right to procure alternative insurance coverage. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-21(e)

Title: PSDR - Advertising and Solicitation - Disclosures - Lending Products - Identification of Solicitor
Summary:

Code r. 187-15.9; Iowa Admin. Code r. 187-18.18(1); Md. Code Regs. 09.03.09.09(B)(2); Md. Code Regs. 09.03.06.06(B)(4); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-72(a); Ohio Admin. Code 1301:8-7-07(A); 10 Va. Admin.
