 e. Wells Fargo must not utilize ‚Äúblind‚Äù loan advertisements referencing only a phone number or an address without providing disclosure of the licensee‚Äôs name. (AK) 
 Alaska Admin. Code tit. 3, ¬ß 12.240
 f. When acting as a residential mortgage loan originator, Wells Fargo must include its NMLS number in any loan application forms in addition to any advertisements or solicitations. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 8, ¬ß 2244(b).
 g. When acting as a mortgage lender licensee, a mortgage correspondent lender licensee, or mortgage broker licensee, Wells Fargo must not advertise any mortgage in which the bank intends to act only as a mortgage broker without providing additional disclosures. (CT) 
 Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-497
 h. When acting as a licensed finance lender, broker or mortgage loan originator, Wells Fargo must not advertise within the state of California without disclosing its California license number under which any such loan would be made. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22162(a)
 i. Where Wells Fargo uses an email or website address that is different from the name or address as it appears on the bank‚Äôs Maryland license, any email or website address must have been listed as a trading name on the licensee‚Äôs NMLS record. (MD) Md. Code Regs. 09.03.06.06(B)(3)
 j. In advertisements for mortgage loans, Wells Fargo must not indicate that the interest rates or charges for loans are approved or set by the state or by state law. (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.02 
 k. Wells Fargo may not reference the trade name or trademark of another lender in an advertisement without the consent of a lender unless certain additional disclosures are made clearly and conspicuously. (NM) N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 57-12-25 
 l. When acting as a mortgage banker, Wells Fargo must include the complete name of the mortgage banker as it appears on the subject license and the address, phone number and its unique identifier or license number along with a description of any licensed activity in non-technical terms. (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.405; Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645E.285(4).
 m. When acting as a licensee in the state of Maryland, and when utilizing social media for advertising purposes, Wells Fargo‚Äôs NMLS unique identifier must be prominently displayed on the bank‚Äôs profile page within the social media platform. Md. Code Regs. 09.03.06.06(B)(5)
 n. When acting as a mortgage broker, mortgage banker or exempt organization, Wells Fargo must include its official entity name and street address in any advertisements; and, if the entity is not located in New York State, the advertisement must contain the street address for any one of its offices outside of New York. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.2(b)
 o. Where Wells Fargo is advertising through a website to consumers in the state of Washington, the bank‚Äôs web page and/or social media page must indicate the bank‚Äôs name as entered on its NMLS license, the bank‚Äôs NMLS and license number, and a link to the bank‚Äôs NMLS consumer access website page and must comply with all other Washington state and federal laws. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-622(1)-(5); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-446(1)-(5).
 p. Where Wells Fargo is acting as a registrant in the state of Ohio, any of the bank‚Äôs advertisements indicating charges on loans in dollars must state the length of time required to repay the loan, as well as the allowable method of repayment and the applicable interest rate; if advertising a flat or average payment on loans including principal and interest, any advertisement by the bank must specify the number and frequency of payments required to repay the loan. (OH) Ohio Admin. Code 1301:8-3-05(A)(2), (8), (9)
 
 2. Consumer Lending
 a. Wells Fargo must not advertise any loan in contravention of federal law or regulations. (AK, GA, IA,) Alaska Admin. Code tit. 3, ¬ß 14.510; Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.02; Iowa Admin. Code r. 187-18.18 
 b. When acting as a licensee (GA), Wells Fargo must maintain all newspaper, magazine, direct mailing and broadside advertising, and scripts of radio and television commercials for a period of 1 year at a place agreed upon by the Industrial Loan Commissioner (GA) and 36 months (IA). 
 Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.02; Iowa Admin. Code r. 187-15.9
 c. Iowa‚Äôs statutes are more proscriptive than Georgia‚Äôs since Iowa requires a 36-month retention period and Georgia requires only a 1-year retention.
 
 3. Other Products
 a. When not acting as a lender, Wells Fargo may not use a loan number, loan amount or any specific loan information publicly available without including certain disclosures in specific format. (NM) N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 57-12-25
 b. When advertising and offering a consumer lease through use of radio or broadcast, Wells Fargo must establish a toll-free telephone number not later than the date on which the advertisement is broadcast and maintain such phone number for not less than 10 days of any broadcast. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-313

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Debtor May Waive Right to Require Disposition of Collateral Only after Default (U.C.
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AK, AZ, CA, CO, CONN, DC, DEL, FLA, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, NB, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, W.VA, WY 
 
 When disposing of collateral of the below consumer products, Wells Fargo must provide an agreement entered into and authenticated after a debtor's or secondary obligor's default before acknowledging any consumer's waiver of notification of the disposition of collateral or any consumer's waiver requiring the disposition of collateral. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines 
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate 
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines 
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/ Wholesale Loans & LOC 
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer- Products 
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance 
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.29.624; Ala. Code ¬ß 7-9A-624; Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-9-624; Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-9624; Cal. Com. Code ¬ß 9624; Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 4-9-624; Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42a-9-624; D.C. Code ¬ß 28:9-624; Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 9-624; Fla. Stat. ¬ß 679.624; Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 11-9-624; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 490:9-624; Iowa Code ¬ß 554.9624; Idaho Code ¬ß 28-9-624; 810 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/9-624; Ind. Code ¬ß 26-1-9.1-624; Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 84-9-624; Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 355.9-624; La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 10:9-624; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 106, ¬ß 9-624; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 9-624; Me. Stat. tit. 11, ¬ß 9-1624; Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 440.9624; Minn. Stat. ¬ß 336.9-624; Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 400.9-624; Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-9-624; Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 30-9A-624; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25-9-624; Neb. Rev. Stat. UCC ¬ß 9-624; N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 382-A:9-624; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 12A:9-624; N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 55-9-624; N.Y. U.C.C. Law ¬ß 9-624; Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1309.624; Okla. Stat. tit. 12A, ¬ß 1-9-624; Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 79.0624; 13 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 9624; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 6A-9-624; S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 36-9-624; S.D. Codified Laws ¬ß 57A-9-624; Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-9-624; Tex. Bus. & Com. Ann. ¬ß 9.624; Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70A-9a-624; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 8.9A-624; Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9A, ¬ß 9-624; Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 62A.9A-624; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 409.624; W. Va. Code ¬ß 46-9-624; Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 34.1-9-624
 
 Additional State-Specific Requirements: 
 
 1. Wells Fargo does not have to provide an agreement entered into and authenticated after a debtor's or secondary obligor's default for any consumer's waiver requiring the disposition of collateral (NV). Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 104.9624

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Notice and Acknowledgment
Summary:
MCR1018
 
 Covered States: CA, GA, HI, MA, MT, NJ, NV, PA, WV
 
 For the products below, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information in various state-specified format. Additionally, Wells Fargo must obtain a written acknowledgment by the consumer/borrower indicating they received such disclosures.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans;
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines;
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.92; W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-4-111
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines;
 
 a. Wells Fargo must obtain a written acknowledgment from the consumer that the consumer has received a copy of the contract and comply with certain state specific formatting requirements. (HI, PA) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-7(c); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6323(c). CA is the most restrictive and requires delivery of a contract copy to take place within 10 days of receiving the contract in certain instances. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1799.202(a)
 
 b. Wells Fargo must retain a copy of the provided written disclosure with the applicant‚Äôs initials and date in acknowledgment of receipt. (CA) (CA) (a) Cal. Code Regs. tit. 10, ¬ß 1612(c)
 
 c. Wells Fargo must provide a copy of the applicant‚Äôs written acknowledgement to the applicant. (GA) Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(4); Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(6)
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate;
 
 a. When acting as a mortgagee, Wells Fargo must obtain a written statement signed by the borrower acknowledging receipt of the disclosure of all contractual contingencies which could force a sale of the mortgaged real estate. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 167E, ¬ß 7(d)(3)
 
 b. Wells Fargo must provide written acknowledgement in compliance with state law in response to a borrower‚Äôs loss mitigation request within 10 days of the request. (NC) 4 N.C. Admin. Code 3M.0702(a)
 
 c. In consumer real estate transactions, Wells Fargo must provide and maintain a consumer-signed statement of disclosure to the borrower and the investor before the date the loan is consummated that indicates if a Wells Fargo affiliate has any personal involvement in a lending or borrowing transaction of the mortgage broker; or is licensed as, conducts business as or holds a controlling interest or position in certain real estate entities. (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.210(1)
 
 d. Wells Fargo must develop policies to comply with state law. These policies must not make the borrower demonstrate that a home loan is in the borrower‚Äôs interest or require the borrower to sign a waiver of future claims under state law. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 53.07(1)
 
 3. Deposit / Money Movement - Cash Management Accounts; Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts; Deposit / Money Movement - Multi Currency Accounts; Deposit / Money Movement - Retirement Accounts; Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 
 a. If Wells Fargo participates in a multiple party account contract, Wells Fargo and any all other parties to the contract must sign an acknowledgement noting they have read the contract.
 
 4. Deposit / Money Movement - Wire Transfer; Deposit / Money Movement - Online Money Movement
 
 a. Wells Fargo must (i) provide state specific disclosures to the customer, (ii) retain a written statement from the customer acknowledging and accepting the disclosures, and (iii) provide a copy of the statement, signed by a Wells Fargo officer, to the customer. (MT) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-6-104(2)
 
 b. Wells Fargo must have the customer acknowledge the liability of the various parties for unauthorized transactions made by electronic funds transfers by initialing her initials immediately adjacent to this particular disclosure. (MT) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-6-104(2)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Secondary Obligor May Waive Right of Redemption after Default (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-624 State
PSDR - Retail Leases - Lease Contract Must Be Signed by Parties, Describe the Goods Leased and the Lease Term, to Be Enforceable (U.C.C. ¬ß 2A-201)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 
 When Wells Fargo creates a lease agreement, it must be signed by the parties, describe the goods and the lease term.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
  
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.12.201Ala. Code ¬ß 7-2A-201(1); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-2A-201; Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-2A201; Cal. Com. Code ¬ß 10201; Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 4-2.5-201; Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42a-2A-201; D.C. Code ¬ß 28:2A-201; Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 2A-201; Fla. Stat. ¬ß 680.201; Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 11-2A-201; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 42A0:2A-201; Iowa Code ¬ß 554.13201; Idaho Code ¬ß 28-12-201; 810 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/2A-201; Ind. Code ¬ß 26-1-2.1-201; Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 84-2a-201; Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 355.2A-201; Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 106, ¬ß 2A-201; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 2A-201; Me. Stat. tit. 11, ¬ß 2-1201; Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 440.2851; Minn. Stat. ¬ß 336.2A-201; Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 400.2A-201; Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-2A-201; Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 30-2A-201; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25-2A-201; N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 41-02.1-10; Neb. Rev. Stat. UCC ¬ß 2A-201; N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 382-A:2A-201; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 12A:2A-201; N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 55-2A-201; Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 104A.2201; N.Y. U.C.C. Law ¬ß 2-A-201; Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß1310.08; Okla. Stat. tit. 12A, ¬ß 2A-201; Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 72A.2010; 13 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2A201; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 6A-2.1-201; S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 36-2A-201; S.D. Codified Laws ¬ß 57A-2A-201; Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-2A-201; Tex. Bus. & Com. Ann. ¬ß 2A.201; Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70A-2a-201; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 8.2A-201; Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9A, ¬ß 2A-201; Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 62A.2A-201; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 402.201; W. Va. Code ¬ß 46-2A-201; Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 34.1-2A-201
 
 No state specific requirements.

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Typesize, Font and Color - 14-point Typesize
Summary:
MCR1025
 
 Covered states: CA, MN, PR, SC
 
 Wells Fargo must use 14-point font when issuing certain contracts or notices to consumers relating to: 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 3. Asset Based Loans
 4. Advisory, investment, brokerage, asset management
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) When offering or negotiating a mortgage loan modification or mortgage loan forbearance, Wells Fargo must provide to the borrower a statutorily prescribed statement in no less than 14-point boldface type. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10147.6(a). When Wells Fargo offers or negotiates a mortgage loan modification or mortgage loan forbearance in one of the foreign languages set forth in the statute, Wells Fargo must also provide a translated copy of that statutorily prescribed statement. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10147.6(b)
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 
 (a) When engaged in a foreclosure action of real property with at least one tenant and four or fewer dwelling units, Wells Fargo must provide to the tenants a statutorily prescribed notice of foreclosure printed in 14-point boldface type on different colored paper. The notice must be on its own page, and the title of the notice must be in 20-point boldface type. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 580.042(2)
 
 3. Asset Based Loans
 
 (a) When providing a short-term vehicle-secured loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide a statutorily prescribed notice that is placed conspicuously above the borrower's signature and in at least 14-point type. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-3-413(6)(a)
 
 4. Advisory, investment, brokerage, asset management & Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 
 (a) When entering into a service contract as a mortgage loan broker, Wells Fargo must provide the name, address, telephone number, and license number of the person who will provide the service, written at the top center of the first page of the contract in capital letters and in no smaller than 14-point boldface type. (PR) PR Reglamento 8017, Art. 4.8(d)(1)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Arbitration and Alternative Dispute Resolution
Summary:
Covered States: CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, GA, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, NC, NY, OK, PR, SC, TN, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI
 
 Wells Fargo must abide by certain state specific requirements when including an arbitration clause in agreements pertaining to the sale or offering of:
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 90.302(24). 
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 a. In AR and NY, Wells Fargo cannot use an arbitration clause that is oppressive or that limits the relief of the borrower against any party to a high-cost home loan. (AR, NY) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-53-104(j); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 6-l(2)(g)
 b. In UT, for an arbitration clause to be valid in a high-cost loan agreement, the document must follow the rules of the Utah Uniform Arbitration Act. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 61-2d-106
 c. In MD and D.C., Wells Fargo must include state specific disclosures when a mortgage loan requires the borrower to undergo binding arbitration as dispute resolution. D.C. has the most restrictive rule and requires the disclosure be provided to the borrower at least 3 days prior to the loan closing. (MD, D.C.) Md. Code Regs. 09.03.10.03(A),(B)(3); D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß Appendix Form 1(17).
 d. In WV, Wells Fargo must abide by the provisions of federal law to include a term of arbitration for any mortgage loan agreement. (WV) W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-4-109(5)(G)(1)
 e. In CT, Wells Fargo cannot require arbitration for a non-prime loan that (1) is not consistent with CT statutes or common law, (2) is less convenient for the borrower, or (3) limits any claim or defense the borrower has. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-760e(a)(2)
 f. In IL and NY, a high-risk loan with a mandatory arbitration clause that is deemed unconscionable is void. (IL, NY) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 137/130; N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 6-m(2)(f)
 
 2. Other Lending Products Identified Above
 a. In MN, Wells Fargo is prohibited from requiring binding arbitration to the borrower of a PACE loan. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 216C.437(16)(c)(4)
 b. In NM, Wells Fargo is prohibited from unreasonably restricting the right to notice of the initiation of an arbitration proceeding in a loan or other agreement. (NM) N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 44-7A-4(b)and(c)
 c. In UT, Wells Fargo may add an arbitration clause to any open-ended consumer agreement. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-4-102(2)(b)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Required Terms and Provisions - Insurance
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Required Terms and Provisions - Insurance
 
 MCR 1015
 
 Covered States: CT, FL, IA, KS, MI, MO, MS, TX
 
 When issuing insurance policies, Wells Fargo must include all essential terms and provisions of the policy including: the name of parties to the contract, the subject of the insurance, the risks insured against, the extent of coverage, the premium, conditions pertaining to the insurance, and the effective date and expiration date of the policy. 
 
 1. Insurance Products
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 12. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Fla. Stat. ¬ß 627.413(1)(a)-(f); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-2609(b)-(c).
 
 Additional State Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Insurance Policies in Connection with Lending Products
  a. In connection with auto loans under a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo insurance policies must be written for the full term which a premium has been charged to the borrower/purchaser. Conn. Agencies Regs. ¬ß 38a-288-4 
  b. When acting as a creditor requiring collateral protection insurance, Wells Fargo terms for repayment of costs of collateral protection coverage must include at least one of the following: full amortization over the term of the credit transaction; a final balloon payment within 30 days of the last scheduled payment; full payment within 30 days of the Notice of Placement of Insurance; or any other repayment terms agreed to by the debtor in the original transaction (MO) (Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 427.125(3); (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 307.052(g)
 
 2. Notice Requirements
  a. As an insurer, Wells Fargo insurance policies must include a provision that states the basis and rates for which the premium is to be determined and paid, when the exact amount of the premium is determinable only at stated intervals or termination of the contract. Fla. Stat. ¬ß 627.413(2).
  b. As an insurer, Wells Fargo insurance policies must include a provision that provides clear and conspicuous notice that each policy or contract may be canceled if payment is not made in accordance with the agreement. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 537.3207
  c. As an insurer, Wells Fargo insurance policies associated with loans must be furnished to the borrower within 15 days of the loan. (MI) Mich. Admin. Code r. 493.15(1)
 
 3. Fee Cap
  a. As an insurer, all fees for Wells Fargo personal property insurance policies must not exceed the sum of payments to be paid by the borrower to the lender or the contractual terms of a loan. (MS) Miss. Code R. ¬ß 1.4
 
 4. Form
  a. Wells Fargo insurance policies must specify the form numbers and editions dates/numeric codes of any endorsements attached to a policy. Fla. Stat. ¬ß 627.413(1)(g).
  b. Wells Fargo premium finance agreements must be dated and signed by or on behalf of the insured, with printed portions of the agreement in at least 8-point type, and both the insured and the negotiating insurance agent must be identified by name and place of business or residence. (KS) Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-2609(a).

Title: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Watercraft
Summary:
Covered States: VA
 
 For every retail installment sale of a watercraft, Wells Fargo must provide a written agreement signed by the buyer. The agreement must contain all pertinent terms, including whether or not the sale is contingent upon financing on terms agreeable to both parties before the sale. 
 
  1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 29.1-826(A)
 
 No state specific requirements.

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - Lender Identifying Information
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - Lender Identifying Information
 
 MCR0001029
 
 Covered States: CA, DC, DE, GA, KY, LA, MA, MN, NC, NJ, NV
 
 When originating a residential mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must disclose the Bank's unique identifier, name, address, affiliations, and licensing, on all application forms, solicitations, and advertising (including business cards and websites).
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22337(f); D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1103(1); 5-2400-2401 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 21.0; Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2420; Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1004.3; La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:1098(C); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 41.12(1), (2); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 53-244.107; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-72(a); Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.405.
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must cancel a mortgage loan originator license if it has not been re-assigned to another sponsoring agent within one (1) year of termination of the sponsoring relationship or affiliation. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 26-C, ¬ß 1103.1(5);
 
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide the disclosures required by the section, otherwise it must refund any brokerage fees obtained in connection with the residential mortgage loan. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:1098(D).
 
 (c) Wells Fargo must not represent that the licensee or exempt person is acting as the borrower's agent after providing a nonagency disclosure, unless the disclosure is retracted and the licensee or exempt person complies with all of the requirements of section 58.16 (MN). Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.13(17).
 
 (d) Wells Fargo must clearly and unambiguously disclose the existence of any ownership or control and the extent and nature of the ownership or control where it owns any portion or controls an entity, or entities, that perform services, provide goods, or receive payment for goods or services provided in connection with a mortgage loan. The disclosure must:
 
 (i) meet the requirements as set out in the federal Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, F.R. Part 1024.1 through 1024.41 ("RESPA"), and follow the prescribed disclosure format as set out in Appendix D of Part 1024 RESPA (KY). Ky. Admin. Regs. 12:050(3).

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Waivers - Debtor May Waive Right of Redemption after Default in Non-Consumer Goods Transaction (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-624)
Summary:
MCR 0001072
 
 Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IN, KA, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 
 Wells Fargo must allow a debtor or secondary obligor to waive his or her right to redeem collateral relating to the products below if the debtor or secondary obligor has entered into an authenticated agreement to that effect after default. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines 
 2. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Assets Based Loans 
 3. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 4. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans 
 5. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 6. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products 
 7. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 8. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance 
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.29.624(c); Ala. Code ¬ß 7-9A-624(c); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-9-624(c); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-9624(C); Cal. Com. Code ¬ß 9624(c); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 4-9-624(c); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42a-9-624 (c); D.C. Code ¬ß 28:9-624(c); Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 9-624(c); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 679.624(3); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 11-9-624(c); Haw. Rev. Ann. ¬ß 10:9-624(c); Mass. Gen. Laws Ch. 106, ¬ß 9-624(c); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 9-624(c); Me. Stat. tit. 11, ¬ß 9-1624(3); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 440.9624(3); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 336.9-624(c); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 400.9-624(c); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-9-624(c); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 30-9A-624 (3); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25-9-624(c); Neb. Rev. Stat. UCCLE ¬ß 9-624(c); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 382-A:9-624 (c); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 12A:9-624(c); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 55-9-624(c); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 104.9624(2); N.Y. U.C.C. Law ¬ß 9-624(c); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1309.624(C); Okla. Stat. tit. 12A, ¬ß 1-9-624(c); Or. Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - Brokers
Summary:
PSDR ‚Äì Credit Application Notices ‚Äì Early Disclosures ‚Äì Brokers
 MCR 1072
 Covered States: AL, CA, IL, IN, LA, MA, MD, MN, MT, NV, NY, OK, SC, WA, WY
 When engaged in the mortgage application process, or acting as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo must, within certain timeframes, provide (1) certain state-specific disclosures and notices, (2) conform such disclosures and notices to state-specific formatting requirements (e.g., font sizes), (3) provide other information pertaining to mortgages, including the amount of fees, interest, and options available to the consumer. 
 
 1. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Real Estate
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements
 
 1. Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate and Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate 
 a. Before collecting a mortgage broker fee from a borrower, Wells Fargo must disclose, in a certain size font, certain requirements to the borrower in writing, as well as comply with all applicable federal and state laws, rules, and regulations. (AL) Ala. Code ¬ß 5-25-12(a)(1)-(2) and (b)(1)-(5). 
 b. Wells Fargo must, in any application for a consumer or federal related mortgage loan in which a loan broker is involved, include a ‚ÄúLoan Brokerage Agreement and Disclosure Statement‚Äù that contains certain information. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3572.11(A)
 c. When acting as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo must not charge a finder‚Äôs fee unless it is pursuant to a separate and distinct written agreement between the broker and the borrower. Wells Fargo must disclose the terms of the proposed agreement before assisting the borrower to obtain a loan or advance of money, and must make certain other disclosures to the borrower. Wells Fargo must provide a copy of the agreement to the borrower within 10 days after the loan application is signed. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-805(d)
 d. When acting as a residential mortgage originator, Wells Fargo must provide to each borrower, at the expiration of a contract, a list of lenders or loan sources to whom loan applications were submitted on behalf of the borrower. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.16(7)
 e. When acting as a mortgage loan originator working for a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo must, within 3 days of taking an application, provide to the borrower a written disclosure as prescribed by the department. (MT) Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-9-124(2)
 f. Wells Fargo must disclose in a statutorily prescribed form if a mortgage broker or mortgage agent is also licensed as a real estate broker or salesperson and acts in both capacities in a single transaction. (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.235(1)
 g. Wells Fargo must disclose if Wells Fargo is owned by a corporation in which one control person, manager, or employee owns a 10% interest or more, and that person has any personal involvement in a licensed transaction of the mortgage broker. (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.210(2)
 i. Wells Fargo must disclose if a control-person manager or employee of a licensed mortgage broker, or relative of same, has any personal involvement in a lending/borrowing transaction, has any personal involvement in certain statutorily-enumerated activities, that involvement must be separately disclosed to the borrower and investor before the loan is consummated and signed by both. (NV) Nev. Admin. Code ¬ß 645B.210(1)
 i. A Wells Fargo mortgage broker must not accept, give, or charge any undisclosed compensation that inures to the broker‚Äôs benefit, and must clearly disclose to the borrower within 3 days after receiving the loan application, all material information specified by the Superintendent that might affect the borrower‚Äôs benefit from the home loan. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 590-b
 j. Wells Fargo must, before taking an application or collecting certain fees, make certain statutory disclosures to the applicant. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(a)(1)
 k. If the proceeds of a mortgage loan will be used to finance the acquisition of the dwelling‚Äîand in all other transactions in which a commitment fee or points are paid to the lender before closing‚ÄîWells Fargo must, before taking an application, credit, or property appraisal fee, make certain disclosures to each mortgage-loan applicant. Wells Fargo must not assess any fee other than an application fee, credit report fee, property appraisal fee and lock-in fee shall be taken prior to the acceptance by an applicant of a commitment. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.3(b)(1).
 l. Wells Fargo must not make a high-cost home loan without providing certain counseling disclosures that include a list of approved counselors. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.3(a)(1)
 m. Wells Fargo mortgage brokers or loan originators must not solicit or receive fees for third-party goods or services before borrowers obtain a loan, unless the fee is disclosed in advance and is consistent across all borrowers. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 59, ¬ß 2095.15(D)(3)
 n. Within 3 days of receiving an application for a mortgage loan, Wells Fargo must provide a mortgage broker fee agreement disclosing certain charges to the borrower and an itemization of charges. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 40-58-75(A)
 o. Wells Fargo must disclose to an applicant all fees earned for services rendered as a mortgage broker as required by federal or state law. (SC, WA) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 40-58-75(C); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-600-200(4)
 p. Wells Fargo must, within 3 days of receiving a borrower‚Äôs loan application or receiving money from a borrower for third-party provider services, make all disclosures required by statute. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(1)(a)
 q. Wells Fargo must comply with the Truth in Lending Act and Regulation Z but Washington law governs the delivery requirements of those federal disclosures. Wells Fargo also provide itemized costs for any third party costs associated with a residential mortgage loan. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)
 r. Wells Fargo must disclose that, if the borrower cannot obtain a loan for any reason, Wells Fargo must‚Äîwithin 5 days of the borrower‚Äôs request‚Äîprovide copies certain documents the borrower and transmit the documents to any other broker or lender requested by the borrower. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(h)
 s. Wells Fargo must disclose any changed loan terms or conditions to the borrower no less than 3 business days prior to the signing of the loan closing documents. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(19)(c)
 t. Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures if a rate-lock agreement has been entered into. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(c).
 u. Wells Fargo must not charge a fee that exceeds the fee disclosed to the consumer unless the need to change the fee was not reasonably foreseeable at the time the disclosure was provided or Wells Fargo‚Äîno less than 3 business days before the signing of the loan-closing documents‚Äîprovides to the borrower a clear explanation of the fee and an explanation of why it exceeds the previously disclosed fee. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.030.
 v. A Wells Fargo mortgage broker must provide a prospective borrower with an origination agreement no later than 3 days after the initial loan application date. The origination agreement must contain certain disclosures; these disclosures may be incorporated into the brokerage contract or a separate document. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:1098(B),(D)
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 a. Wells Fargo must provide a certain, statutory statement, conforming to certain font requirements, to any applicant for a program loan and ask the applicant to acknowledge receipt of the statement in writing. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22373(a)
 b. Wells Fargo must, within 3 business days after making a loan application, enter into a separate loan-broker agreement with the potential borrower; this agreement must contain certain disclosures. (IN) 710 Ind. Admin. Code 1-22-5
 c. Wells Fargo must make any disclosures and provide any documents (including to consumers) required by any applicable state or federal law, regulation, or directive. (MA) 209 Mass. Code Regs. 42.12A(11)
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Real Estate
 a. Before a mortgage-loan applicant signs a residential mortgage loan application or considers the licensee a loan-brokerage agreement must be signed by the applicant and Wells Fargo. Wells Fargo must include an explicit description of the services the licensee agrees to perform for the broker, a good-faith estimate, and contain certain language pertaining to any false or misleading statements in the loan-brokerage agreement. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 1050.1010(a)-(e), (h)
 b. Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures to the borrower at the time the borrower receives the loan estimate under the Real Estate Settlement and Procedures Act (RESPA), the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), and regulations adopted thereto, and before the scheduled closing of a consumer home loan. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-75 (A) and (B)
 c. Wells Fargo must, within a certain timeframe, include a separate, specific disclosure in the form prescribed when a prepayment penalty is a condition of a residential mortgage loan offered to a borrower and the borrower must agree in writing to accept that condition. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-115(b)

Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Prescribed Language - Disclosures and Notices at Consummation
Summary:
PSDR - Disclosures ‚Äì Prescribed Language - Disclosures and Notices at Consummation
 
 Covered States: AL, CA, CO, GA, HI, IA, ID, KS, MA, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, ND, NJ, NY, OK, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV
 
 When engaged in the sale, lease, or other offering of the below consumer products and services, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information within contracts for mortgages, deeds of trust, the addition of cosigners, right to cancel the contract, and miscellaneous other disclosures when the transaction occurs.
 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 3. Consumer Real Estate
 4. Commercial Real Estate Loans
 5. Consumer Credit Cards
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Ga. Comp. R. & Regs. 80-11-1-.01(9)(a); Iowa Admin. Code r. 61-15.1; Idaho Admin. Code r. 04.02.02.057; N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß47-18-05.1(1); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß31-23.2-6(a),(b); S.D. Codified Laws¬ß 44-8-26; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß6.2-1524(K); Wis. Stat. ¬ß422.303(3); Wis. Stat. ¬ß422.402(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß428.207(2)(b).
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines, Consumer Real Estate, Commercial Real Estate
 
 (a) When entering into certain consumer and commercial loan, credit card and lease contracts and consumer and commercial mortgage contracts, Wells Fargo must provide particular disclosures, including:
 
 (i) notice detailing state specific regulations regarding the customer‚Äôs rights and obligations that are required to be in the Note or Contract in at the time it is signed by Wells Fargo and the customer. (AL, CA, CO, GA, HI, IA, MN, MO, NC, SC, TX, VA, WA, WI); Ala. Code ¬ß5-19-6(a); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß1916.5(a)(6); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß5-3.5-102(1)(g)(iii); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß476-3(c); Iowa Code ¬ß535.17(2),(3); Minn. Stat. ¬ß47.605(3)(c); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß367.185(3); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß75-20(a)(3); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß34-29-150(a)(1-9); Tex. Bus. & Com. Ann. ¬ß26.02(e); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß55.1-318(B); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß48.22.115; Wis. Stat. ¬ß100.315(2)(b).
 
 (ii) notice detailing state specific regulations to the cosigner detailing their liability, role, and rights as a cosigner. (IA, MI, MT, NY, SC, VT); Iowa Code ¬ß537.3208(2)-(4); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß487.715; Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß72-6-204(1); N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß15-702(3); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß37-2-303(2); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß 102.
 (iii) notice informing the customer of their state specific regulations regarding the right to cancel and the procedure to cancel the contract. (AL, ID, MN, MO, NJ, UT, WI); Ala. Code ¬ß5-19-12(a); Idaho Code ¬ß48-1004(2); Minn. Stat. ¬ß216C.437(20)(a); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß408.500(5); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß11:5-9.17(c); Utah Admin. Code r. 152-11-9(A)(8); Wis. Stat. ¬ß424.401(2).
 
 (iv) notice detailing state specific regulations regarding the customer‚Äôs rights and obligations regarding contracts for mortgages or deeds of trust generally. (GA, ND, NJ, NY, OK, RI, SD, UT, WA); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß7-1-1014(3); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß35-03-17; N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß17:11C-78(a), N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß590-a(2); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß160:45-9-2(c); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß34-25.2-6(l); S.D. Codified Laws ¬ß 21-49-12; Utah Code Ann. ¬ß70D-2-303(1); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß208-620-820(7).
 
 (v) notice of other state specific disclosures, such as disclosures for opening a credit card, that are to be given to the customer when the contract is signed by the customer. (CA, HI, KS, MA, MN, MO, NC, NY, VA, WA, WI, WV); Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß1803.2(b)(3); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß476-3(d); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß58-2342(c) and (d); Mass. Gen. Laws ch.140D, ¬ß21; Minn. Stat. ¬ß47.59(12); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß432.045(3); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß75-20(a)(2); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11, ¬ß79.2; 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß5-60-30(G); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß208-620-820(1)(c); Wis. Stat. ¬ß224.075; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.305(1); W. Va. Code ¬ß46A-2-105(2).
 
 (vi) notice related to the insurance coverage provided incident to a loan, including limitations in coverage and the right to cancel such insurance. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 424.304(2), (3) In Tennessee, Wells Fargo must give the required notice in 14-point, red typeface. (TN) Tenn. Comp. R. & Regs. 0780-1-7-.15(a).

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - Open-End Credit
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR ‚Äì Credit Application Notices ‚Äì Early Disclosures ‚Äì Open-End Credit
 MCR0001030
 
 Covered States: CA, HI, GA, IA, KY, MA, MN, NC, OK, RI, VA, WI.
 
 When engaged in the marketing, solicitation, application-process, or other offering of the products listed below, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information pertaining to open-end credit accounts and similar products, including the amount of fees, interest, and options available to the consumer. 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Credit Cards
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Real Estate
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Credit Cards
 
 (a) In California, with the exception of mailed forms, all credit card applications must contain a form disclaimer with a check box. (CA) CAL. CIV. CODE ¬ß 1748.12(g)(i)
 (b) If Wells Fargo discloses marketing information concerning a cardholder to any person, Wells Fargo must notice the cardholder of her right to prohibit disclosure of marketing information revealing the cardholder‚Äôs identity to marketers of goods. (CA) CAL. CIV. CODE ¬ß 1748.12(b).
 (c) Wells Fargo must not exceed 18% simple interest per year and must disclose all fees or charges before assessing interest. (HA) HAW. REV. STAT. ¬ß 478-11.5(b). 
 (d) Wells Fargo must disclose the annual percentage rate on or with an application or solicitation to open a credit or charge card account and how any variable rates vary and are determined. If disclosures are made available at another location, like web sites, the annual percentage rate must be one in effect within the last 30 days. (OK) OKLA. ADMIN. CODE ¬ß 160:45-3-2(a), (b)(1); 
 (i) Wells Fargo must disclose certain fees that may be imposed for the issuance or availability of a credit or charge card. (OK) OKLA. ADMIN. CODE ¬ß 160:45-3-2(b). 
 (ii) Wells Fargo must disclose applicable statutory items given on or with an application sent (via mail or electronic communication) to consumers. When variable-rate disclosures are provided, the annual percentage rate must be accurate if the rate was in effect within 60 days before mailing the disclosures. (OK) OKLA. ADMIN. CODE ¬ß 160:45-3-2(b)(1)(B) and (c).
 (iii) Wells Fargo must provide disclosures, to the extent applicable, on or with an application or solicitation that is made available to the general public,. (OK) OKLA. ADMIN. CODE ¬ß 160:45-3-2(e).
 (iv) For telephonic applications or solicitations initiated by Wells Fargo, Wells Fargo must orally disclose the information contained in paragraphs (b)(1) through (b)(7) of OKLA. ADMIN. CODE ¬ß 160:45-3-2(d)(1). The oral disclosure is unnecessary in certain circumstances. (OK) OKLA. ADMIN. CODE ¬ß 160:45-3-2(d)(2).
 (e) Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures for applications or solicitations to open credit card accounts for persons under revolving loan account plans and must conspicuously disclose certain information regarding fees. OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(1); ¬ß 3-309.1(5)(a)(b).
 (f) If Wells Fargo imposes a fee, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures at least 30 days before the scheduled renewal date of the consumer‚Äôs credit or charge card. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-309.1(7).
 (g) Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures for any application to open a credit card account for any person under a revolving charge account plan or a solicitation to open such an account without requiring an application that is mailed. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(1)-(10). Wells Fargo must conspicuously disclose certain fees in each solicitation or application.
 (i) Wells Fargo must orally disclose certain information in telephone solicitations to open a credit card account for any person under a revolving charge account plan. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(3)(a). 
 (ii) Wells Fargo meets the disclosure requirements under subsections (b), (c), or (d), of OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1 if the information is made available to the public. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(4). 
 (h) Wells Fargo must, for any application or solicitation to open a charge-card account, conspicuously disclose certain fees. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(5)(a).
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide all disclosures required by federal law (in lieu of certain Georgia specific disclosures), to applications for (1) home equity lines of credit, (2) residential mortgage loans not secured by real property, and (3) residential mortgage loans related to a reverse mortgage. (GA) GA. COMP. R. & REGS. 80-11-1-.01(3).
 (b) Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures for open-end credit plans secured by the consumer‚Äôs dwelling. (OK) OKLA. ADMIN. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(4); R.I. GEN. LAWS ¬ß 6-27-11(1) & (2). 
 (c) Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures for revolving charge account plans secured by the consumer‚Äôs principal dwelling. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(1)(d). 
 (i) If the revolving charge account plan provides for an extension of credit secured by the customer‚Äôs dwelling, Wells Fargo must make several additional disclosures. (OK) OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(1)(h)‚Äì(n).
 (ii) Wells Fargo must also provide (a) a pamphlet published by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System pursuant to Section 4 of the Home Equity Consumer Protection Act of 1988; or (b) any pamphlet which provides substantially similar information to the information described in such section. OKLA. STAT. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(3)(a). 
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 (a) Wells Fargo must provide, on all application forms for open-end credit accounts distributed in CA on or after October 1, 1987, a statement granting the recipient the opportunity to receive the disclosure of terms pursuant to the Areias Credit Card Full Disclosure Act of 1986. (CA) CAL. CIV. CODE ¬ß 1748.11(g).
 (b) If Wells Fargo offers some or all of its customers consumer credit sales of goods or services both pursuant to (1) open-end credit and (2) not pursuant to open-end credit, Wells Fargo must give written notice of those alternative methods at the specific times provided in (IA) IOWA CODE ¬ß 537.3212(3)(a) & (b). 
 (i) Wells Fargo‚Äôs notice must also conspicuously state the certain charges to consumers in a particular form. (IA) IOWA CODE ¬ß 537.3212(2).
 (c) Before opening an account under a revolving credit plan, Wells Fargo must send a statement of the plan‚Äôs provisions containing certain required information. (KY) KY. REV. STAT. ¬ß 286.3-720(2). 
 (d) Before opening any account under an open-end consumer credit plan, Wells Fargo must disclose certain information regarding finance charges. (MA) MASS. GEN. LAWS ch. 140D ¬ß 11(a)(1)-(7).
 (e) At the time an open-ended credit account is established, Wells Fargo must provide to the borrower certain disclosures if Wells Fargo imposes a loan fee, points, or similar charge that relate to the opening of the account which is not included in the annual percentage rate given. MINN. STAT. ¬ß 47.59(12)(a).
 (f) Wells Fargo must conspicuously disclose certain fees and charges in any application, solicitation, offer of credit, or communication extending credit for certain open-end credit plans accessed through a credit card or a revolving credit loan accessed through a credit card. (NC) N.C. GEN. STAT. ¬ß 24-11.2(a) & (b)
 (g) For application or solicitations for revolving or open-end credit plans it for Rhode Island residents, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures. (RI) R.I. GEN. LAWS ¬ß 6-27-10(a)(1). The application or solicitation must be accompanied by a disclosure that satisfies the initial disclosure statement requirements of ‚ÄúRegulation Z.‚Äù (RI, VA) R.I. GEN. LAWS ¬ß 6-27-10(a)(2); VA. CODE ANN. ¬ß 6.2-432. 
 (h) For any open-end credit plan between Wells Fargo and a Wisconsin customer who is given the opportunity to enter into an open-end credit plan while present in a Wisconsin establishment (but who is not required to complete the application), Wells Fargo must satisfy certain notice requirements. (WI) WIS. STAT. ¬ß 422.308(2

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Typesize, Font and Color - 18-point Typesize
PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Mortgage Loans
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Mortgage Loans
 
 MCR 1068
 
 Covered States: AK, AR, CA, CO, CT, DC, IL, IN, MA, MD, ME, MN, NC, NJ, NM, NY, OH, OK, RI, SC, TN, TX, VA, WA, WI
 
 When engaged in the sale, lease, or other offering of mortgages and/or home loans, Wells Fargo must not include provisions, other than standard repayment provisions, that disadvantage the applicant/borrower. Such prohibited provisions include, but are not limited to, balloon payments, prepayment penalties, waivers of class actions or certain claims and defenses, and acceleration clauses.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans;
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; and
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate.
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 No generally applicable citations.
 
 State Specific Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 a. Acceleration Clauses
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not include an acceleration clause in the loan agreement. (AK, CA, CO, CT, DC, IN, NC, NJ, NM, NY, RI, SC, TN). Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-53-104(d); Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(i); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-102(1)(a); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-746c(7); D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1152.14; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-9-3-5(a); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 24-1.1E(b)(1); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-79 (Sec. 29) (f); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21A-4(L); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.2(a); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.2-5(d); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(B); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(1); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(12)
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include an acceleration clause, except under certain enumerated circumstances. (OH, VA, WI). Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.27(F); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1614(5); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 428.203(2)
 
 b. Prepayment Penalties
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not include prepayment penalties except under certain circumstances. (CT, IA, MA, NM, OH, OK, RI). Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-760e(a)(6); Iowa Code ¬ß 528.4; 209 Mass. Code Regs. 32.32(4); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21A-4(M); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.27(A); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(3)(a); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-2(d); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(1); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(2)(3). Massachusetts is the most restrictive.
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include a prepayment fee if the dwelling has been damaged by a natural disaster for which the Governor declared a state of emergency. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10242.6(b)
 
 iii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include a prepayment fee if the rate of interest exceeds an annual percentage rate of 8%. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 205/4(2)(a)
 
 iv. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include a prepayment fee through a rider or amendment to the loan contract when the terms of the contract state no penalty will be imposed or it is not authorized under state law. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 9-314
 
 v. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include a prepayment fee unless it offers the customer the option of choosing a loan product without a prepayment penalty in writing and initialed by the customer. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 428.207(2)(b)
 
 c. Increase or Change in the Interest Rate
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not increase the interest rate as a result of or after default. (CA, CO, IL, IN, NC, NJ, NY, OH, OK, RI, SC, TN, WI) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(e); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-102(1)(d); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 205/4(2)(b); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-9-4-5; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 24-1.1E(b)(4); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-26(c); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.2(d); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.27(B); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(4); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-2(d); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.2-6(e); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(1); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(4); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(14); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 428.203(4)
 
 ii. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not increase the interest ratge after default unless the payment becomes due and payable at least 120 months after the date of the loan. (AR) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-53-104(h).
 
 d. Charging Certain Fees
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not earn a commission or charge a prohibitive fee. (AK) Alaska Stat. ¬ß 06.60.340(6), (14)
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include provisions that impose certain fees, penalties, or other charges. (MN, RI, SC, WA) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 58.137(2)(c); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(2)(3); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(6); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-552. Washington is the most restrictive.
 
 iii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not charge a fee of >5% of total home loan or $800, whichever is greater. (RI) 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(1)
 
 e. Payments Other than Unpaid Balance
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any provision requiring the consumer to pay an amount other than the unpaid balance of the promissory note or loan agreement. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-79(c)
 
 f. Balloon Payments
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any provision that includes balloon payments unless such balloon payment becomes due and payable not less than 120 months after the date of the execution of the loan, or when the payment schedule is adjusted to account for the obligor‚Äôs seasonal income. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-102(1)(a).
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any provision that includes balloon payments with the scheduled payment twice as large as the average of earlier scheduled payments unless the payment schedule is adjusted to account for the obligor‚Äôs seasonal income. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(2)
 
 iii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any provision that includes balloon payments. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-2(d)
 
 g. Periodic Payments that Do Not Fully Amortize the Outstanding Principal Balance
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan with a term of five or fewer years, Wells Fargo must not include terms under which the aggregate amount of the regular periodic payments would not fully amortize the outstanding principal balance. (CA, OK) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(b)(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(5)
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan with a term of less than ten years, Wells Fargo must not include terms under which the aggregate amount of the regular periodic payments will not amortize the outstanding principal balance unless the payment schedule is adjusted to account for the obligor‚Äôs seasonable income. (AK) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-53-104(f)
 
 iii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not make a high-cost home loan that contains a payment schedule with regular periodic payments that cause the principal balance to increase. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(11)
 
 h. Negative Amortization
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any payment schedule with regular periodic payments that cause the principal balance to increase. (AK, CO, IN, NC, NJ, NY, OK, RI, SC, WI) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-53-104(g); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-102(1)(c); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-9-4-4(a)and(b); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 24-1.1E(b)(3); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-26(b); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.2(c); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(6); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-2(d); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.2-6(d); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(1); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(3); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 428.203(3)
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan having a term of 5 or fewer years, Wells Fargo must not include any payment schedule with regular periodic payments that cause the principal balance to increase. (OH) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.27(A); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.27(C)).
 
 i. Prohibitions on Disclosing a Credit Score
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not prohibit the disclosure of a credit score by a consumer reporting agency. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-111
 
 j. Provisions Relieving Liability
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any provision relieving Wells Fargo from liability for any claim, or from any legal remedy, which the borrower may have against the licensee. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-79(d)
 
 k. Provisions Regarding Arbitration
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any mandatory arbitration clause that: does not comply with rules set forth by a nationally recognized arbitration organization (such as the American Arbitration Association); does not require the arbitration proceeding to be conducted in either the federal judicial district where the subject property is located, the city closest to the consumer‚Äôs residence where a federal district court is located, or at another location mutually agreed upon by the parties; does not require Wells Fargo to contribute at least 50% of the amount of any filing fee; and does not require Wells Fargo to pay standard daily arbitration fees, both its own and those of the obligor, for at least the first day of arbitration. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-102(1)(e)
 
 l. Waivers of Class Actions or Certain Claims and/or Defenses
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include a waiver of participation in a class action lawsuit or other claims and defenses. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-746c(6)
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not prohibit the borrower from asserting claims and defenses or require certain forums. (RI, WA) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.2-5(e); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(B); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-55
 
 m. Choice of Law or Forum Provisions
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan agreement or a consumer home loan agreement, Wells Fargo must not include terms allowing for choice of law other than South Carolina unless allowed by federal law. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(7); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-70(E)
 
 n. Limiting Who May Acquire or Transfer Property
 
 i. Wells Fargo must not require a certified community development institution (CDFI) to limit ownership or occupancy to a preceding mortgagor or grantor, when a CDFI makes an offer to Wells Fargo to purchase an owner-occupied residential property in order to transfer said property to the immediately preceding mortgagor or grantor. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Real Prop. ¬ß 7-105.1(n-1)
 
 ii. When issuing a mortgage or home loan, Wells Fargo must not include any option or right to acquire equity and/or any other ownership interest in the property or in a partnership, corporation, trust, or other entity that owns property, except under enumerated conditions. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 5-334
 
 o. Payment to Contractors
 
 i. Wells Fargo must not pay a contractor under a home improvement contract from the proceeds of a high-cost home loan, unless it meets enumerated exceptions. (NY, RI) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.3(e); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(2)(3)
 
 p. Recommend or Encourage Default on Another Loan
 
 i. When issuing a mortgage or a home loan, Wells Fargo must not recommend or encourage default on an existing loan or other debt prior to closing a home loan that refinances all or any portion of such existing loan or debt. (RI) 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(B)
 
 q. Advance, Consolidated Payments
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not include terms where more than 2 periodic payments required under the loan are consolidated and paid in advance from the loan proceeds provided to the borrower. (AK, IN, NC, NJ, NM, NY, OH, OK, RI, SC, TN, WI) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-53-104(i); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-9-4-6; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 24-1.1E(b)(5); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-26(d); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21A-4(F); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.2(f); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.27(A); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(7); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.2-6(f); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-30(5); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(13); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 428.203(5)
 
 ii. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not require any periodic payments to be paid in advance from the loan proceeds provided to the obligor. (CA, CO, RI) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(d); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3.5-102(1)(f); 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(1)
 
 r. Larger Payments
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must not schedule a payment that is more than twice as large as the average of earlier scheduled payments. (IN, NC, NJ, NY, RI, TN, WI) Ind. Code ¬ß 24-9-4-3; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 24-1.1E(b)(2); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-26(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.2(b); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 34-25.2-6(c); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(10); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 428.203(1)
 
 s. Disclosure Requirements 
 
 i. Wells Fargo must not make a loan secured by a first lien real estate mortgage on an owner-occupied residential property containing not more than four dwelling units providing for prospective changes in the rate of interest unless certain enumerated disclosures are given in writing (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß138.053(2).
 
 t. Repayment Schedules
 
 i. When issuing an equity loan, at closing, Wells Fargo must schedule the loan to be repaid in substantially equal successive installments, not more often than every 14 days and not less often than monthly, beginning no more than 2 months from the date of the transaction unless modification is proper pursuant to certain enumerated provisions. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß153.11
 
 u. False Advertising
 
 i. Wells Fargo must not engage in false or misleading advertising. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-55
 
 v. Certification from Counselor
 
 i. When issuing a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must receive certification from a counselor with a third-party nonprofit organization approved by the USHUD that the Applicant/borrower has received counseling on the advisability of the loan transaction. (RI) 230 R.I. Code R. 40-10-3.5(C)(1)

Title: PSDR - Retail Leases - Motor Vehicles - Prohibitions and Restrictions
Summary:
Covered States: CA, DE, IL, MD, NH, NJ, NV, NY, OH, WA, WI
 When engaged in the sale or lease of motor vehicles, Wells Fargo must refrain from certain state-specific activity or provide certain specific disclosures concerning the agreement. 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Prohibited Contract Provisions in Motor Vehicle Lease Agreements
 (a) When engaged in a motor vehicle lease agreement, Wells Fargo must not include any provision by which the lessee relieves the Wells Fargo from liability for any legal remedies which the lessee may have against the Wells Fargo under the contract or any separate instruments executed in connection therewith. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2986.3(c)
 (b) When engaged in a motor vehicle lease agreement, Wells Fargo must not include any provision permitting venue to be brought anywhere other than certain specified counties. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2986.3(d)
 (c) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not include certain prohibited provisions, including acceleration of maturity of the lease absent default; acceleration of maturity of the lease following a default solely due to failure to make timely rental payments; acceleration of maturity of the lease solely because Wells Fargo deems itself insecure; power of attorney to confess judgment; assignment of wages; waivers for certain illegal acts or authority for breaches of peace committed during repossession; power of attorney for collection of payments or repossession of vehicle; waiver of certain legal rights and remedies; or waiver of certain statutory provisions. The most restrictive state is Maryland, which includes each restriction above and provides that inclusion of a prohibited provision will render the provision unenforceable but not affect the lease‚Äôs validity. (IL, MD NH, NY) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(m); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(l)(2), (l)(8), (m); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:5(I); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:5(II); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:5(III); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(a), (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(b), (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(c), (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(d), (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(e), (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(f) and (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(g), (15); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(14)(h), (15)
 (d) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not include provisions contrary to certain statutory requirements. Any such provisions will be void but will not otherwise affect the validity of the lease. (IL, WI) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(n); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.203(10)
 (e) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not include any provision creating a security interest in personal or real property to secure the obligations assumed under the lease. In Illinois and New York, any such security interest will be void. (IL, NY, WI) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/30(a); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/30(b); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 338(1); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 338(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.205(1)
 (f) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not include any provision setting forth an early termination obligation in an amount exceeding the sum of certain specified charges. If the lessee exercises an option to purchase, Wells Fargo must not charge an early termination fee. In New Hampshire, the amount or method of calculating the early termination obligation must be conspicuously disclosed in the lease.. (IL, NH, WI) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/45(b); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:17(II), (IV); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.207(2), (4) In Maryland, penalties and charges for early termination or default must comply with the Consumer Leasing Act (MD). Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2010 
 (g) When engaged in motor vehicle lease or, in New York, purchase agreements, Wells Fargo must not include any provision waiving, limiting, or otherwise disclaiming certain statutory rights. Such agreements will be considered void. In New York, this applies only to the purchase or lease of used motor vehicles. (MD, NY) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2005(d); N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 198-b(d)(1)-(3)
 (h) When engaged in an agreement for the purchase, lease, or repair of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must not include any provision wherein the lessee waives the right to make statements regarding the goods or services provided by Wells Fargo. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-16.1(a); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 56:12-49.1
 (i) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not include any provision wherein lessee waives any claim or defense or which requires the execution of a note which will cut-off as to third parties any right of action or defense which the lessee may have against the lessor. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(10)
 (j) When engaged in motor vehicle lease or purchase agreements, Wells Fargo must not include any false or misleading statement or representation within the agreement. (WA) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 46.70.180(2)(a)
 (k) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo may not include a provision charging for insurance coverage if the lessee provides proof of coverage required under the lease, except as agreed by both parties under the statutory requirement. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.203(6)(b)(3) 
 (l) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not include any provision placing lessee in default with respect to inspection when lessee does not obtain a counter-inspection or pre-termination inspection. Such provisions will not be valid in these circumstances. Further, in New Hampshire, Wells Fargo must not increase the charges stated in a lessee counter-inspection. In both states, if no such counter-inspection is obtained, a pre-termination itemized bill prepared by the Wells Fargo as required by the statutory provision, which is conclusive upon the Wells Fargo. (NH, WI) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(V)(a)-(b), (X); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:19(IX), (X); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.208(6)
 2. Prohibited Acts in the Promotion or Advertising of Motor Vehicle Sales or Leases 
 (a) When engaged in the promotion of a motor vehicle lease agreement, Wells Fargo must not state that any specific lease at a specific amount or terms is available. However, inclusion of such a statement will not affect the validity of a subsequent contract. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.71(c), (d)
 (b) When engaged in leasing motor vehicles, Wells Fargo must not make certain misleading or deceptive oral or written statements or visual depictions, or advertise in certain misleading or deceptive manners. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2003(a)
 (c) When engaged in the provision of motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not fail to register the motor vehicle or provide the lessee with appropriate documentation to register; advertise for a specific motor vehicle without a VIN or license number; or refuse to least to a creditworthy lessee. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:26(I)-(IV)
 3. Other Prohibitions and Requirements Relating to Motor Vehicle Sales and Leasing 
 (a) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must adhere to certain statutory requirements regarding the purchase and cost of liability insurance on the motor vehicle. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(6)
 (b) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must agree in writing to the amount of the lessee's liability under the retail lease agreement after the lessee returns the vehicle to the Wells Fargo or the lessee has fully satisfied his or her obligations under the agreement. Otherwise, Wells Fargo must provide ten days written notice of intention to sell the vehicle. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 340(2)
 (c) When engaged in motor vehicle or trailer lease agreements, Wells Fargo must, at the end of the lease term, if required, adjust the rental price higher or lower by reference to the amount the lessor realizes upon the sale or other disposition of the motor vehicle or trailer. (OH) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 4505.13(D)
 (d) When offering guaranteed asset protection waivers in lease agreements, Wells Fargo must provide certain written disclosures. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 218.0148(3) 
 (e) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must provide notice of actual assignment or intent thereon. In the event Wells Fargo fails to do so, lessee may validly make payment to the last known holder. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(12) 
 (f) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must notify the lessee in writing of any advance, including the amount and repayment options. Such advancement will be subject to the agreement‚Äôs default provisions. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(7)(c)
 (g) When entering into motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must promptly provide a refund on advanced payments pending execution of the agreement if the agreement is not ultimately executed. In New York, such refund must be provided with 15 business days of rejection of the application. Further, Wells Fargo must not sell, offer for sale, or transfer any trade-in vehicle provided by lessee pending execution of the agreement until such agreement is fully executed. If no agreement is executed, in Wisconsin, Wells Fargo must promptly return the vehicle. (NY, WI) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 334(1), (4), (5); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 334(3); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.202(1), (2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.202(1), (2) 
 (h) When engaged in retail installment contracts for the sale or lease of motor vehicles, Wells Fargo must not install in the motor vehicle or use starter interruption technology unless agreed to in writing by the buyer. Such writing must be separate from the lease or sale agreement. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 598.9715(2) 
 (i) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must disclose fees and calculations regarding fees for excess wear and use or excess mileage in 8-point bold, uppercase font, provide a written statement at time of inspection, and deliver an itemized list of wear and tear as well as a statement of any excess miles to the lessor within 30 days of obtaining possession of the vehicle. (In Maryland, Wells Fargo must not advertise a capitalized cost reduction unless it is offered to all and must provide the lessee the opportunity to be present at any visual inspection conducted upon return of the vehicle. (MD, WI) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2003(a); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2005(g); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.208(7)
 (j) In Wisconsin, Wells Fargo must comply with the statutory requirements or else may not demand such charges and waives the right to collect upon failure to substantially comply. Additionally, Wells Fargo must conspicuously include such charges in the agreement to be considered damage to lease property within the meaning of the statutory requirement. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 429.208(7); Wis. Admin. Code DFI-WCA ¬ß 1.38
 (k) When engaged motor vehicle leases allowing a lessee to cure a default with a new motor vehicle lease in the same vehicle, Wells Fargo must not use less favorable terms in the new lease than were available to the lessee in the original. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2003(b)
 (l) When engaged in a motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must disclose in the lease any fee of no more than $5 per statement if the lessee requests more than 1 statement in any 12-month period. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(k)(3)
 (m) When engaged in motor vehicle lease agreements, Wells Fargo must not charge for insurance unless the insurance is from an authorized Illinois insurance company. Further, Wells Fargo must allow the purchase of insurance from an agent or broker of the lessee‚Äôs selection. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(f)(1); 15 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(f)(1)
 (n) When engaged in a motor vehicle lease agreements, and, in Delaware, retail installment sales contracts Wells Fargo must not sign an agreement that includes blank spaces to be filled in after signed. In California and New Hampshire, this restriction applies only to the lessee‚Äôs signature. In Delaware, Illinois, Maryland, and New York, there is an exception for the VIN number and date of first payment if the vehicle has not yet been delivered. In New Hampshire, Wells Fargo must furnish a copy of the agreement, signed by both Wells Fargo and the lessee, to the lessee, at the time it is executed . (CA, DE, IL, MD, NH, NY) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(i); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(i); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 636/25(i); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(h)(1), (2); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 361-D:3(II); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(9)
