 (o) When engaged in a motor vehicle lease agreement, Wells Fargo and, in Delaware, retail installment sales contracts, Wells Fargo must not allow for delinquency collection charges on payments in default, and attorney fees and costs, subject to certain specified maximums; and, in Maryland, charges for certain dishonored checks, subject to certain maximums unless provisions are included in the agreement. In Delaware and New York, payments must be in default for at least ten days. (DE, MD, NY) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, ¬ß 2907(h); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2002(g)(1); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(8)(a); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 337(8)(a) 
 (p) When engaged in a motor vehicle lease agreement, Wells Fargo must provide a copy of the executed contract to the lessee prior to delivery of the vehicle. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2985.8(h), (i)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Required Terms and Provisions - Deposit/Share Accounts or Services
Summary:
Covered States: MD, MI, MN, NC, NJ
 When providing certain accounts, Wells Fargo must provide to customers certain information, such as the account agreement or other disclosures of agreement terms, conditions and required notices, and in some instances, such disclosures must be made within statute-specific time frames. 
 1. Other Services - Special Services - Safekeeping Services
 2. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts
 3. Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 4. Deposit / Money Movement - Debit Card ‚Äì Check and ATM
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 Md. Code Ann., Fin. Inst. ¬ß 1-204(e)(2) 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Other Services - Special Services - Safekeeping Services, Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts, Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 (a) When providing certain accounts, Wells Fargo must provide a written account agreement: 
 (i) When renting safe deposit boxes, Wells Fargo must enter into an agreement containing requisite information, signed by all parties who are to have entry to the safe deposit box. Wells Fargo must employ certain procedures for restricting access to safe deposit boxes and the corresponding keys; such procedures are adjusted depending on whether the safe deposit box is rented. (MN) Minn. R. 2675.2300
  (ii) When providing multi-party deposit accounts, Wells Fargo must include statutorily specific account terms and disclosures, including any rights of survivorship, in the account agreement. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-12.4(a)(1)-(4) Maryland has the most restrictive requirement; there, Wells Fargo must specify in the multi-party account agreement, in clear and conspicuous language unless contrary language is given, the survivorship rights to the account upon the death of an account holder. (MD ) Md. Code Ann., Fin. Inst. ¬ß 1-204(e)(1); . When providing multi-party accounts in North Carolina, and upon the death an account holder, Wells Fargo must make certain disbursements of the funds held in the account. (NC) N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 41-2.1(b)
 (iii) When providing an account that is accessible through a funds transfer facility, Wells Fargo must provide a written agreement at the time the customer is issued a card or other access to the funds transfer facility. The agreement must contain account terms and conditions and additional disclosures and notices specified by statute. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 488.19

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Disclosures in Retail Installment Contracts
Summary:
Covered States: AK, DC, HI, IL, MI, NM, NV, OH, OR, TX, VA, VT, WA, WI 
 When purchasing or requiring insurance for Retail Installment Contracts, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures and notices to the debtor advising that creditor purchased insurance, the policy and coverage provided, and a restricted charge for the insurance premium that may be passed onto the debtor.
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/9.03; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß348.209; Vt. Stat. tit. 9, ¬ß2405(i)
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Insurance Disclosures in Retail Installment Contracts, Generally
 (a) When purchasing or requiring insurance for Retail Installment Contracts, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) list in the contract who is responsible for purchasing the insurance coverage. (AK, MI, NM, NV, OR, WA); Alaska Stat. ¬ß45.10.130(2); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß445.863(a)(2); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß56-1-4(B); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß97.265(2); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß83.110(1)(b); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.140(2)
 (ii) provide debtor with notice and explanation of the purchased insurance coverage. (AK, DC, HI, MI, NM, NV, OH, OR, TX, VT, WA); Alaska Stat. ¬ß45.10.130(1), (4); D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 16, ¬ß321(4); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-8(a); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß445.863(a)(1),(b); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß56-1-4(A); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß97.265(1),(4); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß1317.05(A); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß83.110(1)(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß345.208(a),(b); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß2355(g) Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.140(1)
 (A) If the Retail Installment Contract is for a motor vehicle, it must be disclosed whether the insurance includes, or does not include, coverage such as bodily injury, public, or property damage liability, or any other policy that would protect debtor‚Äôs interests. (AK, DC, HI, NV, VT, WA, WI) Alaska Stat. ¬ß45.10.130(1); D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 16, ¬ß321(4); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-8(b); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß97.265(1); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß2355(g); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.140(1); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.140(1); Wis. Stat. ¬ß218.0143(1)-(2)
 (B) If insurance is purchases by the seller, a copy of the policy must be mailed to the customer within 45 days to the address on the contract. Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.140(4)
 (iii) not force debtor to choose a specific insurance company. (HI, VA, VT); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß476-8(a); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß38.2-3737(G)(2); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß2355(g)
 (A) Additionally, creditor must disclose to the debtor if creditor‚Äôs insurance company receives any item of value for purchasing insurance from that specific agency, such as rebates or kickbacks. (DC, IL); D.C. Mun. Regs. tit. 16, ¬ß105(105.7); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/11.1
 2. Restrictions On Insurance Premiums To Be Paid By Debtor in Retail Installment Contracts 
 (a) When charging the debtor for insurance coverage, in regards to a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must not: 
 (i) charge an amount greater than the premium itself to the debtor. (AK, HI, MI, NM, NV, OR, VT, WA) Alaska Stat. ¬ß45.10.130; Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß476-8(a); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß445.863(a)(3); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß56-1-4(C); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß97.265(3); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß83.110(1)(c); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß2355(g); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 63.14.140(3)
 (A) Illinois does not define a limit, but states that the fees cannot be ‚Äúmore than the fees associated with perfecting the [security] interest.‚Äù 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/23.1
 (B) Ohio allows charging greater than the insurance premium, but the debtor may deduct an amount equal to three times the difference from the amount owed to the creditor. Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß1317.05(A)
 (C) Texas does not have a stated limit but states that the calculated fees for the subject insurance must be within ‚Äúlawful rates.‚Äù (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß345.208(a)(1)(A)
 (ii) keep debtor‚Äôs insurance payments, or continue with insurance charges, if the insurance coverage in question is cancelled or voided. Any funds that were slated for future insurance payments by debtor are to be credited back to the debtor. (AK, HI, IL, NM, VT); Alaska Stat. ¬ß45.10.130(3); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß476-8(c); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 405/11; N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß56-1-4(C); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß2355(g)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - ARM and Variable Rate Notifications - Disclosure of Interest Rates and Rate Changes
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices -ARM and Variable Rate Notifications - Disclosure of Interest Rates and Rate Changes
 
 MCR 1028
 
 Covered States: CA, NC, NY, OH, OK, PA, SC, UT, WA, WI
 
 When offering variable rate loans, Wells Fargo must disclose that the rate on the loan is variable, when and under what circumstances the rate would be adjusted, any index, margin, or calculation relied on to determine the rate, the rate changes‚Äô effect on the monthly payment, how long each rate will apply, any limitations to the magnitude of rate changes, when the finance charges start accruing, any prepayment rights the borrower has, and a statement that the rate does not include any other fees or costs besides interest. Wells Fargo must also give consumers notice of any changes in the interest rate. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1923.2(g)(4); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 49-31b(a)(b); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(B); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-8(f); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 24-11.1(b); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-4(1), (2), (5)(G); Utah Admin. Code r. 335-2-4; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.055(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.056(6); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.421(3)(a)-(c); and Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.308(2)
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans and Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 a. Wells Fargo must provide an applicant for a variable rate account with a specific statutory disclosure in a certain format regarding the adjustable rate. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1916.7(c)
 b. Wells Fargo must provide a specific disclosure statement in a specific form to any applicant for a renegotiable rate mortgage loan. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1916.8(e)
 c. At least 60 days prior to the due date of a monthly payment that will be affected by a change in the interest rate, Wells Fargo must mail a specific notice to the borrower regarding the rate change and its effect on the monthly payment. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1916.7(d)
 d. For a variable rate account, Wells Fargo must include limitations on the rate increase in the scheduled payments due to graduation and changes in the interest rate in the note. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1916.7(b)(3)
 e. Wells Fargo must provide the consumer a copy of the most recent Federal Reserve Board publication designed to provide the public with descriptive information concerning adjustable-rate mortgages at the same time it makes disclosures in accordance with federal regulations. Wells Fargo must also display the descriptive information to in a publically accessible area of the lenders office. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1921(b)(c)
 f. When offering step mortgages, Wells Fargo must include a table indicating the monthly payment at identified interest rates for the loans entire term. (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 82.6(e)
 g. In addition to the general disclosures above, Wells Fargo must provide the consumer: 
 i. A table based on a $10,000 extension of credit showing the annual percentage rate, and minimum periodic payment, under each repayment account;
 ii. the minimum amount of any periodic payment which may be required based on a $10,000 outstanding balance when the maximum annual percentage rate is in effect;
 iii. the earliest date the maximum annual interest rate may be imposed; and
 iv. An example, based on a $10,000 outstanding balance and a variable interest rate which was recently in effect under the same plan, showing what the minimum monthly or periodic payment would be and the time it would take to repay the entire $10,000 if the consumer paid only the minimum payments and obtained no additional extensions of credit. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.2(1)
 h. Wells Fargo must provide an applicant for a renegotiable rate mortgage a disclosure notice in the specific form proscribed by the statute. (PA) 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 13.33(f)
 i. Wells Fargo must provide a comparison between a variable rate mortgage offering and standard fixed rate mortgage offering which shows a side-by-side comparison of the differing interest rates, the payment schedule for each including showing the worst case scenario that shows every maximum increase that might occur, the highest possible payment during the term, the total payment over the whole term, information about the index used, a description of the borrower‚Äôs options in the event of a rate increase, a statement that borrowers have the option of a standard mortgage instrument, and who the creditor may contact in case of questions about the disclosure. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. Regs. ¬ß 15-31(c)(5)
 j. Wells Fargo must provide written disclosures about the amount being earned on the loan in a rom provided by the Department of Consumer Affairs. (SC) S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 37-23-75 (A) and (B)
 k. Account statements from Wells Fargo must include the rate or weighted average of rates applicable to the account over the period of the statement. (UT) Utah Admin. Code r. ¬ß335-2-5(1), (2)
 l. Wells Fargo must include a schedule stating when the rate will be adjusted in any credit agreement for a variable or adjustable rate line of credit. (UT) Utah Admin. Code r. ¬ß335-2-6
 m. Before accepting an application for any loan, Wells Fargo must disclose to the consumer a toll free number and a person to direct any questions to and specific loan terms that apply relating to the interest rate and pre-payment rights. (W.V.) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-19-11(11.1).1
 n. Wells Fargo must not provide a variable rate loan with a term of more than 40 years or provide for more than a one percent increase in the interest rate once every six months. Additionally, Wells Fargo can only adjust the variable interest rate as an approved index adjusts and if the initial interest rate is discounted, wells Fargo must use the most recently available index prior to the expiration of the initial interest rate period. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.056(2); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 138.056(4)(2m)
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards and Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 a. Wells Fargo must disclose all rates, both periodic and fixed, that may apply to a credit card expressed an annual percentage rate or range of annual percentage rates. The rates are required to have been pulled within a specific amount of time before sending in order to be considered accurate. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-2(b)(1)
 b. Wells Fargo must make required disclosures clearly and conspicuously, grouped together, and separated from other unrelated information. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(1)(A)
 c. For variable rate loans, Wells Fargo must, in addition to the general disclosures above, provide the consumer with:
 i. What the minimum periodic payment would be for a $10,000 outstanding balance at the maximum annual rate, the earliest date such maximum rate can be imposed, and an example using historical rates of how a variable rate has applied to a $10,000 balance in the past. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(4)(L); and
 ii. Information regarding if there is a certain time period wherein the credit can be repaid without the consumer incurring a service charge. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(1) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(1)
 d. Within three business days of receiving a consumer‚Äôs loan application, Wells Fargo must provide disclosures in accordance with the Truth-in-Lending Act and Regulation Z. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(1)(a), (3); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.030(2)
 e. When providing open-end credit plans to a resident of this state, Wells Fargo must appropriately divide all applications, even those contained in advertisements, in appropriately captioned subsections setting forth the annual rate, that the rate is varied, the date the finance charge begins to accrue, whether an annual fee is charged, and any other charges or fees that may accrue. (WA) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.308(1).

Title: PSDR - Duty to Notify of Forgeries, Alterations and Statement Errors - Bank's Statement of Account Must Provide Customer with Sufficient Information to Reasonably Identify Items Paid (U.C.C. ¬ß 4-406)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NE, NJ, NV, NH, NM, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY 
 When providing deposit accounts, if Wells Fargo sends or makes available a statement of account showing payment of items, Wells Fargo must either return or make available to the customer the items paid or disclose in the statement sufficient information to identify the items paid, such as the item number, amount, and date of payment. 
 1. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts; Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.04.406(a); Ala. Code ¬ß 7-4-406(a); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-4-406(a); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-4406(a); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42a-4-406(a); D.C. Code ¬ß 28:4-406(a); Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 4-406(a); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 674.406(1); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 11-4-406(a); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 490:4-406(a); Iowa Code ¬ß 554.4406(1); Idaho Code ¬ß 28-4-406(1); 810 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/4-6406(a); Ind. Code ¬ß 26-1-4-406(a); Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 84-4-406(a); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 355.4-406(1); La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 10:4-406(a); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 106, ¬ß 4-406(a); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 406(a); Me. Stat. tit. 11, ¬ß 4-406(1-A); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 440.4406(1); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 336.4-406(a); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 400.4-406(a); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-4-406(a); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 30-4-406(1); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25-4-406(a); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 41-04-37(1); Neb. Rev. Stat. UCC ¬ß 4-406(a); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 12A:4-406(a); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 55-4-406(a); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 104.4406(1); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1304.35(A); Okla. Stat. tit. 12A, ¬ß 4-406(a); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 74.4060(1); 13 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 4406(a); 19 L.P.R.A. ¬ß 956(a); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 6A-4-406(a); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 36-4-406(a); S.D. Codified Laws ¬ß 57A-4-406(a); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-4-406(a); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70A-4-406(1); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 8.4-406(a); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 404.406(1); W.Va. Code ¬ß 46-4-406(a); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 34.1-4-406(a)
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts; Deposit / Money Movement - Savings Accounts
 (a) If Wells Fargo chooses not to return the items when it sends or makes available a statement of account to the customer, Wells Fargo must provide in that statement of account the telephone number that the customer may call to request an item or a legible copy of the items. (CA, CO, NH, TX, WA) Cal. Com. Code ¬ß 4406(a); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 4-4-406(a); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 382-A:4-406(a); Tex. Bus. & Com. Ann. ¬ß 4.406(a); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 62A.4-406(a)
 (b) If a customer requests, Wells Fargo must return to the customer items shown as paid or copies of the items paid. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9A, ¬ß 4-406(a)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Refund of Insurance Premiums
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Refund of Insurance Premiums
 
 MCR1090
 
 Covered States: AZ, AR, DE, GA, IL, IN, ME, MO, NC, ND, NH, NJ, MD, MI, MO, OH, OR, UT, VA, WA, WI
 
 When providing insurance products to borrower consumers, Wells Fargo must provide certain state-specific disclosures relating to the borrower‚Äôs right to receive a refund of insurance premiums and the amount of the refund.
 
 1. Insurance products 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 No generally applicable citations.
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Insurance Products 
 a) Refund of Premium Upon Cancellation of Insurance by the Insured 
 i. Wells Fargo must provide a disclosure to the insured consumer stating a refund of any insurance premiums paid by the consumer will be provided if the consumer cancels insurance purchased in connection with a consumer lender loan within certain timeframes. (AZ, DE, ND, NH) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-636(B); Del. Code Ann. tit. 18, ¬ß 3706(a); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 26.1-37-07(1)(e); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408-A:8(II). OH has the most restrictive requirement and requires the disclosure state a refund will be provided if insurance is cancelled within 25 days after such loan is made. (OH) Ohio Admin. Code 1301:8-2-16(B); 1301:8-3-17(B). 
 
 b) Wells Fargo must include in its disclosures regarding insurance premium refunds: 
 i. That the cancellation of insurance may be effected upon the written request of the borrower together with the return of the policy or certificate of insurance to Wells Fargo. (OH) Ohio Admin. Code 1301:8-2-16(B); 1301:8-3-17(B);
 ii. That purchase of consumer credit insurance is optional and not a condition of obtaining credit approval, the conditions of eligibility, a brief description of the coverage, and information on whether the consumer may purchase multiple types of consumer credit insurance separately or as a package, if applicable. (DE) Del. Code Ann. tit. 18, ¬ß 3706(a); and
 iii. That in the event insurance does not become effective or in the case of termination of the insurance before the scheduled maturity date of the indebtedness, a refund of any premium amount paid by the consumer for insurance must be paid or credited promptly to the consumer. (GA, IL, ME, MI, MO, ND, NJ) Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 33-31-9(c); Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 110.170(c)-(e); ; Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 550.618; Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 385.050(2); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 26.1-37-08(2); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 11:2-3.13(b).
 
 c) Wells Fargo must provide disclosures regarding insurance premium refunds options within each individual policy, group certificate or notice of proposed insurance. (AZ, DE, MI, ND, NH, NJ, VA) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-636(C); Del. Code Ann. tit. 18, ¬ß 3706(e); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 550.618; N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 26.1-37-07(5); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408-A:8 (II); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17B:29-8(b); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 38.2-3722(C).
 
 d) When Wells Fargo does not accept the risk as an insurer, it must send the insured consumer a policy or certificate of insurance that includes the name and home-office address of a substituted insurer and the amount of the premium to be charged, and if the amount of premium is less than that set forth in the notice of proposed insurance, provide a refund to the consumer (ND, OR, UT, VA) N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 26.1-37-07(8); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 743.377(5); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 31A-22-806(5); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 38.2-3724(F). If no insurer accepts the risk, then all premiums paid must be refunded or credited to the consumer within 30 days of application. (ND) N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 26.1-37-07(8).
 
 e) Credit Life Insurance
 i. Wells Fargo must refund any premium paid by the insured when credit life insurance or credit disability insurance is rescinded due to material misrepresentation by the insured. (AR) Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 23-87-111(a)(6); and
 ii. When Wells Fargo requires an insured consumer to make any payment for credit life insurance or credit accident and health insurance and an individual policy or group certificate of insurance is not issued, Wells Fargo must immediately give written notice to such debtor and shall promptly make an appropriate credit to the account. (IN, MO, NC, NJ, WI) Ind. Code ¬ß 27-8-4-8(C); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 385.050(2); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 58-57-50(e); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17B:29-8(c); Wis. Admin. Code Ins ¬ß 3.25(9)(c).
 
 f) When offering property insurance, Wells Fargo must provide the consumer, at the time the loan is made, a written notice of the consumer's right to provide a loss payable endorsement for the protection of the Wells Fargo and the insured right to a refund of the entire property insurance premium. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-312(d)(1)(v).
 
 g) For motor vehicle retail installment contracts involving insurance, Wells Fargo must send disclosures within 30 days to the insured listing the premium amounts, types of insurance, coverages and all terms, exceptions, limitations, restrictions and conditions of the insurance. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/9.
 
 h) Wells Fargo must provide a copy of the disclosure notice to the insured consumer, and a copy must be made part of Wells Fargo‚Äôs file. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß¬ß 38.2-233(C)(2); 38.2-3735(2).
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 a) When acting as a mortgage broker, within three business days of receiving a borrower‚Äôs loan application, Wells Fargo must disclose the following content: the annual percentage rate, finance charge, amount financed, total amount of all payments, number of payments, amount of each payment, amount of points or prepaid interest and the conditions and terms under which any loan terms may change between the time of disclosure and closing of the loan; and if a variable rate, the circumstances under which the rate may increase, any limitation on the increase, the effect of an increase, an example of the payment terms resulting from an increase, the itemized costs of any credit report, appraisal, title report, title insurance policy, mortgage insurance, escrow fee, property tax, insurance, structural or pest inspection, and any other third-party provider's costs associated with the residential mortgage loan. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(1).

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices and Acknowledgments - Confessions of Judgment
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices and Acknowledgments - Confessions of Judgment
 
 MCR 1064
 
 Covered States: AL, AK, CA, DC, ID, IN, KS, KY, ME, MD, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NE, NH, NJ, NV, NY, NC, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, UT, VA, VT, WV, WI
 
 Wells Fargo must not include a confession of judgment in any contract, agreement, note, or other instrument in connection with any of the below products and services.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 
 D.C. Code ¬ß 28-3804(b); Idaho Code ¬ß 28-43-305; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-2-415; Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-306; Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-306; Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-1023(b)(2)(iii); MD - Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-923(b)(2) and (3)); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 13-301(12); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 493.73(a); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 408.365(2)(1); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 399-A:15(VIII)(b); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 590-a(2); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 80.9(b); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25A-18; Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-415; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b)(10); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-1; W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-2-117; W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-4-109(5)(G)(3); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.405(1)and(2)
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Assignment of Wages
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not include an assignment of wages or similar provision in any contract, agreement, obligation or other instrument. (NJ, VT) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-79(a), (b); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß 2456.
 
 b. Wells Fargo must not include an assignment of wages or similar provision in any contract, agreement, obligation or other instrument. Wells Fargo must not prohibit giving an assignment of wages in a separate instrument. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1804.1(c))
 
 
 2. Power of Attorney
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not include a power of attorney to appear on behalf of the borrower in a judicial proceeding in any contract, agreement, note, or other instrument. (AL, KY, MN, MS, MT, NE, NV, NY, NC, SC, VA) Ala. Code ¬ß 5-18-16(b); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 286.4-580(1); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 56.12; Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-67-127(2); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 32-5-305(1); Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 8-823(3); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 675.350(1); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 352; N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 53-181(c); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 34-29-170; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-1524(I) 
 
 b. In addition to the requirement set forth in 2(a), Wells Fargo must not prohibit inclusion of a power of attorney in any agreement or instrument if it is in a form of note approved by the Commissioner for use in the financing of insurance premiums. (VT) - Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 8, ¬ß 2229.
 
 3. Notes and Promises to Pay
 
 a. Wells Fargo must include: 
 i. the total amount to be repaid, a schedule or description of payments, and the agreed rate or aggregate amount of charge (AL) Ala. Code ¬ß 5-18-16(b)
 ii. the total amount to be repaid, a schedule or description of payments, the agreed rate or aggregate amount of charge, a schedule or description of payments, the agreed rate or aggregate amount of charge, and the date (KY) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 286.4-580(1)
 iii. the total amount to be repaid, a schedule or description of payments, the agreed rate or aggregate amount of charge, a schedule or description of payments, the agreed rate or aggregate amount of charge, and the amount of the loan before the addition of precomputed charges. (MS) Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-67-127(2))
 
 4. Confession of Judgment Procedures
 
 a. To obtain a confession of judgment in connection with any of the products and services below, Wells Fargo must provide the consumer with a document that is labeled clearly "Confession of Judgment." (AK) Alaska Admin. Code tit. 3, ¬ß 01.210(d)(3)
 
 5. Acceleration of Loan and Repossession of Collateral
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not include any acceleration of a loan or repossession of collateral in any contract, agreement, or instrument unless there is a default under the terms of that contract, agreement, or other instrument. (PA) 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 303(d)(vi)
 
 b. Wells Fargo must not include a clause permitting Wells Fargo to accelerate payment because Wells Fargo or other holders of the note have deemed themselves insecure. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:9A-59.32(c)
 
 6. Blanks
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not be a party to any contract, agreement, or other instrument that includes any blanks to be filled in after execution or otherwise be incomplete. (AL, KY, MS) Ala. Code ¬ß 5-18-16(b); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 286.4-580(1); Miss. Code Ann. ¬ß 75-67-127(2).
 
 7. Waiver of Notice
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not include any waiver of notice in any loan contract. (OR, UT) Or. Admin. R. 441-730-0280(2); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-2-201)
 
 8. Costs of Collection and Attorney's Fees
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not include an agreement to pay the costs of collection or attorney's fees in any loan contract or instrument. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 8-823(3)
 
 9. Statutory Power of Sale
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not prohibit the inclusion of confession of judgment or any other power of attorney in a statutory power of sale. (RI) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-5(b))
 
 10. Prize Schemes
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not include a confession of judgment or waiver of legal rights (including, but not limited to, the right to cancel the sale in accordance with the provisions of the Fair Trade Law article) in any prize award scheme contract or receipt. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 369-ee(3)(c)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Fee Disclosures and Refundability - Itemization of Disclosures and Amounts
Summary:
MCR1088
 
 Covered States: HI, IA, IL, LA, MA, OK, TX, WI
 
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 
 1. Advisory, investment, brokerage, asset management
 2. Deposit / Money Movement - Checking Accounts
 3. Deposit / Money Movement - Debit Card - Check and ATM
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 12. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 13. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 14. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 
 a. In all solicitations or applications for a credit card plan, Wells Fargo must disclose: interest amount, interest start date, any annual fees, any fixed fees, and that charges on the card are payable on receipt of the statement of charges. (HI) Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 478-11.5(a)
 
 b. When issuing credit cards, Wells Fargo must disclose the following fees: annual and periodic fees and any other fees that may be imposed for issuance or availability of a credit card, fees for extension of credit in the form of cash, fees for late payment, fees for exceeding credit limit, and fees imposed to transfer an outstanding balance. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-2(b); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(2); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(5)(a)
 
 c. In all applications or verbal solicitations for opening credit card accounts under a revolving charge account plan, Wells Fargo must disclose annual fees, transaction charges, statement charges incurred are due upon receipt of charge statement, fees imposed for extension of credit in the form of cash, late fees, fees for overextension of credit, applicable rates, finance charges, and grace periods. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-310.1(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(2); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.1(5)(a)(b)
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 
 a. In a consumer credit sale, Wells Fargo must disclose the amount and identity of each item, fee or charge that is included in the cash price and the amount deferred under the transaction. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:969.18(F). IL has the most restrictive rules if interest is contracted for or received. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 205/4a(f), (g)
 
 b. If Wells Fargo decides to charge and collect a fee in connection with a contract to cancel all of the debtor's liability for non-delinquent amounts that exceed the value received by the creditor or its assignee for the collateral securing the obligation, or the remaining liability in the event of the loss of life, health, or income of the debtor, or in case of an accident, the fee must be, the fee is disclosed in writing and the term of the agreement must equal to the term of the loan or credit transaction. (WV) W. Va. Code R. ¬ß 106-11-6(6.1)
 
 c. If Wells Fargo decides to impose a finance charge on a transaction covered by the Truth in Lending Act, Wells Fargo must give notice to the debtor by providing the debtor all disclosures required by the Act at the time or times required by the Act. If Wells Fargo decides to impose a finance charge on a transaction that is not covered by the Truth in Lending Act, the requirements of notice are more onerous. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 535.11(2)(a); Iowa Code ¬ß 535.11(2)
 
 d. For loans made primarily for an agricultural purpose, Wells Fargo cannot charge, collect or receive any finance charge or fee unless the charge or fee is clearly disclosed in writing to the customer and that is agreed to by Wells Fargo and the customer. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.210(1) and (2)
 
 e. If a change in the annual percentage rates or related fees change, Wells Fargo must mail or deliver written notice of the change to each consumer who may be affected. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-7(c)(2)(B)
 
 f. Before a customer can open an account under an open-end consumer credit plan, Wells Fargo must disclose: conditions and means of imposing a finance charge, and, if the credit is secured, a statement that a security interest has been or will be taken in the collateral. In addition to these disclosures, MA requires disclosing any annual fee and annual percentage rate, but does not require a security interest statement. OK‚Äôs requirements are more restrictive as to form, and requires disclosure of a good faith estimate and a statement that the customer is entitled to receive a good faith itemization of such fees or a statement itemizing such fees. (MA, OK) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 11(a); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 15A; Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(4)(G); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(4)(H)
 
 g. In all non-open-end credit plans, Wells Fargo must disclose: the "amount financed", using that term, which shall be the amount of credit of which the consumer has an actual use the "finance charge", not itemized, using that term; the finance charge expressed as an "annual percentage rate", using that term; the sum of the amount financed and the finance charge, which shall be termed the "total of payments"; the number, amount, and due dates or period of payments scheduled to repay the total of payments; descriptive explanations of the terms "amount financed", "finance charge", "annual percentage rate" and "total of payments"; where the credit is secured, a statement that a security interest has been taken in (i) the property which is purchased as part of the credit transaction, or (ii) property not purchased as part of the credit transaction identified by item or type; any dollar charge or percentage amount which may be imposed solely on account of a late payment, other than a deferral or extension charge; a statement indicating whether or not the debtor is entitled to a rebate of any finance charge upon refinancing or prepayment in full pursuant to acceleration or otherwise, if the obligation involves a precomputed finance charge; and a statement indicating whether or not a penalty will be imposed in those same circumstances if the obligation involves a finance charge computed from time to time by application of a rate to the unpaid principal balance. (MA, OK) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 12(a)(1)-(13)and(b); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-306(2)(c-j); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-306(2)(b)(i)
 
 i. MA and OK have some variance in their requirements in this regard. MA requires Wells Fargo to disclose: Wells Fargo is the creditor; in a sale of property or services in which Wells Fargo is the seller, disclose the "total sale price", using that term, which is the total of the cash price of the property or services, additional charges, and the finance charge; any dollar charge or percentage amount which may be imposed by a creditor solely on account of a late payment, other than a deferral or extension charge; and, in a residential mortgage transaction, a statement indicating whether a subsequent purchaser or assignee of the consumer may assume the debt obligation on its original terms and conditions. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 140D, ¬ß 12(a)(1)-(13)and(b)
 
 ii. OK has requirements regarding how the ‚Äúamount financed‚Äù is to be calculated, but the amount financed is not required to be disclosed if the finance amount does not exceed $75 and the finance charge does not exceed $5, or if the amount financed exceeds $75 and the finance charge is less than $7.50. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-306(2)(b)(i); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-306(2)(c-j)
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 a. Wells Fargo must deliver to the homeowner a final itemized disclosure of the actual fees, points, interest, costs, and charges that will be charged at closing. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 153.13(3)

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Credit Transactions
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Contracts - Contract Terms, Notices, and Acknowledgments - Other prohibited or restricted provisions - Credit Transactions
 
 MCR 1066
 
 Covered States: AL, AZ, CA, DC, ID, IL, IN, KS, MD, ME, NC, NH, NJ, NY, OK, OR, PA, RI, TN, VA, VT, WI
 
 When offering the products listed below, Wells Fargo must comply with state-specific prohibitions on certain payment structures, contractual terms, and other requirements and conditions. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans;
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards;
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans;
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards;
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines;
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate;
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines;
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC;
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer ‚Äì Products;
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products; and
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 12. Insurance Products
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: None 
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. All lending products.
 
 a. In loan or credit agreements, Wells Fargo must not include terms requiring a final payment more than double the amount of a regularly scheduled payment. (PA) 7 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 303(m).
 
 b. Wells Fargo must not pay a finder‚Äôs fee where the loan application is unconsummated, where the fee is based on the principal loan amount, or where the fee exceeds the total of the origination fee and the interest charges on the loan. Wells Fargo must not pass on the costs of any finder‚Äôs fee onto the borrower. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22374(a)-(c).
 
 c. Wells Fargo must not incorporate damages as a penalty for any default or forfeiture, unless provided by statute. (DC) D.C. Code ¬ß 26-909.
 
 d. Wells Fargo must not attempt to enforce a loan agreement unless the borrower fails to make a payment, fails to maintain contractually required insurance coverage, or if there is some other significant endangerment or impairment of payment, performance, or realization. (NC) N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 53-180(b).
 
 e. Wells Fargo must not enter agreements providing for interest rates higher than the maximum amount allowed under the law. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 205/4(1).
 
 f. In a credit transaction, Wells Fargo must not allow a buyer to agree to pay a charge to rescind or avoid the agreement. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b).
 
 g. In credit agreements, Wells Fargo must not require a waiver of claims or rights of action under applicable or other relief from liability or authorize unlawful premises access or breach of the peace for repossession. (PA, VA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-2215(7).
 
 h. In any agreement, Wells Fargo must not obtain power of attorney or authority to confess judgment from the borrower. (PA, VA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-2215(7).
 
 i. Wells Fargo must not require:
 
 i. an assignment of wages in a credit agreement. (MD, PA, RI) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-1023(b)(1),(2); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-5(e); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-5(e). 
 
 ii. an assignment or ordered payment of salaries, wages, commissions, or other compensation for services. (RI) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-5(e); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-5(e).
 
 j. Wells Fargo must not require legal proceedings or arbitration disputes:
 
 i. to take place in foreign countries or states. (NC, VA) N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 22B-3; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-2215(7). 
 
 ii. to take place in any county besides where the buyer signed the agreement, where the buyer resided at the time of the agreement or legal action, or where the goods were affixed to real property. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b).
 
 k. Wells Fargo must not require acceleration in specific circumstances:
 
 i. In a loan document, Wells Fargo must not require acceleration of the unpaid balance based on the holder‚Äôs deemed insecurity. (RI) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-5(a); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-5(a). 
 
 ii. Wells Fargo must not accelerate maturity for any reason other than default. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6305(b).
 
 l. In a loan document, Wells Fargo must not require more than one installment payment during an installment period. (RI) R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-5(d); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-5(d).
 
 m. In any credit transaction, Wells Fargo must not unilaterally change the terms of the credit plan without adhering to certain statutory requirements. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.415(3) and (4). 
 
 n. When making any note, promise to pay, or security agreement, Wells Fargo must accurately disclose the amount of the loan, the time of the payment agreement, and the agreed rate of interest. Wells Fargo must also not include any blank spaces to be filled in after execution of any note, promise to pay, or security. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 8, ¬ß 2229.
 
 o. For revolving loan accounts, Wells Fargo must not require fees or charges for non-use, penalties, increased annual fees, or any similar or additional charges because the accountholder pays the account balance in full. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-202(4).
 
 p. Wells Fargo must not include assignment or orders for wages, earned or future, in revolving credit agreements. (MD) Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 12-923(b)(1)-(2).
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 
 a. In a consumer credit transaction, Wells Fargo must not provide for any charges as a result of a consumer‚Äôs default, besides those provided by statute. (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß¬ß 3-402(1), (3).
 
 b. For consumer credit sales and direct installment loans besides revolving credit accounts, Wells Fargo must not create a payment schedule unless the payment amounts are substantially equal. (DC) D.C. Code ¬ß 28-3803(1).
 
 c. In a consumer credit transaction, Wells Fargo must allow consumers to refinance any payment without penalty when the payment is more than twice as large as the average of earlier scheduled payments. (KS) Kan. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 16a-3-308.
 
 d. In any consumer transaction, Wells Fargo must not arrange for assignment of the customer‚Äôs earnings as payment or security for payment, unless the assignment is revocable at will by the customer. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.404(1).
 
 e. In consumer credit transactions, Wells Fargo must not pursue the recovery of anything beyond reasonable expenses resulting from a default besides those provided by statute (ID, OK). Idaho Code ¬ß 28-45-301; Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-414.
 
 f. Wells Fargo must not go beyond the statutorily provided parameters when entering open-end loan plans and receiving interest or consideration. (OR) Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 725.345(2).
 
 g. In an open-ended credit transaction, Wells Fargo must not make changes adverse to the customer‚Äôs interest with respect to outstanding balances or that alters a charge permitted by statute. A change is presumed to be adverse if the result increases the finance charge or the amount of the periodic payment due. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.415(1).
 
 h. When entering a title pledge agreement, Wells Fargo must not commit any of the eighteen statutorily prohibited actions regarding the terms and formation of such agreements. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-15-115.
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans, Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans, Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines, Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate, Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines, & Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 
 a. In closed-end loan agreements, Wells Fargo must not include acceleration clauses triggered by declared insecurity, waivers of criminal rights of actions or defenses under the agreement, or power of attorney provisions, including to confess judgment. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:3B-23.
 
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 a. Besides a 15-year call option, Wells Fargo must not include contractual provisions that accelerate payment of a consumer revolving or home equity loan for any reason other than the consumer‚Äôs default. (AZ) Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 6-637(D).
 
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans and Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 a. When issuing motor vehicle loans, Wells Fargo must not include acceleration provisions that prevent the buyer‚Äôs right of redemption. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Oblig. Law ¬ß 7-401(1).
 
 b. Wells Fargo must not include clauses permitting continued interest payments after motor vehicle repossession. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 399-A:15(VIII).
 
 c. In motor vehicle title loan agreements, Wells Fargo must not be treated as an agent of the borrower other than for the purposes of releasing or filing a lien with the state where the vehicle is registered. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-2215(8).
 
 d. Wells Fargo must not include acceleration clauses for the entire balance unless ten or more days after the payment was due, borrower is provided with written notice of the loan‚Äôs termination, and only prorated interest is collected, running until the earlier of the vehicle‚Äôs repossession or the loan‚Äôs termination. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-2215(19).
 
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 a. For installment loan contracts, Wells Fargo must require payment of the cash advance and charges in installments payable at approximately equal periodic intervals, except for borrowers with seasonal incomes. Wells Fargo must also not structure any installment payment to be substantially larger than any previous installment payment. Likewise, Wells Fargo must not offer installment loans in which the borrower agrees to make scheduled repayment of the cash advance more than 25 months after the contract date. (AL) Ala. Code ¬ß 5-18-15(i).
 
 b. Wells Fargo must not provide charges as a result of a default of a small loan agreement other than those provided by statute. Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-7-406(1).
 
 c. Wells Fargo must not make small loans if either the total of the small loan‚Äôs principal amount and finance charges or the total amount of other small loan balances outstanding with all lenders exceed 20% of the borrower‚Äôs monthly gross income. (IN) Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-7-402(1).
 
 d. In small loan agreements, Wells Fargo must not include hold harmless clauses, confession of judgment clauses, assignments or orders of payments of wages or other compensation of services, release of contractual claims or defenses, or any other waiver under the statute. Wells Fargo also must not include any waivers or limitations on exemption from attachment, execution, or other processes on the consumer‚Äôs property besides any property subject to a security interest in connection with the loan. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 399-A:15(VIII).
 
 i. Likewise, Wells Fargo must not include mandatory arbitration clauses in small loan agreements unless approved by the director of financial institutions. (IN) Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-7-410(j).
 
 e. For supervised loans of $300 or less in principal, Wells Fargo must not contract for an interest in motor vehicles as a security. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-515.
 
 f. In consolidation transactions, Wells Fargo must not provide a payment period longer than the periods provided for in the statute, beginning with the date of consolidation. However, the outstanding balances must be based on the amount of the consolidated outstanding balance. (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.206(3) and (4).
 
 7. Insurance Products
 
 a. Wells Fargo must not grant a loan conditioned on, agreed upon, or with the understanding that the borrower will contract with any specific person or entity for insurance services from an agent or broker, real estate services from an agent or broker, real estate or property management services, or legal services. Wells Fargo also must not require any of these services be placed with any of its subsidiaries, affiliates, officers, or employees. (IL) 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/48.2(a).
 
 b. Wells Fargo must not require a separate charge for insurance against liability unless the insurance it covers a substantial risk of liability arising out of the ownership or use of the property related to the credit transaction. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 4-303.

Title: PSDR - Duty to Notify of Forgeries, Alterations and Statement Errors - Financial Institution Duties
Summary:
Covered States: MI, TX, UT
 When engaged in offering of the below consumer products and services, Wells Fargo must take certain state-specific actions to correct inaccurate account statements discovered by Wells Fargo, address customer reports of error or identity theft, and provide notice in writing of the customer‚Äôs rights with regards to unauthorized account usage. 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Consumer Credit Card
 3. Checking Accounts
 4. Savings Accounts
 5. Debit Card - Check and ATM
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines, Consumer Credit Cards
 (a) Wells Fargo must, within 60 days of discovering an account error and prior to receiving written notice of the error or institution of a legal action, notify the customer of the error and make necessary adjustments to ensure that the customer will not be required to pay an amount in excess of the charge actually disclosed, or the dollar equivalent of the annual percentage rate actually disclosed, whichever is lower. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-7-206(2)
 2. Checking Accounts, Savings Accounts, Debit Card - Check and ATM
 (a) When offering accounts that are accessible through a funds transfer facility, Wells Fargo must provide a written account agreement to the customer at the time the customer is issued a card or other means of access, that contains certain disclosures, including the right of the customer to seek correction of errors within 60 days and Wells Fargo‚Äôs responsibility to respond within 10 days, and the name and address of the responsible regulator. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 488.19
 (b) Wells Fargo must process checks as forgeries if a customer who has been a victim of identity theft closes the account, notifies Wells Fargo that the identity theft is the reason for closing, provides Wells Fargo with a copy of the criminal complaint, and requests further checks be returned marked ‚Äúforgery.‚Äù (TX) Tex. Bus. & Com. Ann. ¬ß 523.051(b)

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Paper Size - 8-1/2 x 11 Paper Required
Summary:
MCR: 1020 
 
 Covered States: TX, WI
 
 Wells Fargo must use 8-1/2 x 11 paper for the certain contracts and disclosures. 
 
  1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 No generally applicable supporting citations. 
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
  1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
  (a) Wells Fargo must fit the disclosure of equity standard form on 1 standard-size, 
  8-1/2 x 11, sheet of paper. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.204(c)
 
  (b) For consumer disclosure statements, Wells Fargo must use white 8-1/2 x 11 paper 
  and Times New Roman font, size 12 or greater. (WI) Wis. Admin. Code DFI-Bkg ¬ß 44.02(2)

Title: PSDR - Retail Sales - Leases - Implied Warranties May Be Excluded by Expressions "As Is", "With All Faults", if in Writing and Conspicuous (U.C.C. ¬ß 2A-214)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 When engaged in the retail sale, lease, or other offering of products and services, in order to exclude providing implied warranties, Wells Fargo must provide in writing, in a clear and conspicuous form, that the goods or services are being sold ‚Äúas is‚Äù or ‚Äúwith all faults‚Äù or using other language that makes plain there is no implied warranty. 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.12.214(c); Ala. Code ¬ß 7-2A-214(3); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-2A-214(3); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-2A214(C); Cal. Com. Code ¬ß 10214(c); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 4-2.5-214(3); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42a-2A-506(c)‚Äì(e), (g); D.C. Code ¬ß 28:2A-214(c); Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 2A-214(3); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 680.214(3); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 11-2A-214(3); Haw. Rev.
