Ann. ¬ß 355.2A-214(3); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 106, ¬ß 2A-214(3); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 2A-214(3); Me. Stat. tit. 11, ¬ß 2-1214(3); Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß 440.2864(3); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 336.2A-214(3); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 400.2A-214(3); Mont. Code Ann. ¬ß 30-2A-214(3)(a)-(c); N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 25-2A-214(3); N.D. Cent. Code ¬ß 41-02.1-23(3); Neb. Rev. Stat. UCC ¬ß 2A-214(3); N.H. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 382-A:2A-214(3); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 12A:2A-214(3); N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 55-2A-214(3); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 104A.2214(3)(a)-(b); N.Y. U.C.C. Law ¬ß 2-A-214(3); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1310.21(C); Okla. Stat. tit. 12A, ¬ß 2A-214(3); Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 72A.2140(3); 13 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 2A214(c); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 6A-2.1-214(3); S.C. Code Ann. ¬ß 36-2A-214(3); S.D. Codified Laws ¬ß 57A-2A-214(3); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-2A-214(3); Tex. Bus. & Com. Code Ann. ¬ß 2A.214(c); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70A-2a-214(3); Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 8.2A-214(3)(a),(b); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9A, ¬ß 2A-214(3); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 62A.2A-214(3); Wis. Stat. ¬ß 411.214(3); W. Va. Code ¬ß 46-2A-214(3); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 34.1-2.A-214(c)
 No state-specific requirements.

Title: PSDR ‚Äì Contracts and Disclosures ‚Äì Form and Style ‚Äì Typesize, Font and Color ‚Äì 10-point Typesize
Summary:
Covered States: CA, GA, IA, MA, NC, TN, TX, VA
 When engaged in the provision of written documentation concerning certain consumer lending, real estate transactions, and insurance policies, Wells Fargo must format certain state-specific disclosures, notices, and other information in a particular typesize and style.
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 2. Consumer Other Loans/Lines (Leases and Loans)
 3. Insurance Products
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10241(h)
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 (a) When providing a subordination agreements, Wells Fargo must format the title ‚ÄúSUBORDINATION AGREEMENT‚Äù in at least 10-point, bold typeface, and include requisite statutory language regarding potential modification of lien priority in at least 8-point, bold typeface. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 2953.3(a), (b) When providing written contracts affecting agricultural land, or dwellings, buildings, or other appurtenances located on the land, Wells Fargo must provide certain Homestead exemption waivers in at least 10-point, bold typeface, which must be signed and dated by the individual waiving the exemption. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 561.22(1)(A)
 2. Consumer Other Loans/Lines (Leases and Loans) 
 (a) When providing any written material concerning eligibility to win or receive a prize, gift or item of value where disclosures are set forth in their own separate section, in connection with the sale or lease, or solicitation for sale or lease, of goods, property, or services, Wells Fargo must format the title ‚ÄúConsumer Disclosure‚Äù in at least 10-point, bold typeface. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 59.1-417(A)
 (b) When providing any contract for a consumer loan that is not subject to the federal Truth in Lending Act, Wells Fargo must disclose any prohibition or penalty on prepayment in at least 10-point, bold typeface. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 47-14-108(b)
 (c) When providing an unsolicited check to secure a loan, Wells Fargo must include certain statements in at least 10-point, bold typeface and 6-point typeface. (NC) N.C. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 75-20(a)(1) 
 (d) When providing motor vehicle installment contracts, Wells Fargo must provide a disclosure of equity in Times New Roman font and at least 10-point, bold typeface. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 84.204(f)
 (e) When providing a notice of adverse action because certain credit or employment is denied, or certain charges for credit or insurance are increased, Wells Fargo must format the notice and required disclosures in at least 10-point typeface. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 93, ¬ß 62(a) 
 (f) When providing any written material concerning eligibility to win or receive a prize, gift or item of value where disclosures are set forth in their own separate section, in connection with the sale or lease, or solicitation for sale or lease, of goods, property, or services, Wells Fargo must format the title ‚ÄúConsumer Disclosure‚Äù in at least 10-point, bold typeface. (VA) Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 59.1-417(A)
 3. Insurance Products
 (a) When issuing an individual policy, notice of proposed insurance, or group certificate of credit life insurance and credit accident and sickness insurance, Wells Fargo must make certain required disclosures in at least 10-point typeface. (GA) Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 33-31-9(c.1) 
 (b) When providing a notice of adverse action because certain insurance is denied, or certain charges for credit or insurance are increased, Wells Fargo must format the notice and required disclosures in at least 10-point typeface. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 93, ¬ß 62(a)

Title: PSDR - Contracts and Disclosures - Form and Style - Typesize, Font and Color - 12-point Typesize
Summary:
Covered States: CA, TN, VA
 
 Wells Fargo must use 12-point type for certain borrowers‚Äô disclosures and notices. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; and
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 
  State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 
 (a) At the time of application, Wells Fargo must provide the certain information on the interest of the loan, in writing with no smaller than 12-point font. (CA) Ca. Fin. Code ¬ß 22370(a)(3)
 
 (b) If the disclosures are provided in a mobile or electronic application, Wells Fargo must either give the borrower the option to print the disclosure in 12-point font, or provide a hardcopy in 12-point font. (CA) Ca. Fin. Code ¬ß 22370(a)(4)
 
 (c) When giving a borrower the option of making payments on a consumer finance 
 loan through payroll deductions, Wells Fargo must give the borrower a Payroll 
 Deduction Disclosure Form. The form must be a separate, single document with 
 at least 12-point font. (VA) 10 Va. Admin. Code ¬ß 5-60-30(D)
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 
 (a) For a high-cost home loan, Wells Fargo must provide certain notices to borrower in at least 12 point bold type. (TN) Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(16)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - High Cost, High Risk, Higher Priced, and Covered Loans
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Early Disclosures - High Cost, High Risk, Higher Priced, and Covered Loans
 
 MCR 1086
 
 Covered States: CA, MA, MD, ME, NV, OH, OK, UT 
 When engaged in non-traditional mortgages, Wells Fargo must conspicuously disclose to the borrower adequate information concerning the actual costs and risks of the nontraditional loan product offered, including associated payment structures, optional premiums, fees, and penalties. 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 209 Mass. Code Regs. 42.12A(1); Me. Code R. ¬ß 02-030-550(5)(3); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(A),(C). 
 
 Additional State Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 a. If a loan includes a prepayment fee or penalty in the first 36 months, Wells Fargo must disclose, in writing to the borrower, any prepayment penalties and associated points and fees. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(a)(2)(B)
 
 b. If a loan contains a negative amortization provision, Wells Fargo must disclose to the consumer that the amortization provision may add principal to the balance of the loan, and provide an explanation of circumstances under which structural payment changes may occur. (CA, NV, OH) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(c); Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 658.200(2); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(B).
 
 c. When offering a higher-priced mortgage, Wells Fargo must disclose to the borrower information concerning available non-higher-priced mortgage loans. (MD) Md. Code Regs. 09.03.06.20(A)(2).
 
 d. Wells Fargo must provide the borrower with a reasonable, tangible net benefit analysis, with an explanation identifying the factors considered. (ME) Me. Code R. ¬ß 02-030-550(5)(6). 
 
 e. Wells Fargo must make all changes to disclosures in writing and not by telephone, unless the change is initiated by the consumer and it is certified in writing not less than three days prior to the date of consummation of the transaction. (OH, OK, UT) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(D)(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(2); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 61-2d-105(3)-(4).
 
 f. Wells Fargo must provide mandatory disclosures at least three (3) days prior to consummation of the transaction. (CA, OH, OK) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(a)(2)(B); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1349.26(D)(1); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(2)
 
 g. Wells Fargo must ensure that all disclosures comply with statutory formatting requirements identifying font size and statutorily required language:
  i. 12 -point font or larger. (CA) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 4973(k)
  ii. 10-point font or larger. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 658.200(1)(2)
  iii. Mandatory disclosure language. (OK) Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 3-309.4(1)

Title: PSDR - Commitment and Rate-lock Agreements - Disclosures
Summary:
Covered States: FL, GA, MA, MN, NJ, NM, NY, WA, VT, WY
 
 In its Commitment and Rate Lock Agreements, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures to its customers within specific timeframes when engaged in: 
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate. 
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 Fla. Stat. ¬ß 494.007(1); (2); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 7-1-1014(2); 209 Mass. Code Regs. 42.11A(4); Minn. Stat. ¬ß 47.206(2); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.5(a), (c); N.M. Code R. ¬ß 12.19.8.12(A); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.4(a)(3); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(c), (e), (f); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(9); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.146.030(3); Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-23-115(a)
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. New York
 a. NY has the most restrictive requirements, and compliance with NY law will ensure compliance with other applicable state law, except as noted below. (NY) N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(c); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 9-o(2); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.4(a); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.4(c)(2),(3); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.4(c)(6); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.4(d); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.5(b)(1); N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 38.6(b)(4). 
 2. New Mexico
 a. Wells Fargo must provide a revised "good faith estimate" and a copy of the borrower's lock-in agreement to the borrower within three days of locking in the loan rate, pricing and terms. (NM) N.M. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 58-21-31(B).
 3. Vermont
 a. Commitment agreements must be delivered at least three business days prior to the closing, unless certain circumstances are present (including hardship to the borrower). (VT) 21-010-010 Vt. Code R. ¬ß 5.

Title: PSDR - Contracts - Required Terms and Provisions - Credit Sales and/or Leases
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR ‚Äì Contracts ‚Äì Required Terms and Provisions ‚Äì Credit Sales and/or Leases
 
 MCR 1074
 
 Covered States: CA, CO, GA, HI, IL, IN, LA, MA, NY, PA, WV, WY
 
 When engaged in a revolving account or consumer credit sale, Wells Fargo must reduce the agreement to a writing, signed by the consumer and including: the name, address and telephone number of the seller, the description of the goods, services or security interest, and cost. The instrument must also include a notice that buyer should not sign if there are any blank spaces and information regarding the buyer‚Äôs right to cancellation. When the initial solicitation was made over the telephone, the contract‚Äôs description of goods or services must be the same as the description used in the telephone solicitation, be in bold, and immediately precede the signature. Wells Fargo must include the following statement: ‚ÄúYou are not obligated to pay any money unless you sign this contract and return it to the seller.‚Äù The contract and all required inclusions must be in at least 12-point font.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products; and
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally applicable supporting citations: 
 
 Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-107; Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 17511.5(2); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 10-1-4(a); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-3(a); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 476-3(e); Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 160.40(d); Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 160.40(b); Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 160.230(k); Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.5-2-502; Ind. Code ¬ß 24-4.7-4-4(c); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255D, ¬ß 27(A); Md. Code Ann., Com. Law ¬ß 14-2203(a) and (b); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 413(1)(b); N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 369-ee(3)(a); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6332(c); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. ¬ß 6332(d); W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-2-107(4)
 
 
 Additional State-Specific Requirements:
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines; Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 
 a. When Wells Fargo is a seller that seeks to make any changes to the agreement, Wells Fargo must give the buyer notice at least 3 times, with the first notice occurring at least 6 months before the effective date of the change. Notice for any proposed change must be given to the customer at least 30 days prior to effective date of such change or 30 days prior to the beginning of the billing cycle during which the change would become effective ‚Äì whichever is earlier when certain requirements are met. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-250(b)-(d)
 
 b. Wells Fargo must include a cancellation notice in 10-point bold font when entering a sale or lease as a result of a prize scheme. (NY) N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 369-ee(3)(a-1); N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law ¬ß 369-ee(3)(a)
 
 
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 
 a. When the secured property is a motor vehicle and the written agreement does not provide automobile liability insurance, Wells Fargo must include the following clause in bold: "THIS CONTRACT DOES NOT PROVIDE FOR AUTOMOBILE LIABILITY INSURANCE, AND SAID BUYER ALSO STATES THAT HE OR SHE HAS/DOES NOT HAVE (strike words not applicable) IN EFFECT AN AUTOMOBILE LIABILITY POLICY AS DEFINED IN SECTION 42-7-103 (2), COLORADO REVISED STATUTES, ON THE MOTOR VEHICLE SOLD BY THIS CONTRACT." (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-107
 
 b. When Wells Fargo contracts for a security interest, the rate set by Wells Fargo for the finance charge must not exceed the permitted amount when the balances so secured were consolidated pursuant to the provisions on consolidation. (CO) Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-3-202(1) and (2)
 
 
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 
 a. When Wells Fargo seeks to have a non-consumer credit sale be subject to the laws applying to consumer credit sales, Wells Fargo must provide so in writing. (WY) Wyo. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 40-14-256
 
 b. When a licensee owns a substantial interest in Wells Fargo and that licensee is purchases a product from Wells Fargo, the document must clearly reflect the relationship in the following prescribed language, in at least 8 points bold type: ‚ÄúThe retail buyer hereunder has been informed by the retail seller that his contract will be sold and assigned by the retail seller to, (a licensed Sales Finance Agency) and that the said Sales Finance Agency has a substantial interest in the business of the retail seller and that pursuant to law the retail buyer may assert all defenses equally against the retail seller and said, Sales Finance Agency.‚Äù (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38, ¬ß 160.230(k) 
 
 
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) ‚Äì Consumer Credit Cards
 
 a. When Wells Fargo is transferring a written obligation arising out of a consumer credit sale, the obligation must be transferred or assigned to a supervised financial organization within 35 days from the date of the contract. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3521(A), (B)

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Insurance Disclosures - Termination or Cancellation of Policy
Summary:
Covered States: AL, AR, CO, CN, DE, IA, IN, LA, MO, OH, PA, RI, TN, WI, WV
 
 In connection with credit insurance, Wells Fargo policies must include provisions that inform the insured of their rights of cancellation and provide the insured with written notice of policy cancellations when an agreement is made. 
 
 1. Insurance products
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Credit Cards
 4. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Commercial Real Estate Loans
 5. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Credit Cards
 6. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 7. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 8. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 9. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
 10. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Retail Broker Dealer - Products
 11. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Structured Products
 12. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Trade Finance
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 Ala. Admin. Code r. 482-1-117-.08(4)-(5); 054-00-012 Ark. Code R. ¬ß 3(3.7); 4 Colo. Code Regs. 902-1, Rule 8(c); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-4-304; Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-559(b); 5-900-903 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 2.2.1; Iowa Admin. Code r. 191-28.33(5)(b); 760 Ind. Admin. Code 1-5.1-3(c)(2); La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:969.54(4), (6) and (7); Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 385.070(6)(f); Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1321.672(B); 10 Pa. Code ¬ß 41.3(j); 31 Pa. Code ¬ß 73.127(e)-(f); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.1-3; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-3; Tenn. Comp. R. & Regs. 0780-1-4-.04(7); Wis. Admin. Code Ins ¬ß 3.25(7)(i)-(j); W. Va. Code ¬ß 46A-3-109(b)(6)(A),(B).
 
 Inapplicable Citations: Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-5-305(b)(2)
 
 Additional State- Specific Restrictive Requirements: 
 
 1. Insurer/Creditor Cancellations
 a. When cancelling a credit insurance policy, Wells Fargo must provide written notice to the insured borrower at least 30 days prior to the effective date of termination. (CO, IA, IN) 4 Colo. Code Regs. 902-1, Rule 8(c); Iowa Admin. Code r. 191-28.33(5)(b); 760 Ind. Admin. Code 1-5.1-3(c)(2). 
 b. When cancelling a credit insurance policy, Wells Fargo must provide written notice to the insured borrower at least 31 days prior to the effective date of termination. (AR, TN) 054-00-012 Ark. Code R. ¬ß 3(3.7); Tenn. Comp. R. & Regs. 0780-1-4-.04(7)
 c. Wells Fargo cannot request cancellation of a policy except after default or in accordance with written authorization by the consumer, and the cancellation is not effective until written notice is given to the consumer at their address given to Wells Fargo. (CO, CT). Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 5-4-304(b)(c); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-559(b)
 d. Wells Fargo cannot terminate a policy due to a delinquent payment unless one or more payments is past due for ninety days or more, and Wells Fargo advances to the insurer the amounts required to keep the insurance in force during such period (CT). Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-559(c)
 
 2. Borrower/Insured Cancellations
 a. Wells Fargo must provide a refund or credit of premium to any borrower who cancels a credit insurance policy within 30 days of receipt of the policy. (AL, RI) Ala. Admin. Code r. 482-1-117-.08(4); R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-14.2-3 
 b. Wells Fargo must provide a refund or credit of premium to any borrower who cancels a credit insurance policy within 25 days of receipt of the policy. (OH) Ohio Rev. Code Ann. ¬ß 1321.672(B) 
 c. Wells Fargo must provide a refund or credit of premium to any borrower who cancels a credit insurance policy within 15 days of receipt of the policy. (MO) Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 385.070(6)(f)
 d. Wells Fargo must provide a refund or credit of premium to any borrower who cancels a credit insurance policy within 10 days of receipt of the policy. (WI) Wis. Admin. Code Ins ¬ß 3.25(7)(i)-(j) 
 
 3. Debt Waiver or Debt Forgiveness Agreements 
 a. Wells Fargo must disclose whether any waivers or forgiveness for any insurance will be applied and whether any exclusions apply (LA). La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:969.54(4); La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 6:969.54(3)
 
 4. Form of Notice/Disclosure
 a. Wells Fargo must use 10-point font or larger to inform a borrower of their right of cancellation. (MO) Mo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 385.070(6)(f)

Title: PSDR - Retail Sales - Leases - Exclusion, Modification of Warranty of Fitness Must Be In Writing, Conspicuous (U.C.C. ¬ß2A-214)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 
 When providing consumer or commercial leases and seeking to exclude or modify any warranty of fitness in any contract, Wells Fargo must use specific language that is conspicuous and in writing.
 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 2. Non-Consumer Loans/Lines
 
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Alaska Stat. ¬ß 45.12.214(b),(c); Ala. Code ¬ß 7-2A-214(2),(3); Ark. Code Ann. ¬ß 4-2A-214(2),(3); Ariz. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 47-2A214(B),(C); Cal. Com. Code ¬ß 10214(b),(c); Colo. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 4-2.5-214(2),(3); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 42a-2A-506(b),(e),(g); D.C. Code ¬ß 28:2A-214(b),(c); Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ¬ß 2A-214(2),(3); Fla. Stat. ¬ß 680.214(2),(3); Ga. Code Ann. ¬ß 11-2A-214(2),(3); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 490:2A-214(b),(c); Iowa Code ¬ß 554.13214(2),(3); Idaho Code ¬ß 28-12-214(2),(3); 810 Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/2A-214(2),(3); Ind. Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Timing - Application and Processing
Summary:
Covered States: CA, CO, DC, DE, HI, IA, ID, ME, MT, NJ, NM, NY, OK, OR, TN, TX, VT, WA, WI
 When soliciting or engaging in certain consumer lending, consumer credit transactions, and real estate transactions, Wells Fargo must provide state-specific disclosures, notices, and copies of documents within certain, state-specific timeframes.
 1. Consumer Credit Cards 
 2. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 3. Consumer Real Estate 
 4. Commercial Real Estate 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Credit Cards 
 (a) When entering into a contract for the extension of credit, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures within a specified timeframe, the earliest of which is at the time Wells Fargo solicits purchase of the contract (MT) Mont. Admin. R. 2.59.118(2); 
 (b) When operating variable rate, open-end accounts, Wells Fargo must provide certain statutory disclosures prior to the date of the first transaction on a new account, or, at least 30 days prior to the effective date of any variable rate amendment (NY) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 90.3 
 (c) When entering into a consumer credit agreement, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures before the agreement is entered into, or before any money is paid by a consumer, whichever occurs first (ME) Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 10-303
 (d) When offering credit insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures and copies of documents to the principal debtor at the time the insurance is applied for (ID) Idaho Admin. Code r. 18.01.61.023
 (e) When engaging in the extension of credit, Wells Fargo must provide refinancing disclosures within three business days of submission of the loan application and at least 12 days before the refinancing closes (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code ¬ß 153.45(4)(C), (D)
 2. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 (a) When entering into a consumer loan agreement, Wells Fargo must enter into a separate, signed, written agreement with applicant, independent of the loan agreement, governing terms of licensee compensation, and provide a copy of the agreement at the time the agreement is signed (DE) 5-2100-2104 Del. Admin. Code ¬ß 1.0;
 (b) When entering into a refund anticipation loan, Wells Fargo must provide certain specified disclosure on a form signed by the customer prior to entry into the agreement (WI) Wis. Stat. ¬ß 422.310(1)
 3. Consumer Real Estate, Commercial Real Estate Loans 
 (a) When entering into a mortgage loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide certain statutory disclosures and notices within a specified timeframe, the shortest of which is at the time of the loan application (CO, DC, HI, NJ, NM, NY, OK, VT, WA) 4 Colo. Code Regs. 725-3, Chapter 5(5.8); 4 Colo. Code Regs. 725-3, Chapter 5(5.22)(C); D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1152.11(a)and(b); Haw. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 667-41(a) and (c); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:15-9.2(c)(4); N.M. Code R. ¬ß 12.19.8.12(B); N.Y. Banking Law ¬ß 595-a(3)(b); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(1); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(2)(A); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(5)(B); Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-1(C); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, ¬ß 103(b); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(3). In Oklahoma, if information necessary for an accurate disclosure is unknown to Wells Fargo, it must make the disclosure based on the best information reasonably available at the time the disclosure is provided and clearly that the disclosure is an estimate (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-1(d)(2) 
 (b) When entering into a mortgage loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide any new or changed disclosures within a specified time frame, the earliest of which is either within three days of the change or three days before closing (OK, TN, WA) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-5-3(a)(2)(B); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(17)(A); Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-620-511(3); Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.144.020(1)
 (c) When entering into a mortgage loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide notice regarding financial counseling options to the borrower within a specified timeframe, the earliest of which is at the time of application. In New York, such notice must be in 12-point font (NY, TN) N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3, ¬ß 41.3(a)(1); Tenn. Code Ann. ¬ß 45-20-103(21)
 (d) When entering a mortgage loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide certain notice to the borrower no later than the time notice is required by notice provisions under the law. Such notice must be acknowledged and signed by the borrower (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 46:10B-26(f)
 (e) When entering into a loan secured directly or collaterally by a lien on real property, Wells Fargo must provide certain statutory disclosures at least three days before the commencement of the loan (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 10240(a)
 (f) When entering into an arrangement regarding a real estate loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures prior to entering into the arrangement (OR) Or. Rev. Stat. ¬ß 86.255
 (g) When entering into a mortgage loan agreement, Wells Fargo must provide notice of the right to cancel at the time the statutorily-mandated disclosures are provided (DC) D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1113(a-1)(9) 
 (h) When entering into a financing agreement, Wells Fargo must provide certain disclosures within the agreement and delivery to borrower at least 72 hours before settlement (DC) D.C. Code ¬ß 26-1113(B)(1)
 (i) When entering into a residential real estate installment contract, Wells Fargo must provide a copy of the contract at the time the signed disclosure statement is delivered to the contract purchaser and must provide a copy of the executed contract to all contract purchasers within five days of execution of the contract. (IA) Iowa Code ¬ß 558.70(2)-(7)
 (j) When entering into an open-end credit plan secured by the consumer‚Äôs dwelling, Wells Fargo must provide the disclosures and brochure statutorily required at the time an application is provided to the consumer (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-3-3(2)

Title: PSDR - Retail Sales - Leases - Exclusion, Modification of Warranty of Merchantability Must Include Term, Be In Writing, Conspicuous (U.C.C. ¬ß 2A-214)

Title: PSDR - Disclosures - Prescribed Language - Servicer Disclosures and Notices
Summary:
Covered States: CT, FL, IL, MI, MN, NY, OR, TX, UT, WV
 When providing consumer credit or servicing consumer loans, Wells Fargo must use certain state-specific language, formats, and delivery methods when providing certain written notices and disclosures
 1. Consumer Real Estate
 2. Commercial Real Estate Loans
 3. Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 4. Consumer Credit Cards
 No generally applicable supporting citations.
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 1. Consumer Real Estate, Commercial Real Estate Loans
 (a) When acting as a loan servicer, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) use language identical or substantially similar to the language set forth in the statute when assigning a mortgage, rents, or interest in a lease. (CT) Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 49-10(b)
 (ii) give notice to a borrower of a high risk home loan that his or her loan is 30 days delinquent, and use specific language set forth in the statute to advise borrower to seek consumer credit counseling. (IL) Ill. Admin. Code tit. 38 ¬ß 1050.1280(b)
 (iii) give tenants notice of foreclosure on property consisting of one to four family dwelling units, which notice must contain language identical or substantially similar to the language set forth in the statute. (MN) Minn. Stat. ¬ß 580.042(3)
 (iv) provide notice to a non-institutional investor in specified language that the mortgage broker or lender did not obtain a title insurance policy. (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 494.0043(b)(3)
 2. Consumer Other Loans/Lines, Credit Cards
 (a) When providing consumer credit, Wells Fargo must:
 (i) provide written notice of increases the rate, or the index or formula used to compute the rate for an open-end account, and must provide written notice of such change to the customer in statutorily mandated language that the customer may cancel the account. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. ¬ß 303.103(c)
 (ii) provide written notice to the customer using language identical or substantially similar to the language set forth in the statute that a negative credit report may be made upon default. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 70C-7-107(3)(c)
 (iv) provide certain disclosures on all initial communications attempting to collect on a debt. (OR) ORS ¬ß 646.639(2)(h)
 (v) provide a written disclosure with specific language and formatting concerning extended coverage for open-end credit personal property insurance, within the time period set forth in the statute. (WV) W. Va. R. ¬ß 114-61-4(4.3)
 (vi) provide an itemized appraisal and repair bill by registered mail which includes statutory language concerning the customer‚Äôs rights and obligations for dispute resolution if a charge for excess wear and damage to a vehicle is made upon termination of a retail lease agreement. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law ¬ß 343(3)(a), (b)
 (vii) notify a customer who enters into eight deferred presentment service agreements with Wells Fargo in a twelve month period that he or she is eligible for a repayment option, using specific language. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws ¬ß487.2155(3)

Title: PSDR - Retail Leases - Goods (including Motor Vehicles)
Summary:
Covered States: CA, CO, CT, DC, GA, LA, OK, PR, WA, WY
 
 Wells Fargo must disclose all information for retail leases involving goods and motor vehicles including a description of the leased property, payment details, responsibilities, rights, warranties, penalties, fees, and taxes as required by the Consumer Leasing Act.
 
 1. Consumer Other Loans/Lines (Leases and Loans)
  
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 
 D.C. Code ¬ß 28-3808(a),(b); La. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 9:3303(B),(D),(E) and (F); Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-301.1; Okla. Stat. tit. 14A, ¬ß 2-402
 
 Additional State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:

Title: PSDR - Retail Leases - Secured Party's Contract on Disposition Provides Warranties unless Waived (U.C.C. ¬ß 9-610)
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, NC, ND, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY

Title: PSDR - Retail Sales - Leases - Exclusion, Modification of Warranty against Interference, Infringement Must Be Specific, in Writing, Conspicuous (U.C.C. ¬ß 2A-214
Summary:
Covered States: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, WV, WY
 
 When excluding or modifying a lease warranty against interference or against violation or any part of it, Wells Fargo must provide written language that is specific and conspicuous, unless the circumstances, including industry rules, give a customer reason to know that the goods are being leased subject to a claim or interest of any person.

Title: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Appraisals - Copy of Appraisal and Fee Disclosure
Summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Credit Application Notices - Appraisals - Copy of Appraisal and Fee Disclosure
 
 MCR1080
 
 Covered States: CA, CT, FL, IL, MD, ME, NJ, OK, RI, UT, VA, WA, WI
 
 As a lender in certain loan transactions secured by real property, Wells Fargo must provide written notice and certain disclosures to loan applicants relating to any appraisals and any fees charged for the appraisals.
 
 1. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Asset Based Loans
 2. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Other Loans/Lines
 3. Lending Product (loans, lines and leases) - Consumer Real Estate
 Generally Applicable Supporting Citations:
 
 Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 11423(b)-(h); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-755(b); Conn. Gen. Stat. ¬ß 36a-755(c)-(d); 205 Ill. Comp. Stat. 635/5-11; Md. Code Ann., Real Prop. ¬ß 14-104.1; Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 3-313; Me. Stat. tit. 9-A, ¬ß 9-309; R.I. Gen. Laws ¬ß 19-9-3; Va. Code Ann. ¬ß 6.2-407; Wash. Rev. Code ¬ß 19.149.020; Wis. Stat. ¬ß 224.75(3)(b)
 
 State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
 1. Mandatory Appraisal 
 
 (a) When originating a consumer loan, prior to any payment by the consumer, Wells Fargo must provide a valuation opinion along with certain relationship disclosures unless the consumer has waived such opinion in writing. (FL) Fla. Stat. ¬ß 494.0043(1)(a)
 
 2. Residential Mortgage Loans
 
 (a) When providing a loan secured by residential real property, Wells Fargo must provide notice of the applicant's right to receive a copy of the appraisal in at least 10-point boldface type, as a separate document for the applicant to retain, and no later than 15 days after Wells Fargo receives the written application. (CA) Cal. Bus. & Prof. Code ¬ß 11423(d)
 
 (b) When providing residential mortgage loans secured by a first lien on a dwelling, Wells Fargo must provide the prospective borrower with a copy of each appraisal and any other written valuation of the property as soon as reasonably possible or 3 business days before the day of settlement, unless the 3-day timeline is waived by the borrower. (UT) Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 61-2c-301(1)(n); Utah Code Ann. ¬ß 61-2c-301(5)
 
 (c) When engaging as a mortgage broker, Wells Fargo must disclose in writing that if the borrower is unable obtain a loan for any reason Wells Fargo must give copies of any appraisal to the borrower, and transmit the appraisal to any other mortgage broker or lender to whom the borrower directs the documents to be sent within 5 days of a written request by the borrower. (WA) Wash. Admin. Code ¬ß 208-660-430(3)(h)
 
 3. Appraisal Fee Amounts and Limitations on Appraisal Fees
 
 (a) When acting as a residential mortgage broker or a residential mortgage lender, Wells Fargo must not charge a borrower twice for an appraisal fee in connection with the same mortgage loan application unless there is good cause, such as where Wells Fargo has obtained new or additional information regarding the value of the appraised property or more than one year has elapsed since the date of the last appraisal. (CA, NJ) Cal. Fin. Code ¬ß 22317.2(a); N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.2(a)(3)
 
 (b) Before accepting any application fee, credit report fee, appraisal fee, or any third party reimbursement fees by a consumer in connection with a consumer loan, Wells Fargo must disclose in writing to the consumer certain descriptions, disclosures, terms estimates, and contact information. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.3(a)
 
 (c) When updating the borrower‚Äôs credit report and appraisal, Wells Fargo must not charge the borrower an amount that exceeds the actual amount of the fee paid or incurred by Wells Fargo. (NJ) N.J. Admin. Code ¬ß 3:1-16.2(a)(7)
 
 (d) When engaging in a mortgage loan transaction as a lender or a broker, Wells Fargo must not seek reimbursement from the consumer for fees imposed by third parties except for an appraisal fee, credit report fee, and such other permitted third party charges as expressly determined by a commissioner. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-74(a)(7); N.J. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 17:11C-74(b)(3)
 
 4. Material Misrepresentations in Appraisal Reports 
 
 (a) In connection with a consumer credit transaction secured by a consumer‚Äôs dwelling, Wells Fargo must not extend credit based on an appraisal that Wells Fargo knows to contain misstatements or misrepresentations of value based on improper coercion or influence by the creditor or mortgage broker, unless Wells Fargo documents that it has acted with reasonable diligence that the appraisal does not materially misstate or misrepresent the value of such dwelling. (OK) Okla. Admin. Code ¬ß 160:45-9-6(b)(2)
